subsection.leadIn: The day specified for subsection (13) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Saturday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a public holiday; (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined by section 71(2) of Cap. 1; or (Added 1 of 2015 s. 4. Amended 40 of 2021 s. 13)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a day on which the electronic MPF system (or any part of it) is suspended under section 19J or 19L(1)(a) or (b). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 13)

editorialNote.content: For transitional provision relating to the amendments made by the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (1 of 2015), see Part 8 of the Amendment Ordinance.

section.name: s7AB
section.heading: Contributions paid under section 7AA be accompanied by statement

subsection.content: When paying contributions to the Authority under section 7AA, an employer must ensure that the contributions are accompanied by a statement, in a form specified or approved by the Authority, for the contribution period or periods to which the contributions relate.

subsection.leadIn: The statement must include the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and business registration number of the employer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the address and telephone number of the employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of the contact person of the employer and the means by which the person can be contacted;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registered scheme nominated by the employer to which the contributions are to be paid;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the name of the relevant employee and his Hong Kong Identity Card number or, if he is not the holder of a Hong Kong Identity Card, the number and issuing agency of any passport held by him;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the contribution period or periods to which the contributions relate;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the amount of relevant income of the relevant employee for the contribution period or periods;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the amount of contributions paid under section 7AA(2)(a) or (3)(a) by the employer in respect of the relevant employee for the contribution period or periods;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the amount of contributions deducted from the relevant income of the relevant employee under section 7AA(2)(b) or (3)(b) by the employer for the contribution period or periods;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the date of commencement of the employment of the relevant employee;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: such other information as may be specified by the Authority.

section.name: s7AC
section.heading: Authority to pay contributions received under section 7AA to approved trustee
section.leadIn: The Authority must pay any contribution that is paid to it in respect of a relevant employee under section 7AA—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the employee is still employed by the employer concerned at the time the Authority makes payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employer for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the employer has not nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employee for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if neither the employer nor the employee has nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of a registered scheme that the Authority considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the employee has ceased to be employed by the employer concerned at the time the Authority makes payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employee for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the employee has not nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of a registered scheme that the Authority considers appropriate.

section.name: s7AD
section.heading: Approved trustee’s duties with regard to contributions received from Authority

subsection.content: This section applies if a contribution paid to the Authority in respect of a relevant employee under section 7AA is paid under section 7AC to the approved trustee of a registered scheme.
On receiving the contribution, the approved trustee of the registered scheme must take actions reasonably required by the Authority with regard to the contribution.

section.name: s7AE
section.heading: Certain contributions due for payment to the Authority on commencement of section 7AA

subsection.content: This section applies if at any time during the specified period, a relevant employee of an employer was not a member of a registered scheme as required by section 7.

subsection.leadIn: On the commencement date, the amount of contributions that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: would have been payable by the employer under section 7A to a registered scheme for each contribution period occurring in the specified period during which the relevant employee was not a member of a registered scheme, had the employee been such a member for the relevant contribution period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remains unpaid as at the commencement date,

subsection.continued: becomes due for payment to the Authority.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, this section applies to an employer even if the relevant employee is no longer employed with the employer on the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date of commencement of section 7AA;

contribution period (供款期) has the same meaning as in section 7A(10) except that it does not include the contribution period that begins on a date before the commencement date and ending on or after the commencement date;
specified period (指明期間) means the period beginning on 1 December 2000 and ending on the day immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s7B
section.heading: Sections 7, 7A and 7AA not to apply to certain employees
section.content: Sections 7, 7A and 7AA do not, except in the case of a casual employee, apply to or in respect of an employee who is employed by an employer for less than 60 days.

section.name: s7C
section.heading: Duty of self-employed person to become scheme member

subsection.leadIn: Every self-employed person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must, within the permitted period after the relevant time, become a member of a registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must, in accordance with the provisions of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A), before the end of each contribution period, pay to the approved trustee of the scheme from the person’s own funds for the person’s own benefit a contribution equal to the prescribed percentage of the person’s relevant income. (Amended 2 of 2002 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: contribution period (供款期) means a period prescribed by the regulations as a contribution period;
permitted period (特准限期) means the period specified by the Authority by notice published in the Gazette for the purposes of this section;

def.name: TheRelevantTime
def.leadIn: the relevant time (有關時間) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a person who is a self-employed person at the commencement* of this section, the time of that commencement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a person who becomes a self-employed person after that commencement, the beginning of the date on which the person becomes self-employed. (Amended 2 of 2002 s. 8)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the prescribed percentage is 5 per cent or, if some other percentage is prescribed by the regulations, that other percentage. The regulations may prescribe different percentages for those purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require self-employed persons to report their relevant income to the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the matters that must be included in those reports.

subsection.content: This section is subject to sections 9 and 10.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to a self-employed person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: less than 18 years of age; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of or more than retirement age. (Added 2 of 2002 s. 8)

section.name: s7D
section.heading: Application of Ordinance to certain employees and self-employed persons

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employer enters into a contract of employment with an employee who is less than 18 years of age; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employee reaches 18 years of age on or after the date of commencement* of this section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the employer continues to employ the employee after he reaches 18 years of age,

subsection.continued: then this Ordinance applies to the employer and the employee as if they had entered into the contract of employment on the day on which the employee reaches 18 years of age and the employment had begun or commenced on that day.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is self-employed before he is 18 years of age; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he reaches 18 years of age on or after the date of commencement of this section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he continues to be self-employed after reaching 18 years of age,

subsection.continued: then this Ordinance applies to him as if he had become a self-employed person on the day on which he reaches 18 years of age.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Minimum level of income for contribution purposes

subsection.content: A relevant employee whose relevant income is less than the minimum level of relevant income is not required to contribute to a registered scheme but he may, if he so wishes, by notice in writing to his employer elect to do so.
An employer who receives a notice under subsection (1) must give effect to the election by making deductions and paying contributions in respect of the employee in accordance with section 7A.
A relevant employee may not make an election under subsection (1) in respect of a contribution period during which he is not a member of a registered scheme as required by section 7.
A self-employed person whose relevant income is less than the minimum level of relevant income is not required to contribute to a registered scheme.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Maximum level of income for contribution purposes

subsection.content: A relevant employee whose relevant income is more than the maximum level of relevant income is not required to contribute to a registered scheme in respect of the excess relevant income but he may, if he so wishes, by notice in writing to his employer elect to do so.

An employer who receives a notice under subsection (1) must give effect to the election by making deductions and paying contributions in respect of the employee in accordance with section 7A. (Replaced 1 of 2015 s. 5)
A relevant employee may not make an election under subsection (1) in respect of a contribution period during which he is not a member of a registered scheme as required by section 7.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: An employer of a relevant employee whose relevant income is more than the maximum level of relevant income may contribute to a registered scheme in respect of the excess relevant income, but is not obliged to do so. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 5)

A self-employed person whose relevant income is more than the maximum level of relevant income may contribute to a registered scheme in respect of the excess relevant income, but is not required to do so. (Amended 1 of 2015 s. 5)

section.name: s10A
section.heading: Authority to conduct review of minimum and maximum levels of relevant income every 4 years

subsection.content: The Authority must, not less than once in every period of 4 years beginning with the commencement* of this section, conduct a review of the minimum level of relevant income and the maximum level of relevant income to ascertain whether or not there are grounds to amend Schedule 2 or 3 or Schedules 2 and 3.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the factors which the Authority may take into account for the purposes of conducting a review mentioned in subsection (1), the Authority must take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of the minimum level of relevant income, 50 per cent of the monthly median employment earnings prevailing at the time of the review as compiled from the General Household Survey conducted by the Census and Statistics Department; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of the maximum level of relevant income, monthly employment earnings at 90th percentile of the monthly employment earnings distribution prevailing at the time of the review as compiled from the General Household Survey conducted by the Census and Statistics Department.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Voluntary contributions

subsection.content: The employer of a person may arrange for the person to join and pay contributions to a registered scheme notwithstanding that the person is less than 18 years of age or is of or more than retirement age or is exempted under section 4(3). The employer may pay contributions to the scheme in respect of the person, but is not obliged to do so, whether or not the person pays contributions to the scheme whilst being of that age or is exempted under section 4(3). (Replaced 2 of 2002 s. 9)

A self-employed person may join and pay contributions to a registered scheme notwithstanding that the person is less than 18 years of age or is of or more than retirement age or is exempted under section 4(3). (Replaced 2 of 2002 s. 9)
A relevant employee may pay contributions to a registered scheme exceeding the amount of contribution deductible in respect of the employee under section 7A(1)(b) or (2)(b).

An employer may pay contributions to a registered scheme in respect of a relevant employee employed by the employer exceeding the amount of contribution required by section 7A(1)(a) or (2)(a) to be paid in respect of the employee, but is not obliged to do so, even if the employee continues to pay contributions to the scheme.
A self-employed person may pay contributions to a registered scheme exceeding the amount of contribution payable in respect of the person under section 7C.
A relevant employee or a self-employed person whose relevant income is less than the minimum level of relevant income may nevertheless contribute to a registered scheme. (Amended 18 of 2008 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Any contributions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: paid to a registered scheme as provided by this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consisting of any benefits, other than minimum MPF benefits to which section 5(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B) applies, of a member of an ORSO exempted scheme, or an ORSO registered scheme, within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B), transferred to a registered scheme,

subsection.continued: are voluntary, but are subject to the governing rules of the scheme. (Replaced 2 of 2002 s. 9)

subsection.content: The provisions of this Ordinance (sections 12, 13, 14 and 15(1) to (3) excepted), and the governing rules of the scheme (in so far as those rules are not inconsistent with this Ordinance), apply to accrued benefits derived from voluntary contributions paid to a registered scheme in the same way as they apply to accrued benefits that are derived from mandatory contributions.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may provide for all or any of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vesting of voluntary contributions in the scheme member concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the preservation of accrued benefits derived from voluntary contributions;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the payment to or in respect of a scheme member of accrued benefits derived from voluntary contributions.

subsection.content: Tax deductible voluntary contributions are not voluntary contributions for the purposes of this section. (Added 7 of 2019 s. 12)

section.name: s11A
section.heading: Tax deductible voluntary contributions

subsection.leadIn: A person may open an account in a registered scheme for the purposes of Subdivision 2 of Division 7 of Part 4A of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112) (TVC account) if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a contribution account or personal account in a registered scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a member of an occupational retirement scheme in respect of which an exemption has been granted under section 5.

subsection.leadIn: The person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may pay contributions into the TVC account; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may hold in the account—

subparagraph.content: the person’s accrued benefits derived from those contributions; and
the person’s accrued benefits transferred to the account in accordance with Part 12 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: The following provisions apply to accrued benefits in a TVC account in the same way as they apply to accrued benefits that are derived from mandatory contributions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of this Ordinance (other than sections 12A and 16);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the governing rules of the registered scheme in so far as they are not inconsistent with this Ordinance.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Contributions to vest in scheme members as accrued benefits

subsection.content: Subject to section 12A, a contribution in respect of a member of a registered scheme vests in the member as accrued benefits as soon as it is paid to the approved trustee of the scheme.

Subject to subsection (2A) and section 12A, income or profits derived from the investment of the accrued benefits of a member of a registered scheme by or on behalf of the approved trustee of the scheme also (after taking into account any loss arising from any such investment) vest in the member as accrued benefits as soon as they are received by that trustee. (Amended 29 of 2002 s. 6)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: The reference to income or profits in subsection (2) does not include interest derived from the placing on deposit of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: contributions or benefits—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: received by the approved trustee of a registered scheme in respect of a member of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: during the period that the payment of the contributions or benefits into the member’s account is pending;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: benefits—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: moved from a constituent fund; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: during the period that the investment of the benefits into another constituent fund is pending; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: benefits—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: received from a constituent fund; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: withdrawal of the benefits from the registered scheme concerned is pending; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: transfer of the benefits to another registered scheme is pending. (Added 29 of 2002 s. 6)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: Interest referred to in subsection (2A) must be retained by the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the payment of any administrative expenses of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as income of the scheme,

subsection.continued: for the benefit of scheme members. (Added 29 of 2002 s. 6)

subsection.content: The total amount of accrued benefits vested in a scheme member from time to time is to be calculated as provided by the rules.

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Certain amounts relating to severance payments and long service payments to be paid from accrued benefits

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: benefits reduction provision (扣減權益條文) means the following provision of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57)—(a)in relation to the reduction of a part of accrued benefits by an amount of a severance payment—section 31IA; or(b)in relation to the reduction of a part of accrued benefits by an amount of a long service payment—section 31YAA or 31YB;

Cap. 57 payment reduction provision (扣減《第57章》款項條文) means the following provision of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57)—(a)in relation to the reduction of an amount of a severance payment by a part of accrued benefits—section 31I; or(b)in relation to the reduction of an amount of a long service payment by a part of accrued benefits—section 31Y or 31YA;
employer-funded MPFS benefit (僱主供款強積金計劃權益) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of Schedule 11 to the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);
post-transition portion (轉制後部分) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of Schedule 11 to the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);
pre-transition portion (轉制前部分) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of Schedule 11 to the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);
specified employee (指明僱員) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57). (Added 4 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employer has paid to or in respect of an employee a severance payment or long service payment in accordance with the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57), or a part of such a payment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accrued benefits are held in a registered scheme in respect of the employee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a part of those benefits is available to be reduced by an amount of the severance payment or long service payment, or the part of such a payment, that has been so paid (removable benefits) under the benefits reduction provision, (Replaced 4 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.continued: the employer may make an application in writing to the approved trustee of the scheme for payment of an amount under subsection (2).

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after receiving an application under subsection (1), the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned must, on being satisfied as to the employer’s entitlement to a payment under this subsection, pay to the employer from the accrued benefits concerned an amount equal to the amount of the removable benefits. (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: However, if the employer has only paid a part of the severance payment or long service payment (paid Cap. 57 payment), the payment under subsection (2) must be of an amount equal to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the employee is not a specified employee—the lesser of the following—

subparagraph.content: the amount of the removable benefits;

so much of the accrued benefits mentioned in subsection (1)(b) that are employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefits and that would remain if they were to be reduced by an amount of the unpaid part of the severance payment or long service payment (unpaid Cap. 57 payment) under the benefits reduction provision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the employee is a specified employee—the sum of the amounts under subparagraphs (i) and (ii)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: so much of the removable benefits that are such benefits because of a reduction by an amount of the pre-transition portion of the paid Cap. 57 payment;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: so much of the accrued benefits mentioned in subsection (1)(b) that are employer-funded MPFS benefits and that would remain if they were to be reduced by an amount of the pre-transition portion of the unpaid Cap. 57 payment under the benefits reduction provision;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: so much of the removable benefits that are such benefits because of a reduction by an amount of the post-transition portion of the paid Cap. 57 payment;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: so much of the accrued benefits mentioned in subsection (1)(b) that are employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefits and that would remain if they were to be reduced by an amount of the post-transition portion of the unpaid Cap. 57 payment under the benefits reduction provision. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2A)(a)(ii) and (b)(i)(B) and (ii)(B), a reduction under the benefits reduction provision is a reduction under the provision that applies on the basis that the unpaid Cap. 57 payment had also been paid. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employer has not paid the whole of a severance payment or long service payment to or in respect of an employee as required by the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accrued benefits are held in a registered scheme in respect of the employee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a part of those benefits is available to reduce an amount of the severance payment or long service payment, or the part of such a payment, that has not been so paid (deductible benefits) under the Cap. 57 payment reduction provision, (Replaced 4 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.continued: an application may be made in writing by or in respect of the employee to the approved trustee of the scheme for payment of an amount under subsection (4).

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after receiving an application under subsection (3), the approved trustee of the registered scheme concerned must, on being satisfied as to the recipient’s entitlement to a payment under this subsection, pay to or in respect of the employee from the accrued benefits concerned an amount equal to the amount of the deductible benefits. (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a change has occurred (whether by virtue of a sale or other disposition or by operation of law) in the ownership of a business in which a person is employed, or in a part of such a business, and either—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the person is re-engaged by that new owner under a new contract of employment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is taken into the employment of a company that is an associated company of another company by which the person was employed immediately before the person was taken into that employment,

subsection.continued: this section applies to a severance payment or long service payment, or a contribution, paid by the previous owner as if it had been paid by the new owner or the associated company. This subsection has effect whether or not the previous owner may have terminated the employee’s contract in accordance with section 6 or 7 of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57).

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (6)(a) or (b) applies to a person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: the new owner or associated company, as the case may be, (new employer) has assumed the liability of the previous owner or company (previous employer) for severance payment or long service payment in respect of the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the new employer has agreed to recognize the person’s length of employment with the previous employer for the purposes of that severance payment or long service payment; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no accrued benefits held in a registered scheme in respect of the person have been paid in accordance with this section to the person or the previous employer,

subsection.continued: then the new employer may elect, in accordance with the regulations, to have the accrued benefits of the person held in a contribution account in that scheme transferred to an account in a registered scheme nominated by the new employer. (Added 29 of 2002 s. 7)

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.leadIn: Where a new employer has made an election under subsection (6A), then, for the purposes of that election—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 7A(7) shall not apply to the new employer; and

def.name: ContributionPeriod
def.content: paragraph (b) of the definition of contribution period in section 7A(10) shall be construed as if it read as follows—

paragraph.content: in relation to a relevant employee (not being a casual employee), means each period for which the employer pays or should pay relevant income to the employee; and”. (Added 29 of 2002 s. 7)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (6), 2 companies are taken to be associated companies if one is the subsidiary of the other, or both are subsidiaries of a further company.

If an employee falls within section 31ZEA(3) of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57), then this section as in force immediately before the date on which the Employment and Retirement Schemes Legislation (Offsetting Arrangement) (Amendment) Ordinance 2022 (4 of 2022) (Amendment Ordinance) comes into operation* continues to have effect in relation to the employee as if the amendments to this section made by the Amendment Ordinance had not been made. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 33)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Preservation of accrued benefits derived from contributions
section.leadIn: For the purpose of preserving accrued benefits in registered schemes—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no relevant employee or self-employed person shall have any right or entitlement to those accrued benefits otherwise than in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance; (Amended 7 of 2019 s. 14)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no scheme member has any right or entitlement otherwise than in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance to any part of those accrued benefits in a TVC account. (Added 7 of 2019 s. 14)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Portability of accrued benefits

subsection.content: A member of an employer sponsored scheme who ceases to be an employee of an employer who is participating in the scheme must, in accordance with the regulations, elect to have the member’s accrued benefits transferred to another registered scheme. This subsection does not apply if the member exercises an entitlement to have the member’s accrued benefits paid in accordance with section 15 or regulations made for the purposes of that section.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (1), and in accordance with the regulations, the accrued benefits of a member of a registered scheme may be transferred—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to another registered scheme to which the member is eligible to belong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to another account within the same registered scheme,

subsection.continued: but only in a circumstance permitted or required by the regulations.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: However, if the accrued benefits are held in a TVC account in the registered scheme, those benefits may only be transferred to another TVC account in another registered scheme. (Added 7 of 2019 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: If the accrued benefits of a member of a registered scheme are to be transferred under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approved trustee of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where those benefits are to be transferred to another registered scheme, the approved trustee of that other scheme,

subsection.continued: must comply with such requirements with respect to the transfer of those benefits as are prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of a registered scheme whose accrued benefits are to be transferred under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ceases to be an employee of an employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: becomes an employee of an employer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: does both of those things,

subsection.continued: the employer or employers must comply with such requirements with respect to the transfer of those benefits as are prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include requirements as to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the notices that are to be given; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the procedure that is to be followed,

paragraph.continued: in connection with the transfer of accrued benefits in accordance with this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the procedure to be followed if a scheme member who is a relevant employee fails to comply with subsection (1).

section.name: s15
section.heading: Withdrawal of accrued benefits

subsection.leadIn: A scheme member who has attained retirement age shall, in relation to the registered scheme of which he is a scheme member, be entitled as of right to have paid to him by the trustee of that registered scheme the entirety of his accrued benefits in the registered scheme— (Amended 1 of 2015 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a lump sum; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by instalments. (Amended 1 of 2015 s. 6)

subsection.content: A scheme member who has not attained retirement age but has attained the age specified in Schedule 7 and certifies to the trustee of the registered scheme of which he is a scheme member by statutory declaration in a form approved by the Authority that he has permanently ceased his employment or self-employment, or is otherwise included in a class of persons specified for that purpose in the regulations, shall be entitled as of right to have paid to him by the trustee of that registered scheme the entirety of his accrued benefits in the registered scheme. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2; 1 of 2015 s. 6)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2B), a scheme member referred to in subsection (2) is entitled to be paid the entirety of the accrued benefits—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a lump sum; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by instalments. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 6)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: Subsection (2A)(b) does not apply to a scheme member whose entitlement is exercised in the circumstances specified under subsection (3) in the regulations. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: The regulations referred to in subsection (2) may specify the circumstances in which a scheme member’s entitlement under that subsection may be exercised. Those circumstances include (but are not limited to)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the scheme member’s total incapacity; and (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2. Amended 1 of 2015 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the scheme member’s terminal illness. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: When a member of a registered scheme has died, and any of the member’s accrued benefits are held in the scheme, the approved trustee of the scheme must pay those benefits as a lump sum— (Amended 1 of 2015 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the member’s personal representatives; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there are no personal representatives of the member’s estate or if they are unwilling to act, to such person, or to a person of such class, as is specified in the regulations. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: Except as may be prescribed by the regulations, no period of limitation prescribed by the Limitation Ordinance (Cap. 347) applies to proceedings for the recovery of a member’s accrued benefits that have become payable under this section. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a scheme member has permanently ceased employment or self-employment if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has ceased all employment with no intention of becoming employed or self-employed again; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has ceased all self-employment with no intention of becoming self-employed or employed again. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 6)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Protection of accrued benefits

subsection.content: No part of any accrued benefits in a registered scheme in respect of a scheme member shall be taken in execution of a judgment debt or be the subject of any charge, pledge, lien, mortgage, transfer, assignment or alienation by or on behalf of the scheme member and any purported disposition to the contrary is void. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: To avoid doubt, if a scheme member is adjudicated bankrupt, the right or entitlement of the scheme member to any accrued benefits in a registered scheme is excluded from the property of the scheme member for the purposes of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6). (Added 7 of 2011 s. 4)
Subsections (1) and (1A) apply only to accrued benefits derived from mandatory contributions. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2. Amended 7 of 2011 s. 4)

section.name: s17
section.heading: Compensation for losses in respect of accrued benefits

subsection.content: The Authority is required to establish a compensation fund for the purpose of compensating members of registered schemes and other persons who have beneficial interests in those schemes for losses of accrued benefits that are attributable to misfeasance or illegal conduct committed by the approved trustees of those schemes or by other persons concerned with the administration of those schemes. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

The compensation fund is to be administered by such number of administrators as the Authority may appoint for the purpose but, if there are no such administrators, the Authority must administer the compensation fund. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

For the purpose of the compensation fund referred to in subsection (1) and the cost of the administration thereof, the Authority may impose such levies, and at such rates in respect thereof, to be payable by the trustee of a registered scheme out of contributions in relation to the registered scheme in accordance with, and subject to such limits as may be specified in the regulations. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

The regulations referred to in subsection (3) shall prescribe the rate of levy as a percentage of the value (as determined at a date or dates as may be prescribed in those regulations) of the assets of a registered scheme and may specify whether the payment of the levy is by way of a one off payment or by way of a continuing obligation.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations may be made under section 46 for the purposes of this section. Those regulations may include provisions for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administration of the compensation fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appointment of persons to be administrators of that fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the payment of claims to make good losses of accrued benefits. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may provide grants or loans out of money from the general revenue that may be provided by the Legislative Council for that purpose to the persons appointed to act as administrators of the compensation fund for the purposes of that fund and on such terms as may be specified by the Authority. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

Any person (including the trustee of a registered scheme) whose act or omission causes, or has caused, any loss in respect of the accrued benefits of a scheme member and which loss is subsequently compensated from the compensation fund shall be liable to repay such sum (not exceeding the amount of the loss) and interest thereon as the Court may order and that sum and interest (once recovered) shall be paid to the Authority for the purpose of reimbursing the compensation fund. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s17A
section.heading: Scheme member may claim compensation from compensation fund

subsection.leadIn: A person who is a member of a registered scheme, or who claims to have a beneficial interest in the accrued benefits of a scheme member in such a scheme, may lodge with the Authority a claim for compensation from the compensation fund on the ground that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has suffered a loss of accrued benefits in the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the loss was attributable to misfeasance or illegal conduct committed by a person concerned with the administration of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: A claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in writing and specify the particulars of the claim (including the name of the registered scheme concerned and the name of the approved trustee of that scheme); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be lodged with the Authority within 6 months after the claimant became aware of the loss to which the claim relates.

subsection.content: A claim that is not made in accordance with subsection (2) is barred unless the Authority otherwise determines.
On receiving a claim made under this section, the Authority must investigate the claim to determine its validity.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must dismiss a claim if, after investigating the claim, the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are no reasonable grounds for believing that a loss of accrued benefits has occurred; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there were such grounds, there is no evidence of misfeasance or illegal conduct on the part of the trustee of the scheme or any other person referred to in subsection (1)(b).

subsection.content: If the Authority dismisses a claim, it must notify the claimant of its decision, together with a statement of the reasons for it.

section.name: s17B
section.heading: Application to Court

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority reasonably believes, whether as a result of a claim made under section 17A or otherwise, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a loss of accrued benefits has occurred; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is evidence of misfeasance or illegal conduct on the part of the trustee of the scheme or some other person referred to in section 17A(1)(b); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matter has not been resolved to the satisfaction of the person who may have suffered the loss of accrued benefits,

subsection.continued: the Authority must make an application to the Court to have the matter determined by it.

subsection.content: An application under subsection (1) must contain such information, and be accompanied by such documents, as may be prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this section.
If the application is made as a result of a claim made under section 17A, the application must be accompanied by a copy of the claim.

subsection.leadIn: At the hearing of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approved trustee of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person concerned with the administration of the scheme who is alleged to have committed misfeasance or to have engaged in the relevant illegal conduct,

subsection.continued: are entitled to appear and be heard in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of an application made under this section, the Court must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine whether or not the person who is alleged to have suffered a loss of accrued benefits in the scheme concerned has in fact suffered that loss; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if so, determine whether or not the loss was attributable to misfeasance or illegal conduct committed by a person concerned with the administration of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court makes determinations under subsection (5), it must, by order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: declare the fact and the date of the misfeasance or illegal conduct and the amount of compensation to be awarded; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: direct the administrators of the compensation fund to pay that amount to such person as, in its opinion, appears to be properly entitled to receive the amount.

subsection.content: The Court must not make an order for the payment of an amount of compensation directly to a person, unless the person has been paid or is entitled to be paid the relevant accrued benefits as provided by section 15 of the Ordinance or by regulations made for the purposes of that section.

The Rules Committee constituted under section 55 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) may make rules, not inconsistent with this section, with respect to the making of applications under this section and the hearing and determination of those applications and may amend those rules as and when necessary. (Amended 31 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s17C
section.heading: Administrators to pay compensation to specified person

subsection.content: If the Court makes an order under section 17B for the award of compensation, the administrators of the compensation fund must pay the compensation to such person as is specified in the order.
The administrators of the compensation fund must pay the compensation within the period, and in the manner, prescribed by the regulations.
If the Court makes an order under section 17B for the award of compensation, the administrators of the compensation fund must add interest to the compensation.
The interest is to be calculated in accordance with the regulations.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Recovery of arrears and contribution surcharges

subsection.def: If a mandatory contribution that falls within paragraph (a) or (aa) of the definition of mandatory contribution in section 2(1) is not paid on or before the day by which it is required to be paid under this Ordinance, it becomes due for payment to the Authority on the expiry of that day. (Replaced 18 of 2008 s. 10)

subsection.content: If a mandatory contribution becomes due for payment to the Authority under subsection (1) or section 7AE, the person who is liable to pay the contribution is also liable to pay to the Authority as a contribution surcharge an amount determined by multiplying the arrears by the prescribed percentage rate. The prescribed percentage rate is a rate prescribed by the regulations. (Amended 29 of 2002 s. 8; 1 of 2008 s. 60; 18 of 2008 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by proceedings brought in a court of competent jurisdiction, recover as a debt due to the Authority— (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any arrears; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any contribution surcharge payable under subsection (2) in respect of the arrears. (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 15)

subsection.content: In any proceedings brought under subsection (3), a certificate, purporting to be issued by the Authority, specifying the amount of the arrears, or of any contribution surcharge payable in respect of those arrears, is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the matters specified in the certificate. (Amended 1 of 2008 s. 60)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must pay any arrears or contribution surcharge paid to or recovered by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an employee who is still employed by the employer concerned at the time the Authority makes payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employer for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: if neither the employer nor the employee has nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of a registered scheme that the Authority considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an employee who has ceased to be employed by the employer concerned at the time the Authority makes payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employee for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a self-employed person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the self-employed person for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the self-employed person has not nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of a registered scheme that the Authority considers appropriate. (Replaced 1 of 2008 s. 60)

subsection.content: On receiving a payment under subsection (5), the approved trustee of the registered scheme must take actions reasonably required by the Authority with regard to the payment. (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 15)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe the duties of approved trustees in relation to mandatory contributions, arrears and contribution surcharges received by them; or (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 15)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the requirements to be complied with in relation to the recovery of arrears and contribution surcharges. (Added 1 of 2008 s. 60)

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person’s liability to pay a contribution surcharge under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exercise by the Authority of its power to recover any arrears or contribution surcharge under subsection (3),

subsection.continued: is not dependent on the compliance by the approved trustee or any other person with any regulation made for the purposes of this section. (Added 1 of 2008 s. 60)

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a mandatory contribution includes a part of such a contribution.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Powers of Authority in relation to mandatory contributions

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person may, for the purpose of ensuring compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance (except sections 34L, 34ZL and 34ZM), the requirements imposed under this Ordinance, or the conditions imposed under this Ordinance (except section 34X), and for no other purpose do all or any of the following— (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2; 16 of 2012 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), enter, inspect and examine at any reasonable time, by day or night, any premises in which the person knows or reasonably believes relevant employees or self-employed persons are employed or carrying on business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require any person found in those premises or place or any other person to produce any record required to be kept under this Ordinance or otherwise in that other person’s possession or under his control and inspect, examine and copy the same;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make such examination and inquiry as may be necessary to ascertain whether the requirements of this Ordinance applicable to employers, relevant employees and self-employed persons are being complied with, and seize anything which may appear to the authorized person to be or contain evidence of an offence against this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: exercise any other powers which may be conferred on the authorized person by the regulations. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: If premises are being used as a private dwelling, an authorized person may enter those premises only under the authority of a warrant issued under subsection (3). (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may, on an application made by or on behalf of an authorized person, issue a warrant authorizing the person to enter premises referred to in subsection (2) if satisfied by information made on oath that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that an offence under this Ordinance has been, is being or is about to be committed in those premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that there is in those premises any thing that appears to the person to be or to contain evidence of such an offence. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: A person may exercise a power conferred by subsection (1) only if the person is in possession of a written authority issued by the Authority and produces that authority to the occupier of the premises sought to be entered, inspected or examined or to any other person in relation to whom it is sought to exercise that power. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s19A
section.heading: Power of Authority to require production of records

subsection.content: The Authority may, for the purpose of ensuring compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance (except sections 34L, 34ZL and 34ZM), the requirements imposed under this Ordinance, or the conditions imposed under this Ordinance (except section 34X), but for no other purpose, by notice in writing served on an employer, a self-employed person or any other person, require him to produce for inspection within such period as may be specified in the notice any record that is required to be kept under this Ordinance or is otherwise in his possession or under his control. (Amended 16 of 2012 s. 10)
The Authority may make copies of all or any part of the records produced by a person pursuant to a notice served under subsection (1).

section.name: s19B
section.heading: Authority may pay special contributions into accounts of scheme members

subsection.content: The Authority may pay a contribution (referred to in this Part as a special contribution) into an account of a member of a registered scheme.

subsection.leadIn: To effect the payment under subsection (1), the Authority may pay the special contribution to an approved trustee of the scheme, and by a notice in writing direct the approved trustee to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay the special contribution into a sub-account of the member’s contribution account or personal account specified in the notice. (Amended 11 of 2009 s. 4)

subsection.content: Only a sub-account referred to in section 78(6)(c), (7)(b) or (8)(a) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A) may be specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period that is reasonable in the circumstances within which the approved trustee must pay the special contribution into the specified sub-account.

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after receiving the special contribution and the Authority’s notice, pay the special contribution into the specified sub-account within the period specified under subsection (4)(a).

section.name: s19C
section.heading: Authority may require information or documents necessary for paying special contributions

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, for the purpose of paying special contributions, by a notice in writing—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require a trustee of a relevant scheme to give to the Authority any information or document specified in the notice relating to the members of the scheme;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require an employer of a member of a registered scheme or relevant scheme to give to the Authority any information or document specified in the notice relating to the member; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require any other person whom the Authority reasonably believes to have in his possession, or under his control, any information or document relating to a member of a registered scheme or relevant scheme to give to the Authority any information or document specified in the notice relating to the member.

subsection.leadIn: Only information or documents that the Authority reasonably considers to be necessary for the purpose of paying special contributions may be specified in the notice and they may include (but are not limited to) the following particulars of a member of a registered scheme or relevant scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member’s name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member’s date of birth;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the member’s Hong Kong Identity Card number or travel document number;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the member’s income; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the member’s correspondence address, telephone number and electronic mail address.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a manner in which the specified information or document must be given to the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a period that is reasonable in the circumstances within which the specified information or document must be given to the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is given a notice in writing under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information or document specified in the notice is in the possession, or under the control, of that person,

subsection.continued: that person must give the specified information or document to the Authority in the specified manner within the specified period.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: member (成員), in relation to a registered scheme or relevant scheme, includes a former member of the scheme;
relevant scheme (有關計劃) has the same meaning as in Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B).

section.name: s19D
section.heading: Authority may require approved trustees to take actions necessary for paying special contributions

subsection.content: The Authority may by a notice in writing require an approved trustee of a registered scheme to take any action, specified in the notice, that the Authority reasonably considers to be necessary for the purpose of paying special contributions.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a manner in which the approved trustee must take the specified action; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a period that is reasonable in the circumstances within which the approved trustee must take the specified action.

subsection.content: The action specified in the notice may include (but is not limited to) registering a person specified in the notice as a member of the scheme and opening a personal account for that person. (Amended 11 of 2009 s. 5)
The approved trustee must, after receiving the Authority’s notice, take the specified action in the specified manner within the specified period.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the action specified in a notice in writing given to an approved trustee of a registered scheme under subsection (1) is to register a person specified in the notice as a member of the scheme and to open a personal account for that person; and (Amended 11 of 2009 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approved trustee takes the specified action in compliance with the requirements under subsection (4),

subsection.continued: that person is deemed to have agreed in writing to comply with the governing rules of the scheme.

section.name: s19E
section.heading: Authority may recover special contributions that should not have been paid

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority reasonably believes that a special contribution should not have been paid into an account of a member of a registered scheme, the Authority may by a notice in writing specify that account and direct an approved trustee of the scheme to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw from the specified account a sum equal to the special contribution or the accrued benefits derived from the special contribution, whichever is the less, and pay it to the Authority, in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If the accrued benefits derived from the special contribution have been transferred to another account in the scheme or to an account in another registered scheme, the Authority may by a notice in writing specify that account and direct an approved trustee of the scheme or that other scheme to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: withdraw from the specified account a sum equal to the special contribution or the accrued benefits, whichever is the less, and pay it to the Authority, in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period that is reasonable in the circumstances within which the approved trustee must withdraw the sum from the specified account and pay it to the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after receiving the Authority’s notice, withdraw the sum from the specified account, and pay it to the Authority, in the specified manner within the period specified under subsection (3)(a).

subsection.content: A direction under subsection (1) or (2) may only be given in respect of a special contribution within 6 months after the special contribution is paid into an account of a member of a registered scheme.

section.name: s19F
section.heading: Vesting of special contributions
section.leadIn: Subject to section 19E—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a special contribution paid by the Authority in respect of a member of a registered scheme vests in the member as accrued benefits as soon as it is paid to an approved trustee of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of this Ordinance apply to accrued benefits derived from a special contribution in the same way they apply to accrued benefits derived from a mandatory contribution paid under section 7A(1)(b) or (2)(b) or 7C.

section.name: s19G
section.heading: Liability to pay other contributions

subsection.leadIn: A special contribution paid under this Part does not extinguish or reduce the liability of any person to pay any other contributions under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the governing rules of a registered scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the instrument (however described) that governs a relevant scheme.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant scheme (有關計劃) has the same meaning as in Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B).

section.name: s19H
section.heading: Part 3A prevails over any instruments applicable to registered schemes

subsection.content: If there is any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Part and the provisions of a specified instrument applicable to a registered scheme, the provisions of this Part prevail over the provisions of the instrument to the extent of the conflict or inconsistency.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedInstrument
def.leadIn: specified instrument (指明文書) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any governing rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any participation agreement within the meaning of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any articles within the meaning of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

division.name: D1
division.heading: Designation of Electronic MPF System

section.name: s19I
section.heading: Designation of electronic MPF system by Secretary

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate an electronic system administered and operated by a specified entity—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to perform any other functions specified in Schedule 12.

subsection.content: The specified entity that administers and operates an electronic system designated under subsection (1) is the system operator of the system.
An electronic system designated under subsection (1) is to be administered and operated subject to conditions the Secretary imposes with respect to the administration and operation of the system.

As soon as practicable after a notice is published under subsection (1), the Authority must publish information about the designation, including the conditions imposed by the Secretary (if any), in the way the Authority considers appropriate.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Suspension of Electronic MPF System on Authority’s Direction

section.name: s19J
section.heading: Suspension of electronic MPF system on direction of Authority

subsection.content: If the Authority reasonably considers it necessary to do so, the Authority may in writing direct the system operator of an electronic MPF system to suspend (in accordance with the direction) the system or any part of it from being operated or used for any purpose relating to the designation under section 19I(1).
The system operator must comply with the direction given under this section by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A suspension under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may take effect in relation to a person who uses, or who is required under section 19M to use, the electronic MPF system;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may take effect—

subparagraph.content: for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, determined by the Authority; or
until further notice by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may take effect subject to any condition the Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Information about the suspension—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be published by the Authority or the system operator, or both, as soon as practicable after a direction is given under subsection (1) to the system operator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be published in the way the Authority considers appropriate.

division.name: D3
division.heading: System Operator

section.name: s19K
section.heading: General duties of system operator

subsection.leadIn: The system operator of an electronic MPF system must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: administer and operate the system in a proper manner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide scheme administration services to facilitate approved trustees of registered schemes in performing their scheme administration functions.

subsection.leadIn: The system operator must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are in place rules, made by the system operator and approved by the Authority, governing the administration and operation of the electronic MPF system and a suspension of the system under section 19L(1)(a) or (b) (operating rules);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: there are in place adequate arrangements to monitor and ensure compliance with the operating rules, including arrangements regarding the resources available to the system operator; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: there are available to the electronic MPF system financial resources appropriate for the performance of the functions of the system.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), regard must be had in particular to the following matters or aspects in determining whether an electronic MPF system is administered and operated in a safe manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reliability and robustness of the operation of the system;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: access control over the system;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the integrity of, and access control over, the information held within the system;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: data protection and security;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: record keeping;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the risk management and control procedures relating to the operation of the system;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the soundness of the system;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the services provided to the system by the infrastructure associated with the system;
whether the system is administered and operated in accordance with the operating rules.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), regard must be had in particular to the following matters or aspects in determining whether an electronic MPF system is administered and operated in an efficient manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the speed and efficiency with which scheme administration services are provided by the system;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the overall costs of the maintenance and operation of the system.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, the operating rules are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s19L
section.heading: Powers of system operator

subsection.leadIn: The system operator of an electronic MPF system may exercise one or more of the following powers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: suspend the operation or use of the electronic MPF system (or any part of it) for scheduled maintenance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: suspend the operation or use of the electronic MPF system (or any part of it) because of unforeseen circumstances;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: employ or engage any person to assist the system operator in performing the operator’s functions;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: do anything that is necessary for or expedient to the performance of any of the functions of the system operator.

subsection.content: The power under subsection (1)(a) may not be exercised unless information about the suspension is published by the system operator in accordance with the operating rules before the suspension.
If a suspension is made under subsection (1)(b), the system operator must publish information about the suspension in accordance with the operating rules.
A suspension under subsection (1)(a) or (b) must be made in accordance with the operating rules.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Mandatory Use of Electronic MPF System

section.name: s19M
section.heading: Mandatory use of electronic MPF system and scheme administration services provided by system operator

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the approved trustee of a registered scheme must use the following system and services that are made available to the approved trustee to perform their scheme administration functions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the electronic MPF system; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scheme administration services provided by the system operator of the system.

subsection.leadIn: For a pre-existing scheme, subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: begins to apply on the specified day to the approved trustee of the scheme with respect to a specific function of the trustee.

subsection.content: For a newly registered scheme, subsection (1) begins to apply on the specified day to the approved trustee of the scheme with respect to a specific function of the trustee.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: material day (關鍵日), in relation to a pre-existing scheme, means the day specified under section 19N(1) for the scheme;
pre-existing scheme (既有計劃) means a registered scheme that is not a newly registered scheme;

specific function (特定職能) means a function of the approved trustee of a registered scheme described in section 153 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A) as in force immediately before the commencement* of this section;
specified day (指明日) means the day on which section 80 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance comes into operation.

section.name: s19N
section.heading: Secretary to specify day on which approved trustee of pre-existing scheme must begin to use electronic MPF system to perform scheme administration functions (other than specific function)

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify a day for a pre-existing scheme for the purposes of section 19M(2)(a).
Different days may be specified under subsection (1) for different pre-existing schemes.

section.name: s19O
section.heading: Authority’s duty to publish relevant requirement

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after a notice is published in the Gazette under section 19N(1) for a pre-existing scheme, the Authority must publish information about the relevant requirement for the scheme, including the day on which the requirement is to take effect, in the way the Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant requirement (相關規定), in relation to a pre-existing scheme, means the requirement that the approved trustee of the scheme must comply with section 19M(1) with respect to the scheme administration functions (other than a specific function) of the approved trustee;
specific function (特定職能) has the meaning given by section 19M(4).

division.name: D5
division.heading: Duties of Approved Trustees

section.name: s19P
section.heading: What approved trustees should do in relation to implementation of electronic MPF system etc.

subsection.leadIn: An approved trustee of a registered scheme must have in place effective plans, procedures and systems for enabling or facilitating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proper and efficient implementation of an electronic MPF system; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the effective and efficient provision of scheme administration services by the system operator of the system.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by written notice given to an approved trustee of a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the approved trustee to take any action the Authority considers necessary for any of the purposes mentioned in subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: require the approved trustee to do either or both of the following—

subparagraph.content: to take any action the Authority considers necessary for ensuring compliance by the approved trustee with section 19M;
to comply with section 19M; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the system operator of an electronic MPF system has given the approved trustee a notice under section 19R(1), require the approved trustee to do either or both of the following—

subparagraph.content: to take any action the Authority considers necessary for ensuring compliance by the approved trustee with section 19R(3);
to comply with section 19R(3).

subsection.leadIn: An approved trustee of a registered scheme must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: take—

subparagraph.content: actions that are reasonably required for any of the purposes mentioned in subsection (1); and
other actions required by the Authority under subsection (2)(a);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements imposed on the approved trustee under subsection (2)(b); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: comply with the requirements imposed on the approved trustee under subsection (2)(c).

section.name: s19Q
section.heading: Notice to be given to certain persons in relation to section 19N notice

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after a section 19N notice is published in the Gazette, the approved trustee concerned must notify in writing each of the persons mentioned in subsection (2) of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the publication of the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date from which the trustee must comply with the requirement under section 19M(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the matters and activities that are to be conducted by the electronic MPF system.

subsection.leadIn: The persons are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a participating employer of the registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the scheme.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Collection and Use of Certain Information

section.name: s19R
section.heading: Collection of certain information by system operator

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the system operator of an electronic MPF system may, by written notice given to an approved trustee of a registered scheme, require the approved trustee to provide, in the way specified by the system operator, any information regarding the registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is in the trustee’s possession or under the trustee’s control; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is reasonably required by the system operator for performing any of the system operator’s functions under section 19K(1) or 19S.

subsection.content: The system operator must specify in the notice the information that is required to be provided by the approved trustee.
An approved trustee of a registered scheme must comply with a requirement set out in the notice given to the approved trustee under subsection (1) within the period specified in the notice.
The system operator may use the information obtained under this section only for performing the system operator’s functions.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Regulation of Fees relating to Scheme Administration

section.name: s19T
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Division and Schedules 13, 14, 15 and 16—
subsection.def: FER means the fund expense ratio;
reference rate (參考行政費率)—see section 19X;
reference ratio (參考開支比率)—see section 19W;

relevant rate of administration fee (相關行政費率) means—(a)the relevant rate of administration fee determined under section 2 or 4 of Schedule 14 for a constituent fund of a registered scheme; or(b)the relevant rate of administration fee determined under section 19ZB for a constituent fund of a registered scheme;

second related financial period (第二相關財政期), in relation to a constituent fund of a registered scheme, means the financial period of the registered scheme that is immediately after the financial period covering the inception date of the constituent fund.

subsection.content: A constituent fund of a registered scheme begins to exist on the inception date.

If the units of a constituent fund of a registered scheme are divided into more than one class (fund class), this Division and Schedules 13, 14, 15 and 16 apply to a fund class of the constituent fund as if the fund class were a constituent fund of the registered scheme.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Approved Trustee Not to Charge More Than Amount Payable to System Operator

section.name: s19U
section.heading: Approved trustee may charge fee for use of electronic MPF system and certain other services but must not charge more than amount payable to system operator
