paragraph.leadIn: that the trustee has failed to comply with—

subparagraph.content: section 27(2A);
section 34DB(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d);
section 34DD(1) or (4);
section 34DH(1) or (2);
section 34DI(1) or (2);
section 34DK(2); or

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1) must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period for which the approved trustee’s administration of the scheme is to be suspended; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the grounds for the suspension.

subsection.content: A suspension of an approved trustee’s administration of a registered scheme takes effect from the date specified in the notice served under subsection (1) or, if a later date is specified, from that date, irrespective of whether or not the trustee appeals against the suspension under Part 5.
The Authority may, if it reasonably believes that it is necessary to do so, extend the period of an approved trustee’s suspension by serving a further notice on the approved trustee concerned.

As soon as practicable after suspending an approved trustee’s administration of a registered scheme, the Authority must hold an inquiry to determine whether or not the trustee’s administration of the scheme should be terminated. The inquiry is to be held in accordance with Schedule 5A.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must terminate the approved trustee’s administration of a registered scheme if, at the conclusion of an inquiry held under this section, the Authority is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content:
that the trustee’s conduct with respect to the scheme is having, has had or could have an adverse effect on the financial soundness of the scheme or the interests of the scheme members;
(Amended 9 of 2016 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the trustee is engaging or has engaged in a forbidden investment practice specified in guidelines published under section 28; or (Amended 9 of 2016 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the trustee has failed to comply with—

subparagraph.content: section 27(2A);
section 34DB(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d);
section 34DD(1) or (4);
section 34DH(1) or (2);
section 34DI(1) or (2);
section 34DK(2); or

subsection.content: An approved trustee’s administration of a registered scheme is also terminated if the trustee’s approval is revoked under section 20B.
An approved trustee’s administration of a registered scheme is also suspended if the trustee’s approval is suspended under section 20A.

An approved trustee’s administration of a registered scheme may also be terminated by the resignation of the trustee but only with the prior written approval of the Authority. That approval may be given only when the Authority is satisfied that adequate arrangements have been made for another approved trustee to assume responsibility for the administration of the scheme and for the legal interest in the scheme assets to be transferred to that other trustee.

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Authority to appoint administrator on suspension or termination of trustee’s administration

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administration of an employer sponsored scheme by a trustee is suspended or terminated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after the suspension or termination—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: there are no other trustees of the scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there is only one remaining trustee (not being a company); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if each of the remaining trustees is a natural person, there is no remaining independent trustee,

subsection.continued: the Authority must, as soon as practicable after the suspension or termination of administration, appoint an administrator to replace the trustee whose administration of the scheme has been suspended or terminated until the suspension ends or the vacancy resulting from the termination is filled.

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (1) must, as far as possible, be an approved trustee.

However, if the Authority is unable to find an approved trustee who is willing to act as an administrator of the registered scheme concerned, it may appoint as administrator a person who is not an approved trustee.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administration of a master trust scheme or an industry scheme by a trustee is suspended or terminated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there are no other trustees of the scheme,

subsection.continued: the Authority must, as soon as practicable after the suspension or termination of administration, appoint an administrator to administer the scheme to replace the trustee whose administration of the scheme has been suspended or terminated until the suspension ends or the vacancy resulting from the termination is filled.

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (4) must, as far as possible, be an approved trustee that is a company.

However, if the Authority is unable to find an approved trustee that is a company who is willing to act as an administrator of the registered scheme concerned, it may appoint as administrator a person who is not an approved trustee or an approved trustee that is not a company.

An appointment under this section is to be on such terms and conditions as are specified in the appointment, including the fees that are to be payable to the approved trustee. If a person appointed under this section is not an approved trustee, the terms and conditions are, as nearly as practicable, to be those applicable to such a trustee.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may terminate the appointment of an administrator after giving reasonable notice to the administrator and may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the approved trustee’s administration of the scheme is suspended and the suspension has not ended; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that trustee’s administration of the scheme is terminated,

subsection.continued: in accordance with this section appoint another administrator to administer the scheme.

subsection.content: The administrator of a registered scheme may resign by giving to the Authority not less than 30 days’ written notice of the resignation.

An administrator of a registered scheme may deal with the scheme assets as if the legal interest in those assets was vested in the administrator or, where the administrator consists of 2 or more persons, was vested in those persons jointly.

section.name: s33B
section.heading: Authority to appoint replacement trustee on termination of approved trustee’s administration

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administration of an employer sponsored scheme by a trustee has been terminated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after the termination—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: there are no other trustees of the scheme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there is only one remaining trustee (not being a company); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if each of the remaining trustees is a natural person, there is no remaining independent trustee,

subsection.continued: the Authority must, as soon as practicable after the termination, take all reasonable steps to appoint another approved trustee to replace the trustee whose administration of the scheme was terminated.

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (1) must be an approved trustee.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administration of a master trust scheme or an industry scheme by a trustee has been terminated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there are no other trustees of the scheme,

subsection.continued: the Authority must take all reasonable steps to appoint another approved trustee to replace the trustee whose administration of the scheme was terminated.

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (3) must be an approved trustee that is a company.
An appointment under this section is to be on such terms and conditions as are specified in the appointment, including the fees that are to be payable to the approved trustee.
The legal interest in the assets of a registered scheme in respect of which an approved trustee is appointed under this section becomes vested in the trustee on that appointment.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Voluntary winding up of employer sponsored scheme

subsection.leadIn: An employer sponsored scheme may be wound up voluntarily in such circumstances as are prescribed by the regulations, but only with the written consent of the Authority. That consent may be given only if the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are no longer any scheme members or, if there are any such members, the interests of those members are adequately protected and, if those members continue to have accrued benefits in the scheme, satisfactory arrangements have been made for the transfer of those benefits to another registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all existing liabilities relating to the scheme (including obligations to scheme members) can be met from the scheme assets.

subsection.content: The approved trustee of an employer sponsored scheme, or any other person of a class prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of this subsection, may make an application to the Authority to give its consent to the voluntary winding up of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form approved by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain such information, and be accompanied by such documents, as are prescribed by the regulations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by an application fee of such amount (if any) as is so prescribed.

subsection.content: The Authority may, by written notice, require an applicant to provide such additional information and documents as are reasonably necessary to enable it to determine the application. If such a requirement is not complied with within a reasonable time specified in the notice, the Authority may reject the application.

The regulations may prescribe conditions that the Authority may or must impose as a condition of giving its consent to the voluntary winding up of the scheme, including requirements that must be complied with by the approved trustee of the scheme or by the participating employer concerned.

The Authority must not refuse to give its consent to the voluntary winding up of the scheme without giving the applicant an opportunity to make representations (either orally or in writing or both) as to why the Authority should consent to the winding up.

If the Authority refuses to consent to the voluntary winding up of the scheme, it must give written notice of the refusal to the applicants and must include in the notice a statement setting out the reasons for the refusal.

On consenting to the voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme, the Authority may appoint a liquidator to wind up the affairs of the scheme. More than one liquidator may be appointed under this subsection if the Authority thinks it necessary.
A liquidator appointed under subsection (8) must have such qualifications as are specified in the regulations.
The appointment of a liquidator under subsection (8) is to be on such terms and conditions as are specified in the appointment, including the fees that are to be payable to the liquidator.
The voluntary winding up of an employer sponsored scheme is to be conducted in accordance with regulations made under section 46 for the purposes of this section.
On being satisfied that the winding up of a registered scheme has been completed in accordance with this section, the Authority must cancel the registration of the scheme.

section.name: s34A
section.heading: Winding up of registered schemes otherwise than in accordance with section 34 or 34D

subsection.content: Except as provided by section 34 or 34D, a registered scheme may be wound up only by the Court on application made by the Authority. (Amended 2 of 2002 s. 13)

subsection.leadIn: In winding up a registered scheme, the Court must satisfy itself—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the interests of scheme members are adequately protected; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if those members continue to have accrued benefits in the scheme, that satisfactory arrangements are made for the transfer of those benefits to another registered scheme.

subsection.content: The Court may appoint a liquidator to conduct the winding up of a registered scheme and, subject to the regulations, may specify the duties to be performed by the liquidator in relation to the conduct of the winding up. More than one liquidator may be appointed under this subsection if the Court thinks it necessary.
A liquidator appointed under subsection (3) must have such qualifications as are specified in the regulations.
The appointment of a liquidator under subsection (3) is to be on such terms and conditions as are specified in the appointment, including the fees that are to be payable to the liquidator.

The winding up of a registered scheme under this section is to be conducted in accordance with winding up rules made in accordance with subsection (7). Those rules may include provision for the payment of fees with respect to the proceedings relating the winding up of such a scheme and may specify by whom and to whom those fees are to be paid and the manner in which they are to be paid.

The winding up rules referred to in subsection (6) are to be made by the Rules Committee constituted under section 55 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) and may be amended by that Committee as and when necessary. (Amended 31 of 1999 s. 3)
Winding up rules made for the purposes of this section are to be judicially noticed.
On being satisfied that the winding up of a registered scheme has been completed in accordance with this section, the Authority must cancel the registration of the scheme.

subsection.def: In this section, liquidator (清盤人) includes a provisional liquidator.

section.name: s34B
section.heading: Authority may consent to restructuring of registered schemes

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme or the approved trustees of 2 or more registered schemes may apply to the Authority to consent to the restructuring of the scheme or schemes, as the case may be. (Replaced 29 of 2002 s. 9. Amended 1 of 2008 s. 46)

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form approved by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain such information, and be accompanied by such documents, as are prescribed by the rules; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by an application fee of such amount as is so prescribed.

subsection.content: The Authority may, by written notice, require an applicant to provide such additional information and documents as are reasonably necessary to enable it to determine the application. If such a requirement is not complied with within a reasonable time specified in the notice, the Authority may reject the application.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after receiving an application to consent to the restructuring of a registered scheme or registered schemes, the Authority must consider the application. The Authority may consent to the restructuring only if satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the interests of the members of the scheme or those schemes, as the case may be, will be adequately protected and that, if the restructuring is consented to, their accrued benefits will be transferred to the transferee scheme or schemes, as the case may be, as appropriate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the transferee scheme or schemes, as the case may be, will be governed by the law of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the transferee scheme or schemes, as the case may be, complies or comply with, or will if the restructuring is consented to, comply with, such requirements and standards as are prescribed by the regulations referred to in section 21C. (Replaced 29 of 2002 s. 9)

subsection.content: The Authority must not reject an application under this section without giving the applicant or applicants, as the case may be, an opportunity to make representations (either orally or in writing or both) as to why the Authority should consent to the restructuring of the scheme or schemes, as the case may be. (Replaced 29 of 2002 s. 9)

If the Authority rejects an application made under this section, it must give written notice of the rejection to the applicants and must include in the notice a statement setting out the reasons for the rejection.

On registering a new scheme derived from the restructuring of an existing scheme or schemes, the Authority must issue to the approved trustee of the new scheme a certificate of registration and cancel the registration of the existing scheme or such of the existing schemes as is appropriate as a result of the restructuring. The certificate must specify that the new scheme is an employer sponsored scheme, a master trust scheme, or an industry scheme, as the case requires. (Replaced 29 of 2002 s. 9)

The restructuring of a registered scheme or registered schemes that is carried out with the consent of the Authority under this section is, notwithstanding any provision of this Ordinance or the governing rules of the scheme or schemes, binding on the approved trustee or trustees of the scheme or schemes, all participating employers and scheme members in the scheme or schemes and all other parties bound by the governing rules of the scheme or schemes. (Added 1 of 2008 s. 46)

The Authority’s consent to the restructuring of a registered scheme or registered schemes does not affect the right of a participating employer or scheme member in the scheme or any of the schemes to elect to have the accrued benefits of the member transferred under Part 12 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A). (Added 1 of 2008 s. 46)

In this section, a reference to a restructuring of a registered scheme or registered schemes is a reference to any arrangement under which the members of the scheme or schemes, or the accrued benefits of the members of the scheme or schemes, are transferred to another registered scheme or other registered schemes. (Added 1 of 2008 s. 46)

section.name: s34D
section.heading: Cancellation of registration of registered scheme which has no scheme members, etc.

subsection.content: On being satisfied on the application of the approved trustee of a registered scheme that the scheme has no scheme members, no scheme assets and no liabilities (including obligations to participating employers and scheme members), the Authority must cancel the registration of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form approved by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain such information, and be accompanied by such documents, as are specified in the form.

subsection.content: The Authority may, by written notice, require an applicant to provide such additional information and documents as are reasonably necessary to enable it to determine the application. If such a requirement is not complied with within a reasonable time specified in the notice, the Authority may reject the application.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Preliminary

section.name: s34DA
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: DISConstituentFund
def.leadIn: DIS constituent fund (預設投資策略成分基金) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an Age 65 Plus Fund as defined by section 1 of Schedule 10; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Core Accumulation Fund as defined by section 1 of Schedule 10;

section.def: out-of-pocket expenses (實付開支)—(a)means any of the following charges, expenses and fees (however described)—(i)auditor’s fees for annual audit;(ii)printing expenses and postage;(iii)fund price publication expenses;(iv)bank charges;(v)governmental fees and charges (including stamp duties and licence fees);(vi)other charges, expenses or fees that are properly incurred and permitted under this Ordinance or the governing rules; and(b)does not include fees payable to the system operator of an electronic MPF system under section 19U; (Replaced 40 of 2021 s. 24)

specific investment instructions (特定投資指示), in relation to an account of a scheme member of a registered scheme, means the instructions given by the member to the approved trustee of the scheme to invest the accrued benefits in the account according to the member’s selection as permitted under the governing rules.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Default Investment Strategy

section.name: s34DB
section.heading: Approved trustee to invest accrued benefits according to default investment strategy

subsection.leadIn: An approved trustee of a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must provide in the governing rules of the scheme a default investment strategy that complies with Part 2 of Schedule 10;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must ensure that any investment related to the strategy accords with the requirements under this Part and Part 2 of Schedule 10;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (2), (3) and (4), must invest the accrued benefits of a scheme member according to the strategy; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must ensure that the strategy is available for selection by scheme members.

subsection.leadIn: The operation of subsection (1)(c) is subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any specific investment instructions given by the member for the accrued benefits; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Divisions 3 and 4.

subsection.content: The trustee must not invest the accrued benefits in a pre-existing account of a scheme member according to the strategy if the trustee is aware that the member has reached 60 years of age before the commencement date, unless the member has given specific investment instructions to invest those benefits according to the strategy.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(c) does not oblige the trustee to invest the accrued benefits in an account of a scheme member of a registered scheme according to the strategy if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: all or any of the accrued benefits in that account—

subparagraph.content: have been transferred from an account in another registered scheme to that account in a restructuring to which the Authority consented under section 34B(5); and
were not invested according to the strategy before the restructuring; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all or any of the accrued benefits in that account have been invested in a constituent fund but the approval granted in respect of the fund has been cancelled by the Authority under section 21BB(1)(b).

section.name: s34DC
section.heading: Transfer of accrued benefits to an account within the same registered scheme

subsection.content: If all or any of the accrued benefits in an account of a scheme member of a registered scheme (transferor account) are transferred to another account of the member within the scheme (transferee account), the transferred benefits are to remain invested in the same manner as they were invested immediately before the transfer, unless the member otherwise instructs as permitted under the governing rules. (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 25)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 27(2A) does not oblige the trustee to invest the transferred benefits according to any specific investment instructions that the member has given before the transfer for the accrued benefits in the transferee account; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 34DB(1)(c) does not oblige the trustee to invest the transferred benefits according to the default investment strategy if the member has given specific investment instructions for the transferred benefits before the transfer.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: transferred benefits (轉移權益) means the accrued benefits in the transferor account that are transferred, or have been transferred, to the transferee account.

section.name: s34DD
section.heading: Control of payment for services relating to default investment strategy

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the approved trustee of a registered scheme must ensure that no payment for the services specified in subsection (2) may be charged to or imposed on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a DIS constituent fund of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a scheme member who invests in the fund.

subsection.leadIn: The services specified for the purposes of subsection (1) are services provided in relation to the DIS constituent fund by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approved trustee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified service provider; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person named as the sponsor or promoter in the governing rules of the registered scheme.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to payments for those services—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that are calculated as a percentage of the net asset value of the DIS constituent fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that are—

subparagraph.content: for the services provided by a custodian in connection with holding, maintaining or transacting the investments of the fund; and
customarily not calculated as a percentage of the net asset value of the fund;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that are for the services relating to the establishment or winding up of the fund; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that are charged to the member for obtaining copies of documents not required to be provided under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the aggregate of the total amounts mentioned in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), when it is expressed as a percentage of the net asset value of the DIS constituent fund, does not, in a single day, exceed the percentage specified in section 1 of Schedule 11—

subparagraph.leadIn: the total amount of all payments for the services specified in subsection (2) that are—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: charged to or imposed on the fund, or a scheme member who invests in the fund; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: calculated as a percentage of the net asset value of the fund; and
the total amount of any proportionate underlying investment fund fees chargeable to any underlying investment fund of the fund; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total amount of all payments that are charged to or imposed on the DIS constituent fund, or a scheme member who invests in the fund, for out-of-pocket expenses incurred by the approved trustee on a recurrent basis in the discharge of the approved trustee’s duties to provide services in relation to the fund, when it is expressed as a percentage of the net asset value of the fund, does not, in a single year, exceed the percentage specified in section 2 of Schedule 11.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ProportionateUnderlyingInvestmentFundFee
def.leadIn: proportionate underlying investment fund fee (按比例基礎投資項目基金費用), in relation to an underlying investment fund, means an amount that is calculated by the following formula—
A × B

paragraph.content: where—
is the underlying investment fund fee being calculated as a percentage of the net asset value of the underlying investment fund;
is the proportion of the assets of the DIS constituent fund that is invested in the underlying investment fund;

subsection.def: specified CIS (指明CIS)—(a)means a collective investment scheme as defined by section 1(1) of Schedule 1 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A); and(b)does not include such a scheme that is a REIT; (Added 40 of 2021 s. 26)

def.name: SpecifiedPerson
def.leadIn: specified person (指明人士), in relation to the definition of underlying investment fund fee, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person (first mentioned person) whose role in relation to an underlying investment fund is similar to that of any of the following persons who provide services in relation to a DIS constituent fund—

subparagraph.content: an approved trustee of a registered scheme;
a specified service provider;
a person named as the sponsor or promoter in the governing rules of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who provides services that are identical or similar to the services provided by the first mentioned person;

def.name: SpecifiedServiceProvider
def.leadIn: specified service provider (指明服務提供者), in relation to a registered scheme, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following persons appointed or engaged by the approved trustee of the scheme to provide services for the purposes of the scheme—

subparagraph.content: an investment manager of the scheme;
a custodian of the scheme assets of the scheme;
an administrator who administers the scheme in whole or in part; (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person to whom the provision of those services is delegated by such a manager, custodian or administrator; or (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 26)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the system operator of an electronic MPF system; (Added 40 of 2021 s. 26)

def.name: UnderlyingInvestmentFund
def.leadIn: underlying investment fund (基礎投資項目基金), in relation to the DIS constituent fund in which the accrued benefits of a scheme member of a registered scheme is invested, means any of the following fund or scheme in which those accrued benefits are directly or indirectly invested by the fund—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved pooled investment fund as defined by section 2 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a specified CIS; (Replaced 40 of 2021 s. 26)

def.name: UnderlyingInvestmentFundFee
def.leadIn: underlying investment fund fee (基礎投資項目基金費用)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means any amount payable for the services provided in relation to an underlying investment fund by a specified person; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include the payment for the services similar to those referred to in subsection (3)(b) and (c) in relation to a DIS constituent fund.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of specified CIS in subsection (5), a REIT is a real estate investment trust with all of the following characteristics—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not engage in active trading of real estate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: invests predominantly in real estate for generating recurrent rental income;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the majority of its income derives from rentals of real estate;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: distributes a significant portion of its income to holders in the form of regular dividends or other distributions (however described);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is listed on a stock exchange. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 26)

section.name: s34DE
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules 10 and 11

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend— (Amemded 40 of 2021 s. 27)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Schedule 10, in relation to any or all of the following matters—

subparagraph.content: the percentage of the net asset value of the DIS constituent fund targeted to be invested in higher risk assets;
the range of variation of that percentage;
the age of scheme members specified for an investment strategy;
the number of constituent funds used for investments under the default investment strategy of a registered scheme;
a percentage set out in the table in section 4(3) of Schedule 10; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Schedule 11.

subsection.content: A notice made under subsection (1) may contain incidental, supplementary, consequential, transitional or savings provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of an amendment made by the notice.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions for Pre-existing Accounts Wholly Invested according to Default Investment Arrangement

section.name: s34DF
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—

def.name: DefaultInvestmentArrangement
def.leadIn: default investment arrangement (預設投資安排)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means a default arrangement—

subparagraph.content: provided before the commencement date in the governing rules of a registered scheme; and
under which the accrued benefits in an account of a scheme member who has not given any specific investment instructions for those benefits are invested; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not include an arrangement for investing the accrued benefits in an account of a registered scheme—

subparagraph.content: that have been transferred from an account in another registered scheme to that account in a restructuring to which the Authority consented under section 34B(5); or

section.def: reply period (回覆期), in relation to a specified notice, means 42 days after the date of the notice;
specified notice (指明通知) means a notice that is approved, or in the form specified, by the Authority for the purposes of this Division.

section.name: s34DG
section.heading: Scheme members to whom this Division applies

subsection.leadIn: This Division applies to a scheme member of a registered scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either of the following descriptions is met—

subparagraph.content: the member is below 60 years of age, or becomes 60 years of age, on the commencement date;
the approved trustee of the scheme is not aware of the age of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all of the accrued benefits in a pre-existing account of the member were, as at the commencement date, invested according to a default investment arrangement of the scheme and, since then, have remained so invested.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1), this Division does not apply to the member if the trustee reasonably believes that the trustee has received specific investment instructions from the member to invest any of the accrued benefits in the pre-existing account according to the default investment arrangement.

section.name: s34DH
section.heading: Accrued benefits in pre-existing account

subsection.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must continue to invest the accrued benefits in the DIA account of an existing member according to the default investment arrangement of the scheme unless the trustee has received specific investment instructions from the member for those benefits.

Despite subsection (1), if those benefits have become invested according to the default investment strategy under section 34DI(2) or 34DJ(3) or (5), the trustee must continue to invest any accrued benefits in the account according to the default investment strategy, whether or not the member is still an existing member, unless the trustee has received specific investment instructions from the member for the benefits in that account.
Subsection (1) does not limit the operation of sections 34DI, 34DJ and 34DK.

section.name: s34DI
section.heading: Approved trustee to give specified notice to scheme member

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must, within 6 months after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give a specified notice to each existing member in respect of the DIA account, or each of the DIA accounts, of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the specified notice, inform the member of the requirements under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 34DK, if, by the expiry day of the reply period for a specified notice given under subsection (1) to a scheme member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the trustee has not received specific investment instructions from the member for the accrued benefits in a DIA account of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is still an existing member,

subsection.continued: the trustee must, within 14 days after the expiry day, invest those benefits in the account according to the default investment strategy of the scheme.

subsection.content: Despite section 27(2A), the trustee must comply with subsection (2) regardless of any specific investment instructions received by the trustee from the member for those benefits within the 14 days referred to in that subsection.

section.name: s34DJ
section.heading: Locating scheme members whose addresses are unknown etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it comes to the knowledge of an approved trustee of a registered scheme that a specified notice given to an existing member under section 34DI(1) is not taken to have been given under section 206(1A) or (2) of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the trustee is not aware of any contact details of an existing member that enable the trustee to give a specified notice to the member under section 34DI(1).

subsection.content: The trustee must proceed to locate the member in the manner, and within the time limit (time limit), specified in the guidelines for the purposes of this section.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 34DK, if, after subsection (2) has been complied with in respect of a scheme member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member cannot be located before the expiry of the time limit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is still an existing member,

subsection.continued: the trustee must, within 14 days after the expiry of the time limit, invest the accrued benefits in the DIA account, or all of the DIA accounts, of the member, according to the default investment strategy of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: If a scheme member in relation to whom subsection (2) applies is located before the expiry of the time limit, and the member is still an existing member, the trustee must, within 14 days after the day on which the member is located—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a case falling within subsection (1)(a), give another specified notice to the member informing the member of the requirements under subsection (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case falling within subsection (1)(b), give a specified notice to the member informing the member of the requirements under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4) and subject to section 34DK, if, by the expiry day of the reply period for the notice given under that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the trustee has not received specific investment instructions from the member for the accrued benefits in a DIA account of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is still an existing member,

subsection.continued: the trustee must, within 14 days after the expiry day, invest those benefits in the account according to the default investment strategy of the scheme.

subsection.content: Despite section 27(2A), the trustee must comply with subsection (3) or (5) regardless of any specific investment instructions received by the trustee from the member for those benefits within the 14 days referred to in that subsection.

section.name: s34DK
section.heading: Guaranteed funds

subsection.content: This section applies to the accrued benefits of an existing member that have been invested in a guaranteed fund according to a default investment arrangement of the scheme.

For the purposes of section 34DI(2) or 34DJ(3) or (5), the approved trustee of the scheme must not invest those benefits according to the default investment strategy of the scheme if, on the expiry day, the market value of those benefits is less than the value guaranteed by the fund to be paid to the member on that day.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ExpiryDay
def.leadIn: expiry day (屆滿日)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to section 34DI(2), means the expiry day referred to in that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to section 34DJ(3), means the day on which the time limit referred to in that section expires; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to section 34DJ(5), means the expiry day referred to in that section;

subsection.def: guaranteed fund (保證基金) means a constituent fund that provides a guaranteed return of capital, income on capital or both the capital and the income.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Transitional and Savings Provisions for Pre-existing Accounts Partially Invested according to Default Investment Arrangement

section.name: s34DL
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: default investment arrangement (預設投資安排) has the meaning given by section 34DF.

section.name: s34DM
section.heading: Accrued benefits continue to be invested according to default investment arrangement
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a scheme member of a registered scheme is below 60 years of age, or becomes 60 years of age, on the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement date, part of the accrued benefits in a pre-existing account of the member have been invested according to a default investment arrangement of the scheme,

section.continued: then, the approved trustee must continue to invest part of the accrued benefits in the account according to the arrangement unless the trustee has received specific investment instructions from the member for those benefits.

part.name: P4A
part.heading: Sales and Marketing Activities, and Giving of Advice, in relation to Registered Schemes

division.name: D1
division.heading: Preliminary

section.name: s34E
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: disciplinary order (紀律制裁命令) means an order made under section 34ZW(3), (4), (5) or (6);

def.name: FrontlineRegulator
def.leadIn: frontline regulator (前線監督)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person who is a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary, means the industry regulator assigned under section 34ZA(1) or (2) as the regulator of the person, in the person’s capacity as such a subsidiary intermediary, for the purposes of this Part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an individual who is a responsible officer of a principal intermediary, means the industry regulator assigned under section 34ZB(1) or (2) as the regulator of the individual, in the individual’s capacity as such a responsible officer, for the purposes of this Part;

def.name: IndustryRegulator
def.leadIn: industry regulator (行業監督) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission;

def.name: Inspector
def.leadIn: inspector (查察員), in relation to a regulated person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the frontline regulator of the regulated person; or

paragraph.name: b

def.name: Investigator
def.leadIn: investigator (調查員)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an investigation under Division 3, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Authority;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: a person directed by the Authority or such an industry regulator under section 34O(1)(a)(ii) or (2)(b) in relation to the investigation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an investigation under Division 7 in respect of a regulated person, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the frontline regulator of the regulated person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person directed by that frontline regulator under section 34ZT(1)(b) in relation to the investigation;

section.def: licensed long term individual insurance agent (持牌長期業務個人保險代理) means a licensed individual insurance agent as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) who is eligible to engage in long term business within the meaning of that Ordinance; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 121)

licensed long term insurance agency (持牌長期業務保險代理機構) means a licensed insurance agency as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) who is eligible to engage in long term business within the meaning of that Ordinance; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 121)

licensed long term insurance broker company (持牌長期業務保險經紀公司) means a licensed insurance broker company as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) who is eligible to engage in long term business within the meaning of that Ordinance; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 121)

licensed long term technical representative (持牌長期業務代表) means—(a)a licensed technical representative (agent) as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) who is appointed as an agent by a licensed long term insurance agency; or(b)a licensed technical representative (broker) as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) who is appointed as an agent by a licensed long term insurance broker company; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 121)

def.name: PerformanceRequirement
def.leadIn: performance requirement (作業要求)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a registered intermediary, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a requirement under section 34ZL; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a condition to which the registration as a principal or subsidiary intermediary, or the approval of the attachment to a principal intermediary, is subject by virtue of section 34X; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a responsible officer, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a requirement under section 34ZM; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a condition to which the approval as such responsible officer is subject by virtue of section 34X;

def.name: PrescribedPerson
def.leadIn: prescribed person (訂明人士)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the Insurance Authority, means an employee of the Insurance Authority; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 121)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the Monetary Authority, means a person appointed by the Financial Secretary under section 5A(3) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Securities and Futures Commission, means an employee of the Commission;

def.name: TypeARegulatee
def.leadIn: Type A regulatee (甲類受規管者)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the Insurance Authority, means—

subparagraph.content: a company that is authorized under section 8 of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) to carry on long term business within the meaning of that Ordinance; or
a licensed long term insurance broker company; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 121)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the Monetary Authority, means an authorized financial institution that is registered under section 119 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) for Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, or both, within the meaning of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Securities and Futures Commission, means a corporation that is licensed under section 116 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, or both, within the meaning of that Ordinance;

def.name: TypeBRegulatee
def.leadIn: Type B regulatee (乙類受規管者)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the Insurance Authority, means—

subparagraph.content: a licensed long term individual insurance agent;
a licensed long term insurance agency; or
a licensed long term technical representative; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 121)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the Monetary Authority, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a relevant individual who is registered under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, or both, within the meaning of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who, with the consent of the Monetary Authority under section 71C of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), is an executive officer of a registered institution appointed under section 71D of that Ordinance to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business conducted by the registered institution that constitutes Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, or both, within the meaning of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to the Securities and Futures Commission, means a person who is licensed under section 120 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, or both, within the meaning of that Ordinance.

section.name: s34F
section.heading: Regulated activity, material decision and regulated advice

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person carries on a regulated activity if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: invites or induces, or attempts to invite or induce, another person to make a material decision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gives regulated advice.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), a person does not carry on a regulated activity if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person issues an advertisement, invitation or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the issue is authorized by the Securities and Futures Commission under section 105 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571).

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a person makes a material decision if the person makes a decision as to any matter specified in subsection (5).
For the purposes of this Part, a person gives regulated advice if the person gives an opinion in relation to any matter specified in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The following matters are specified for the purposes of subsections (3) and (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether, or when, to apply to join or become a member of a particular registered scheme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether, or when, to apply to participate in a particular registered scheme as an employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether, or when, to pay contributions (including voluntary contributions) to a particular registered scheme, or to invest in a particular constituent fund of a registered scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the amount of contributions (including voluntary contributions) to be paid to a particular registered scheme, or the amount to be invested in a particular constituent fund of a registered scheme;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether, or when, to transfer accrued benefits from a particular registered scheme to another particular registered scheme, or from a particular constituent fund of a registered scheme to another particular constituent fund of the registered scheme;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the amount of accrued benefits to be transferred from a particular registered scheme to another particular registered scheme, or from a particular constituent fund of a registered scheme to another particular constituent fund of the registered scheme;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: whether, or when, to transfer benefits from an occupational retirement scheme to a particular registered scheme;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the amount of benefits to be transferred from an occupational retirement scheme to a particular registered scheme;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: whether, or when, to make a claim for the payment of accrued benefits from a registered scheme;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the amount of a claim mentioned in paragraph (i).

section.name: s34G
section.heading: Principal intermediary

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a principal intermediary if the person is registered under section 34T(4) as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 34M(9)(a), such a person is still a principal intermediary even though the registration is suspended under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to a registration of a person as a principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to a registration under section 34T(4) as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes such a registration that is suspended under this Part.

section.name: s34H
section.heading: Subsidiary intermediary

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a subsidiary intermediary if the person is registered under section 34U(4) as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the person is to be attached; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 34V(7), such a person is still a subsidiary intermediary even though the registration is suspended under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to a registration of a person as a subsidiary intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to a registration under section 34U(4) as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the person is to be attached; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes such a registration that is suspended under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary if the person is approved under section 34V(4) as being attached to the principal intermediary for the purpose of carrying on regulated activities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to sections 34M(9)(b) and 34W(7), such a person is still a subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary even though—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the registration of the person as a subsidiary intermediary is suspended under this Part; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the approval is suspended under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to an approval of the attachment of a person to a principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to an approval under section 34V(4) of the attachment of the person to the principal intermediary for the purpose of carrying on regulated activities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes such an approval that is suspended under this Part.

section.name: s34I
section.heading: Responsible officer and specified responsibilities

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual is a responsible officer of a principal intermediary if the individual is approved under section 34W(4) as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 34ZD(5), such an individual is still a responsible officer of the principal intermediary even though the approval is suspended under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to an approval under section 34W(4) of the individual as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes such an approval that is suspended under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, a reference to specified responsibilities in relation to a principal intermediary, is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsibility to ensure that the principal intermediary has established and maintains proper controls and procedures for securing compliance by the principal intermediary, and by each subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary, with this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the responsibility to ensure that the principal intermediary uses the principal intermediary’s best endeavours to secure observance by subsidiary intermediaries attached to the principal intermediary of the controls and procedures mentioned in paragraph (a).

section.name: s34J
section.heading: Revocation or suspension of qualification as Type A regulatee

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person has a qualification as a Type A regulatee revoked on disciplinary grounds if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of Type A regulatee in section 34E as a company authorized to carry on long term business under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41), the authorization granted under section 8 of that Ordinance is revoked under section 41P(2)(a) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 122)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii) of that definition as a licensed long term insurance broker company, the licence granted under section 64ZA of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is revoked under section 81(4)(a)(i) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 122)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (b) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as an authorized financial institution registered for Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the registration is revoked under section 196(1)(i)(A) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as an authorized financial institution registered for Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the registration is revoked under that section in relation to those regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (c) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a corporation licensed to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the licence is revoked under section 194(1)(i)(A) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a corporation licensed to carry on Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the licence is revoked under that section in relation to those regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person has a qualification as a Type A regulatee suspended if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of Type A regulatee in section 34E as a company authorized to carry on long term business under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41), the authorization granted under section 8 of that Ordinance is suspended under section 41P(2)(b) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 122)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii) of that definition as a licensed long term insurance broker company, the licence granted under section 64ZA of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is suspended under section 81(4)(a)(ii) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 122)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (b) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as an authorized financial institution registered for Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the registration is suspended under section 196(1)(i)(B) or 197(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), or is deemed to be suspended under section 197(4) of that Ordinance, in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as an authorized financial institution registered for Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the registration is suspended under that section 196(1)(i)(B) or 197(1), or is deemed to be suspended under that section 197(4), in relation to those regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (c) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a corporation licensed to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the licence is suspended under section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), or is deemed to be suspended under section 195(4) of that Ordinance, in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a corporation licensed to carry on Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the licence is suspended under that section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1), or is deemed to be suspended under that section 195(4), in relation to those regulated activities.

section.name: s34K
section.heading: Revocation or suspension of qualification as Type B regulatee

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person has a qualification as a Type B regulatee revoked on disciplinary grounds if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of Type B regulatee in section 34E as a licensed long term individual insurance agent, the licence granted under section 64W of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is revoked under section 81(4)(a)(i) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 123)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii) of that definition as a licensed long term insurance agency, the licence granted under section 64U of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is revoked under section 81(4)(a)(i) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 123)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(iii) of that definition as a licensed long term technical representative, the licence granted under section 64Y or 64ZC of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is revoked under section 81(4)(a)(i) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 123)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (b)(i) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a relevant individual registered as engaged in respect of Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, all or any of the person’s relevant particulars are removed from the register under section 58A(1)(c) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a relevant individual registered as engaged in respect of Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, all or any of the person’s relevant particulars are removed from the register under that section in relation to those regulated activities;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (b)(ii) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a person who is an executive officer appointed to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business that constitutes Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the consent is withdrawn under section 71C(4)(c) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to a business that constitutes that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a person who is an executive officer appointed to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business that constitutes Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the consent is withdrawn under that section in relation to a business that constitutes those regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (c) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the licence is revoked under section 194(1)(i)(A) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the licence is revoked under that section in relation to those regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person has a qualification as a Type B regulatee suspended if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of Type B regulatee in section 34E as a licensed long term individual insurance agent, the licence granted under section 64W of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is suspended under section 81(4)(a)(ii) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 123)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(ii) of that definition as a licensed long term insurance agency, the licence granted under section 64U of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is suspended under section 81(4)(a)(ii) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 123)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (a)(iii) of that definition as a licensed long term technical representative, the licence granted under section 64Y or 64ZC of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41) is suspended under section 81(4)(a)(ii) of that Ordinance in relation to long term business; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 123)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (b)(i) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a relevant individual registered as engaged in respect of Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, all or any of the person’s relevant particulars are suspended from the register under section 58A(1)(d) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a relevant individual registered as engaged in respect of Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, all or any of the person’s relevant particulars are suspended from the register under that section in relation to those regulated activities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (b)(ii) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a person who is an executive officer appointed to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business that constitutes Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the consent is suspended under section 71C(4)(d) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to a business that constitutes that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a person who is an executive officer appointed to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business that constitutes Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the consent is suspended under that section in relation to a business that constitutes those regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in paragraph (c) of that definition—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the licence is suspended under section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), or is deemed to be suspended under section 195(4) of that Ordinance, in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the licence is suspended under that section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1), or is deemed to be suspended under that section 195(4), in relation to those regulated activities.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Prohibitions

section.name: s34L
section.heading: Prohibition against carrying on regulated activities etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not carry on any regulated activity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the course of the person’s business or employment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for reward.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not hold themselves out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as carrying on regulated activities in the course of the person’s business or employment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as carrying on regulated activities for reward.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not take or use—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the title of “principal intermediary”, “subsidiary intermediary”, “主事中介人” or “附屬中介人”; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any other title suggesting that the person carries on regulated activities—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the course of the person’s business or employment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for reward.

section.name: s34M
section.heading: Exceptions to section 34L

subsection.leadIn: Section 34L does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a principal intermediary from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities in the course of the principal intermediary’s business; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding themselves out as so carrying on regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities for the principal intermediary in the course of acting as an employee, agent or representative of the principal intermediary; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding themselves out as so carrying on regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: Section 34L does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit a principal intermediary from taking or using the title of “principal intermediary” or “主事中介人”; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibit a subsidiary intermediary from taking or using the title of “subsidiary intermediary” or “附屬中介人”.

subsection.leadIn: Section 34L does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit an approved trustee, a participating employer, or a service provider, from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities for the purpose of complying with a requirement under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding themselves out as so carrying on regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit the Authority from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities for the purpose of performing a function under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding itself out as so carrying on regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: Section 34L does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a solicitor from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to his or her practice as a solicitor in a Hong Kong firm or foreign firm within the meaning of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit counsel from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to his or her practice as counsel; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a certified public accountant from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to his or her practice as a certified public accountant in a practice unit as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); or(Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a trust company registered under Part 8 of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) (other than an approved trustee) from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to the discharge of its duty as such trust company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: holding itself out as so giving regulated advice.

subsection.leadIn: Section 34L does not prohibit a person from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: giving regulated advice through—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a newspaper, magazine, book or other publication that is made generally available to the public (excluding one that is made available on subscription only); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a television broadcast or radio broadcast for reception by the public, whether on subscription or otherwise; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holding themselves out as so giving regulated advice.

subsection.leadIn: Section 34L does not prohibit a company from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: giving regulated advice to a specified company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holding itself out as so giving regulated advice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedCompany
def.leadIn: specified company (指明公司), in relation to a company, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a wholly owned subsidiary of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another company that holds all the issued shares of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a wholly owned subsidiary of that other company mentioned in paragraph (b).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a company is a wholly owned subsidiary of another company if it has only the following as members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that other company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a nominee of that other company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a wholly owned subsidiary of that other company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a nominee of such a wholly owned subsidiary.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a principal intermediary does not include a person whose registration as a principal intermediary is suspended under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary does not include a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whose registration as a subsidiary intermediary is suspended under this Part; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the approval of whose attachment to the principal intermediary is suspended under this Part.

section.name: s34N
section.heading: Offence relating to prohibitions

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes section 34L(1) or (2) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for each day on which the offence is continued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for each day on which the offence is continued.

subsection.leadIn: If a person contravenes section 34L(1) or (2) by carrying on regulated activities for another person in the course of acting as an employee, agent or representative of that other person, or for holding themselves out as so carrying on regulated activities, the person is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for each day on which the offence is continued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day on which the offence is continued.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes section 34L(3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day on which the offence is continued.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Investigation concerning Contravention of Prohibition

section.name: s34O
section.heading: Initiating investigation

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority has reasonable cause to believe that a person may have contravened section 34L—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may exercise the powers under section 34P for the purpose of investigating the contravention or the question whether or not there has been such a contravention; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: may in writing direct a person employed by the Authority to investigate, with those powers, the contravention or the question whether or not there has been such a contravention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority may, in writing, nominate an industry regulator to assist the Authority in the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority nominates an industry regulator to assist the Authority in an investigation under subsection (1)(b), the industry regulator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may exercise the powers under section 34P for the purpose of investigating the contravention or the question whether or not there has been such a contravention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may in writing direct a prescribed person to investigate, with those powers, the contravention or the question whether or not there has been such a contravention.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority or an industry regulator directs a person under subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (2)(b) in relation to an investigation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority or industry regulator must provide the person with a copy of the direction; and

paragraph.name: b
