paragraph.content: the person must, before imposing a requirement under section 34P on another person, produce a copy of the direction to that other person.

subsection.content: Before the Authority, or a person directed by the Authority under subsection (1)(a)(ii), imposes a requirement under section 34P on another person who is a Type A or Type B regulatee of an industry regulator, the Authority or the person so directed must consult the industry regulator.

Before an industry regulator, or a person directed by an industry regulator under subsection (2)(b), imposes a requirement under section 34P on another person who is a Type A or Type B regulatee of another industry regulator, the industry regulator or the person so directed must consult that other industry regulator.

Even though the Authority or an industry regulator has directed a person under subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (2)(b) in relation to an investigation, the Authority or industry regulator may still exercise the powers under section 34P for the purpose of the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: Even though the Authority has nominated an industry regulator under subsection (1)(b) to assist the Authority in an investigation, the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may still exercise the powers under section 34P for the purpose of the investigation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may still direct a person employed by the Authority under subsection (1)(a)(ii) in relation to the investigation.

section.name: s34P
section.heading: Investigation powers

subsection.leadIn: An investigator may, in writing, require a person specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to produce, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, any record or document specified in the requirement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is or may be relevant to any matter under investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that is in the person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to attend before the investigator at the time and place specified in the requirement, and answer any question relating to any matter under investigation that the investigator may raise with the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to respond to any written question relating to any matter under investigation that the investigator may raise with the person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to give the investigator any assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person whom the Authority has reasonable cause to believe may have contravened section 34L; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person whom the investigator has reasonable cause to believe—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be in possession of any record or document that contains, or that is likely to contain, information relevant to any matter under investigation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to be otherwise in possession of such information.

subsection.content: If a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1)(a), the investigator may require the person to give an explanation or further particulars in respect of the record or document.

If a person gives any answer, response, explanation or particulars in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1) or (3), the investigator may, in writing, require the person to verify within the time specified in the requirement, the answer, response, explanation or particulars by a statutory declaration.

If, for the reason that the information concerned is not within the person’s knowledge or possession, a person does not give any answer, response, explanation or particulars in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1) or (3), the investigator may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, that reason and fact by a statutory declaration.
This section is subject to section 34ZZB(2).

division.name: D4
division.heading: Registration of Intermediaries and Approval of Responsible Officers

section.name: s34Q
section.heading: Register of intermediaries

subsection.content: The Authority must establish and keep a register of intermediaries for regulated activities.
The Register may be kept in any form that the Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: At all reasonable times, a member of the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Register is kept in a documentary form, may inspect the Register free of charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Register is kept otherwise than in a documentary form, may inspect a reproduction of any information recorded in the Register in a legible form free of charge.

subsection.leadIn: At all reasonable times, a member of the public may, on payment of a fee of the amount prescribed by the regulations, obtain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in or extract of the Register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of such an entry or extract, certified by an authorized officer of the Authority as a true copy of the entry or extract.

subsection.leadIn: A right under subsection (3) or (4) is only exercisable for the purpose of enabling the member of the public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to ascertain whether the member of the public is dealing with a regulated person in matters of or connected with any regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to ascertain the particulars of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the registration of a person as a principal or subsidiary intermediary; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the approval of an individual as a responsible officer.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of an entry in or extract of the Register, and purporting to be certified by an authorized officer of the Authority as a true copy of the entry or extract, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be certified by an authorized officer of the Authority;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be a true copy of the entry or extract; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: is proof of its contents.

section.name: s34R
section.heading: Register to be made available through internet
section.content: The Authority must make the Register available to the public through the internet.

section.name: s34S
section.heading: Contents of Register

subsection.leadIn: For every registered intermediary, the Register must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and the registration number of the intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the condition (if any) to which the registration as a principal or subsidiary intermediary, or the approval of the attachment to a principal intermediary, is subject by virtue of section 34X;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the name of the frontline regulator;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a record of every disciplinary order (except an order under section 34ZW(5)(b)) that has been in force against the registered intermediary within the last 5 years;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the registration as a principal or subsidiary intermediary, or the approval of the attachment to a principal intermediary, is suspended under this Part, a note to that effect; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other particulars that are prescribed by the rules.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for every principal intermediary, the Register must also contain—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the address of the principal intermediary’s principal place of business in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name and the office address of every responsible officer of the principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for every subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary, the Register must also contain—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of the principal intermediary;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the address of the principal intermediary’s principal place of business in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: if the registration of the principal intermediary as such is suspended under this Part—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a note to that effect; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a note to the effect that section 34M(1)(b) does not apply to the subsidiary intermediary; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: if the subsidiary intermediary is also a responsible officer of the principal intermediary—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a note to that effect;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the condition (if any) to which the approval as such a responsible officer is subject by virtue of section 34X; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: where the approval of the subsidiary intermediary as such responsible officer is suspended under this Part, a note to that effect.

section.name: s34T
section.heading: Registration as principal intermediary and related matters

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Authority for registration as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an application made by the principal applicant under section 34V(1) for approval of attachment of a subsidiary intermediary to the principal applicant for the purpose of carrying on regulated activities;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an application made by the principal applicant under section 34W(1) for approval of the subsidiary intermediary as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the principal applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: all of the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an application made by an individual under section 34U(1) for registration as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the individual is to be attached;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an application made by the principal applicant under section 34V(1) for approval of attachment of the individual to the principal applicant for the purpose of carrying on regulated activities;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an application made by the principal applicant under section 34W(1) for approval of the individual as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the principal applicant.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by an application fee of the amount prescribed by the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: On application under subsection (1), the Authority may register the principal applicant as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the principal applicant is a Type A regulatee of an industry regulator;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that, within 1 year immediately before the date of the application, the principal applicant has not had any qualification as a Type A regulatee revoked on disciplinary grounds;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that the principal applicant does not have any qualification as a Type A regulatee suspended;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: that, within 1 year immediately before the date of the application, the principal applicant has not had a registration as a registered intermediary revoked under section 34ZW(3)(a)(i); and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: that the principal applicant is not disqualified under section 34ZW(3)(a)(ii) from being registered as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(i), and the criteria for approval under section 34V(4) are satisfied; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for the purposes of subsection (2)(a)(ii), and the criteria for approval under section 34W(4)(b), (c) and (d) are satisfied; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(i), and the criteria for approval under section 34U(4) (except paragraph (g)) are satisfied;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(ii), and the criteria for approval under section 34V(4)(b), (c) and (d) are satisfied; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(iii), and the criteria for approval under section 34W(4)(b), (c) and (d) are satisfied.

subsection.content: If the Authority registers under subsection (4) a principal applicant as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities, the Authority must also grant the accompanying applications made for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) or (b).
If the Authority rejects an application made under subsection (1), the Authority must also reject the accompanying applications made for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) or (b).
The Authority must give the principal applicant a notice in writing of the results of the application made under subsection (1).
A notice under subsection (7) must, in the case of the application being rejected, include a statement of reasons for the rejection.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: principal applicant (主要申請人) means the person who applies under subsection (1) for registration as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities.

section.name: s34U
section.heading: Registration as subsidiary intermediary

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Authority for registration as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the person is to be attached.

An application under subsection (1) must be accompanied by an application made by a principal intermediary under section 34V(1) for approval of attachment of the principal applicant to the principal intermediary for the purpose of carrying on regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by an application fee of the amount prescribed by the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: On application under subsection (1), the Authority may register the principal applicant as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the principal applicant is to be attached if it is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the principal applicant is a Type B regulatee of an industry regulator but not a Type A regulatee of any industry regulator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, within 1 year immediately before the date of the application, the principal applicant has not had any qualification as a Type B regulatee revoked on disciplinary grounds;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the principal applicant does not have any qualification as a Type B regulatee suspended;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that, within 1 year immediately before the date of the application, the principal applicant has not had a registration as a registered intermediary revoked under section 34ZW(3)(a)(i);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that the principal applicant is not disqualified under section 34ZW(3)(a)(ii) from being registered as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the principal applicant is to be attached;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: that if the principal applicant is an individual, the principal applicant has, within 1 year immediately before the date of the application, passed a qualifying examination specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for the purposes of subsection (2); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the criteria for approval of the attachment under section 34V(4)(b), (c) and (d) are satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4)(f) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 3 years immediately before the date of the application, the principal applicant has been registered as a subsidiary intermediary and that registration has been revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the revocation, or the last revocation (if there is more than one), is not made under section 34ZP(4).

subsection.content: If the Authority registers under subsection (4) the principal applicant as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the principal applicant is to be attached, the Authority must also grant the accompanying application made for the purposes of subsection (2).
If the Authority rejects an application made under subsection (1), the Authority must also reject the accompanying application made for the purposes of subsection (2).
The Authority must give the principal applicant a notice in writing of the results of the application made under subsection (1).
A notice under subsection (8) must, in the case of the application being rejected, include a statement of reasons for the rejection.
The Authority must publish the qualifying examination specified under subsection (4)(f) in any manner that it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: principal applicant (主要申請人) means the person who applies under subsection (1) for registration as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the person is to be attached.

section.name: s34V
section.heading: Approval of attachment of subsidiary intermediary to principal intermediary

subsection.content: A person specified in subsection (2) may apply to the Authority for approval of attachment of another person to the specified person for the purpose of carrying on regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: The person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a principal intermediary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who applies under section 34T(1) for registration as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by an application fee of the amount prescribed by the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: On application under subsection (1), the Authority may approve the attachment if it is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the other person is a subsidiary intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the applicant consents to the other person being an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the other person is employed by, or acts as an agent or representative for, the applicant; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the other person is a Type B regulatee of an industry regulator that is the frontline regulator of the applicant.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the applicant and the other person a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
A notice under subsection (5) must, in the case of the application being rejected, include a statement of reasons for the rejection.
In subsection (4)(a), a reference to a subsidiary intermediary does not include a person whose registration as a subsidiary intermediary is suspended under this Part.

section.name: s34W
section.heading: Approval as responsible officer

subsection.content: A person specified in subsection (2) may apply to the Authority for approval of an individual as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the specified person.

subsection.leadIn: The person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a principal intermediary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who applies under section 34T(1) for registration as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by an application fee of the amount prescribed by the regulations.

subsection.leadIn: On application under subsection (1), the Authority may approve the individual as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the applicant if it is satisfied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the individual is a subsidiary intermediary attached to the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the individual has sufficient authority within the applicant, and will be provided with sufficient resources and support, for carrying out specified responsibilities in relation to the applicant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that, within 1 year immediately before the date of the application, the individual has not had an approval as a responsible officer revoked under section 34ZW(4)(a)(i); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the individual is not disqualified under section 34ZW(4)(a)(ii) from being approved as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to a principal intermediary.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the applicant and the individual a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
A notice under subsection (5) must, in the case of the application being rejected, include a statement of reasons for the rejection.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (4)(a), a reference to a subsidiary intermediary attached to the applicant does not include a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose registration as a subsidiary intermediary is suspended under this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval of whose attachment to the applicant is suspended under this Part.

section.name: s34X
section.heading: Authority may impose conditions on registration or approval

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registers a person as a principal or subsidiary intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approves the attachment of a person to a principal intermediary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: approves an individual as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary.

subsection.content: The Authority may impose any conditions that it considers appropriate on the registration or approval when the Authority registers or approves the person or individual.
The Authority may also impose any conditions that it considers appropriate on the registration or approval after the Authority has registered or approved the person or individual.
Subsection (3) applies whether or not a condition has already been imposed on the registration or approval under subsection (2) or (3).
The Authority may amend or revoke any conditions imposed under subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2), (3) or (5) is only exercisable by notice in writing given to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(a), the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b), the person and the principal intermediary; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(c), the individual and the principal intermediary.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (6) must, in the case of any conditions being imposed or amended, include a statement of reasons for imposing or amending the conditions.

section.name: s34Y
section.heading: Procedural requirement for rejecting application, or imposing or amending conditions

subsection.content: The Authority must not reject an application made under section 34T(1) or 34U(1) for registration of a person as a principal or subsidiary intermediary, or impose a condition under section 34X(2) or (3) on such a registration, or amend such a condition under section 34X(5), without giving the person an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

The Authority must not reject an application made under section 34V(1) for approval of an attachment of a person to a principal intermediary, or impose a condition under section 34X(2) or (3) on such an approval, or amend such a condition under section 34X(5), without giving the person and the principal intermediary an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

The Authority must not reject an application made under section 34W(1) for approval of an individual as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary, or impose a condition under section 34X(2) or (3) on such an approval, or amend such a condition under section 34X(5), without giving the individual and the principal intermediary an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.
In this section, a reference to an opportunity to make representations is a reference to an opportunity to make oral representations or written representations, or both.

section.name: s34Z
section.heading: Assignment of frontline regulator for principal intermediary

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the Authority registers a person as a principal intermediary, the Authority must assign an industry regulator as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part.

If the Authority considers appropriate, the Authority may replace the industry regulator assigned as the frontline regulator of a person registered as a principal intermediary by assigning another industry regulator as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part.
An assignment under subsection (1) or (2) must comply with subsections (4), (5) and (6).
If the person is a Type A regulatee of 1 industry regulator, the industry regulator is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: If the person is a Type A regulatee of the Monetary Authority and a Type A regulatee of another industry regulator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the Monetary Authority is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the Authority is satisfied that the person carries on the majority of its business activities as a Type A regulatee of that other industry regulator, that other industry regulator is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: If the person is a Type A regulatee of the Insurance Authority and a Type A regulatee of the Securities and Futures Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the Insurance Authority is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the Authority is satisfied that the person carries on the majority of its business activities as a Type A regulatee of the Securities and Futures Commission, the Commission is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An assignment of an industry regulator as the frontline regulator of a person under subsection (1) or (2) ceases to be in force if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another industry regulator is assigned as the frontline regulator of the person under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of the person as a principal intermediary is revoked under this Part.

editorialNote.content: This section has effect subject to section 8(3) of Schedule 5B in its application to a person who, by virtue of section 4(2) of that Schedule, is regarded as being registered as a principal intermediary.

section.name: s34ZA
section.heading: Assignment of frontline regulator for subsidiary intermediary

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the Authority approves the attachment of a person to a principal intermediary, the Authority must assign the frontline regulator of the principal intermediary as the regulator of the person, in the person’s capacity as a subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary, for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority assigns an industry regulator as the frontline regulator of a person in the person’s capacity as a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority assigns under section 34Z(2) another industry regulator as the frontline regulator of the principal intermediary,

subsection.continued: the Authority must replace the industry regulator mentioned in paragraph (a) by assigning that other industry regulator mentioned in paragraph (b) as the regulator of the person, in the person’s capacity as a subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary, for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An assignment of an industry regulator as the frontline regulator of a person under subsection (1) or (2) ceases to be in force if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another industry regulator is assigned as the frontline regulator of the person under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval of the attachment of the person to the principal intermediary is revoked under this Part.

section.name: s34ZB
section.heading: Assignment of frontline regulator for responsible officer

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the Authority approves an individual as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary, the Authority must assign the frontline regulator of the principal intermediary as the regulator of the individual, in the individual’s capacity as a responsible officer of the principal intermediary, for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority assigns an industry regulator as the frontline regulator of an individual in the individual’s capacity as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority assigns under section 34Z(2) another industry regulator as the frontline regulator of the principal intermediary,

subsection.continued: the Authority must replace the industry regulator mentioned in paragraph (a) by assigning that other industry regulator mentioned in paragraph (b) as the regulator of the individual, in the individual’s capacity as a responsible officer of the principal intermediary, for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An assignment of an industry regulator as the frontline regulator of an individual under subsection (1) or (2) ceases to be in force if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: another industry regulator is assigned as the frontline regulator of the individual under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the principal intermediary is revoked under this Part.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Change in Circumstances after Registration or Approval

section.name: s34ZC
section.heading: Principal intermediary ceasing to be Type A regulatee etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a principal intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: ceases to be a Type A regulatee of an industry regulator; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has any qualification as a Type A regulatee of an industry regulator suspended; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the industry regulator is the frontline regulator of the person.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of the person as a principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b)(i), is revoked at the time the person ceases to be such a Type A regulatee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b)(ii), is suspended for the period during which that suspension is in force.

editorialNote.content: This section has effect subject to section 8(4) of Schedule 5B in its application to a person who, by virtue of section 4(2) of that Schedule, is regarded as being registered as a principal intermediary.

section.name: s34ZD
section.heading: Principal intermediary without responsible officer

subsection.content: The Authority may suspend the registration of a person as a principal intermediary for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, determined by the Authority, if the Authority is satisfied that the person ceases to have a responsible officer.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may revoke the registration of the person as a principal intermediary if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has not made an application under section 34W(1) for approval of an individual as a responsible officer of the principal intermediary within 90 days after the date on which the suspension takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has made such an application within 90 days after the date on which the suspension takes effect, and the Authority rejects the application.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (1) is not exercisable unless, before exercising the power, the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has given the person a notice in writing of its intention to do so and the reasons for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has given the person an opportunity to make oral or written representations, or both, on those reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) must also include a statement describing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of the person to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how and when the person may make representations.

subsection.content: In subsection (1), a reference to a responsible officer does not include an individual whose approval as a responsible officer of the principal intermediary is suspended under this Part.

section.name: s34ZE
section.heading: Other change in relation to principal intermediary

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a principal intermediary ceases to carry on any regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a change in the address or any contact details of a principal intermediary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a principal intermediary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: acquires any qualification as a Type A regulatee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ceases to be a Type A regulatee of any industry regulator; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has any qualification as a Type A regulatee of an industry regulator suspended; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a responsible officer of a principal intermediary ceases to be an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary.

subsection.content: The principal intermediary must give the Authority a notice in writing of the cessation, change, acquisition or suspension within 7 working days after it occurs.
The Authority may revoke the registration of a person as a principal intermediary if the Authority is given a notice under subsection (2) that the person ceases to carry on any regulated activity.

The Authority may revoke the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary if the Authority is given a notice under subsection (2) that the individual ceases to be an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

editorialNote.content: This section has effect subject to section 8(5) of Schedule 5B in its application to a person who, by virtue of section 4(2) of that Schedule, is regarded as being registered as a principal intermediary.

section.name: s34ZF
section.heading: Subsidiary intermediary ceasing to be Type B regulatee etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: ceases to be a Type B regulatee of an industry regulator; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has any qualification as a Type B regulatee of an industry regulator suspended; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the industry regulator is the frontline regulator of the person in the person’s capacity of such intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: The approval of the attachment of the person to the principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b)(i), is revoked at the time the person ceases to be such a Type B regulatee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b)(ii), is suspended for the period during which that suspension is in force.

subsection.leadIn: Where the person is not approved as being attached to any principal intermediary after a revocation under subsection (2)(a), the Authority may revoke the registration of the person as a subsidiary intermediary if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no application has been made under section 34V(1) for approval of attachment of the person to a principal intermediary within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (2)(a) takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such an application has been made within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (2)(a) takes effect, and the Authority has rejected the application.

tr.td: This section has effect subject to section 9(3) of Schedule 5B in its application to a person who, by virtue of section 5(2) or 6(2) of that Schedule, is regarded as being—
registered as a subsidiary intermediary; and
approved as being attached to another person regarded as being registered as a principal intermediary.

section.name: s34ZG
section.heading: Subsidiary intermediary without principal intermediary

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the principal intermediary intends to withdraw the consent to the person being an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for the principal intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: A withdrawal of the consent takes effect on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the principal intermediary gives the Authority a notice in the specified form of the withdrawal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in such a notice as the date on which the withdrawal is to take effect, that later date.

subsection.content: The approval of the attachment of the person to the principal intermediary is revoked on the date on which the withdrawal takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: Where the person is not approved as being attached to any principal intermediary after a revocation under subsection (3), the Authority may revoke the registration of the person as a subsidiary intermediary if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no application has been made under section 34V(1) for approval of attachment of the person to another principal intermediary within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (3) takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such an application has been made within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (3) takes effect, and the Authority has rejected the application.

section.name: s34ZH
section.heading: Subsidiary intermediary whose principal intermediary having registration revoked

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a subsidiary intermediary attached to another person who is a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of that other person as a principal intermediary is revoked under this Part.

subsection.content: The approval of the attachment of the person to that other person is revoked at the time of that revocation.

subsection.leadIn: Where the person is not approved as being attached to any principal intermediary after a revocation under subsection (2), the Authority may revoke the registration of the person as a subsidiary intermediary if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no application has been made under section 34V(1) for approval of attachment of the person to another principal intermediary within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (2) takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such an application has been made within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (2) takes effect, and the Authority has rejected the application.

section.name: s34ZI
section.heading: Other change in relation to subsidiary intermediary

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a change in the name of a subsidiary intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a change in the address or any contact details of a subsidiary intermediary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a subsidiary intermediary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: acquires any qualification as a Type B regulatee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ceases to be a Type B regulatee of any industry regulator; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has any qualification as a Type B regulatee of an industry regulator suspended; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a subsidiary intermediary ceases to be the responsible officer of a principal intermediary.

subsection.content: The subsidiary intermediary must give the Authority a notice in writing of the change, acquisition, cessation or suspension within 7 working days after it occurs.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2), commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s34ZJ
section.heading: Responsible officer no longer attached to principal intermediary

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual is a responsible officer of a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approval of the attachment of the individual to the principal intermediary is revoked or suspended under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a revocation of the approval of the attachment, is revoked at the time of that revocation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a suspension of the approval of the attachment, is suspended for the period during which that suspension is in force.

section.name: s34ZK
section.heading: Responsible officer ceasing to have sufficient authority within principal intermediary etc.

subsection.content: This section applies to an individual who is a responsible officer of a principal intermediary.

The Authority may revoke the approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the principal intermediary if the Authority is satisfied that the individual has ceased to have sufficient authority within the principal intermediary, or to be provided with sufficient resources or support, for carrying out specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2) is not exercisable unless, before exercising the power, the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has given the individual a notice in writing of its intention to do so and the reasons for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has given the individual an opportunity to make oral or written representations, or both, on those reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) must also include a statement describing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of the individual to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how and when the individual may make representations.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Conduct and Other Requirements for Intermediaries and Responsible Officers

section.name: s34ZL
section.heading: Conduct requirements for registered intermediary

subsection.leadIn: When carrying on a regulated activity, a principal intermediary or a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must act honestly, fairly, in the best interests of the client, and with integrity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must exercise a level of care, skill and diligence that may reasonably be expected of a prudent person who is carrying on the regulated activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may advise only on matters for which the principal or subsidiary intermediary (as the case may be) is competent to advise;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must have such regard to the client’s particular circumstances as is necessary for ensuring that the regulated activity is appropriate to the client;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: must make such disclosure of information to the client as is necessary for the client to be sufficiently informed for the purpose of making any material decision;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: must use best endeavours to avoid a conflict between the interests of the principal or subsidiary intermediary (as the case may be) and the interests of the client and, in the case of such a conflict, must disclose the conflict to the client;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: must ensure that client assets are promptly and properly accounted for; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: must comply with other requirements that are prescribed by the rules.

subsection.leadIn: A principal intermediary must keep such records of activities carried out by the principal intermediary, and of those carried out by every subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary, as may be necessary for enabling the frontline regulator of the principal intermediary to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the principal intermediary has complied with subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not every subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary has complied with subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: A principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must establish and maintain proper controls and procedures for securing compliance by the principal intermediary, and by each subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary, with this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must use the principal intermediary’s best endeavours to secure observance by subsidiary intermediaries attached to the principal intermediary of the controls and procedures established under paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must ensure that the responsible officer has sufficient authority within the principal intermediary for carrying out specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must provide the responsible officer with sufficient resources and support for carrying out specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to a client of a principal intermediary, or a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary, when carrying on a regulated activity, is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person whom the principal or subsidiary intermediary invites or induces, or attempts to invite or induce, to make a material decision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person to whom the principal or subsidiary intermediary gives regulated advice.

section.name: s34ZM
section.heading: Conduct requirements for responsible officer
section.content: A responsible officer of a principal intermediary must use his or her best endeavours to carry out specified responsibilities in relation to the principal intermediary.

section.name: s34ZN
section.heading: Annual fees

subsection.content: A person who is a registered intermediary must pay to the Authority for every chargeable period an annual fee of the amount prescribed by the regulations. The fee for a chargeable period must be paid within 1 month after the first day of the chargeable period.
If a person contravenes subsection (1), the person must pay to the Authority an additional fee of an amount equal to 10% of the annual fee that was unpaid on the date of the contravention.

The Authority may suspend the registration of a person as a registered intermediary for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, determined by the Authority if the person fails to pay to the Authority the annual fee for a chargeable period to which subsection (1) applies, or any additional fee payable under subsection (2) in relation to that annual fee, within 3 months after the first day of the chargeable period.

The power under subsection (3) is not exercisable unless the Authority has, by notice in writing given to the registered intermediary at least 15 working days before the suspension is to take effect, informed the registered intermediary of the contents of this section.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority suspends the registration of a person as a registered intermediary under subsection (3) for failing to pay an annual fee or additional fee, the Authority may revoke that registration if the person fails to pay to the Authority the annual fee or additional fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 30 days after the suspension takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within any longer period that the Authority may specify in a notice in writing given to the registered intermediary.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5B) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (Party A) is a subsidiary intermediary attached to another person who is a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of Party A as such a subsidiary intermediary is revoked under subsection (5) (subsection (5) revocation). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 28)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: The approval of the attachment of Party A to that other person is revoked at the time the subsection (5) revocation takes effect. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may specify a date for the purposes of this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must publish the date in any manner that it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ChargeablePeriod
def.leadIn: chargeable period (收費期), in relation to a person who is a registered intermediary, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period beginning on the date of the registration of the person as such registered intermediary and ending immediately before the specified date next following; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each successive period of 12 months;

subsection.def: specified date (指明日期) means the date specified by the Authority under subsection (6)(a).

section.name: s34ZO
section.heading: Annual return

subsection.content: A person who is a registered intermediary must deliver to the Authority for every reporting period a return in the specified form. The return for a reporting period must be delivered within 1 month after the last day of the reporting period.
Subsection (1) applies to a reporting period that begins on or after the date of the registration of the person as such registered intermediary.

The Authority may suspend the registration of the person as a registered intermediary for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, determined by the Authority if the person fails to deliver to the Authority the return for a reporting period to which subsection (1) applies within 3 months after the last day of the reporting period.

The power under subsection (3) is not exercisable unless the Authority has, by notice in writing given to the registered intermediary at least 15 working days before the suspension is to take effect, informed the registered intermediary of the contents of this section.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority suspends the registration of a person as a registered intermediary under subsection (3) for failing to deliver a return, the Authority may revoke that registration if the person has not delivered to the Authority the return—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 30 days after the suspension takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within any longer period that the Authority may specify in a notice in writing given to the registered intermediary.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5B) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person (Party A) is a subsidiary intermediary attached to another person who is a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of Party A as such a subsidiary intermediary is revoked under subsection (5) (subsection (5) revocation). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 29)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: The approval of the attachment of Party A to that other person is revoked at the time the subsection (5) revocation takes effect. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 29)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may specify a date for the purposes of this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must publish the date in any manner that it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ReportingPeriod
def.leadIn: reporting period (報告期) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period of 12 months beginning on the date specified by the Authority under subsection (6)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each successive period of 12 months.

section.name: s34ZP
section.heading: Continuing training

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, in relation to individuals who are subsidiary intermediaries or a class of subsidiary intermediaries, specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the training that is to be undertaken by those individuals; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time within which the training is to be completed by those individuals,

subsection.continued: as the Authority considers necessary for ensuring that those individuals will be able to comply with the performance requirements.

subsection.content: If the Authority is satisfied that an individual has failed to complete the training specified under subsection (1)(a) within the time specified under subsection (1)(b), the Authority may give the individual a notice in writing requiring the individual to complete the training within 30 days beginning on the date on which the notice is given or any longer period specified in the notice.

The Authority may suspend the registration of an individual as a subsidiary intermediary for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, determined by the Authority, if the Authority is satisfied that the individual has failed to comply with a notice given under subsection (2).

If, within 30 days after the suspension takes effect, the individual has not complied with the requirement set out in the notice given under subsection (2), the Authority may revoke the registration of the person as a subsidiary intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (6) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual is a subsidiary intermediary attached to another person who is a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of the individual as such a subsidiary intermediary is revoked under subsection (4) (subsection (4) revocation). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 30)

subsection.content: The approval of the attachment of the individual to that other person is revoked at the time the subsection (4) revocation takes effect. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 30)

division.name: D7
division.heading: Inspection and Investigation concerning Failure to Comply with Performance Requirement

section.name: s34ZQ
section.heading: Initiating inspection powers for monitoring compliance

subsection.leadIn: A frontline regulator of a regulated person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may exercise the powers under section 34ZR for the purpose of ascertaining any matter specified in subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may direct a prescribed person to ascertain any specified matter with those powers.

subsection.leadIn: The following matters are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the regulated person has complied, or has failed to comply, with the performance requirements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not the regulated person is complying, or is failing to comply, with those requirements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether or not the regulated person is likely, or is unlikely, to be able to comply with those requirements.

subsection.leadIn: If a frontline regulator directs a person under subsection (1)(b) to ascertain any specified matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the frontline regulator must provide the person with a copy of the direction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person must, before imposing a requirement under section 34ZR on another person, produce a copy of the direction to that other person.

subsection.content: Even though a frontline regulator has directed a person under subsection (1)(b) to ascertain any specified matter, the frontline regulator may still exercise the powers under section 34ZR for the purpose of ascertaining the specified matter.

section.name: s34ZR
section.heading: Inspection powers

subsection.leadIn: An inspector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may enter at any reasonable time any place of business of the regulated person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may inspect any business record of the regulated person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may make copies or otherwise record details of any business record of the regulated person; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: may make inquiries of the regulated person, or a person specified in subsection (5)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: concerning any business record of the regulated person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: concerning any transaction or activity that was undertaken in the course of, or may affect, the business conducted by the regulated person.

subsection.leadIn: In exercising a power under subsection (1)(b) or (c), the inspector may require the regulated person, or a person specified in subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to give the inspector access to any business record of the regulated person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce to the inspector, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, any business record of the regulated person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to answer any question regarding any business record of the regulated person.

subsection.leadIn: In exercising a power under subsection (1)(d), the inspector may require the regulated person, or the specified person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to give the inspector access to any business record of the regulated person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce to the inspector, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, any business record of the regulated person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to answer any question raised for the purposes of subsection (1)(d).

subsection.content: The power under subsection (1)(d) or (2) is not exercisable in relation to a specified person unless the inspector has reasonable cause to believe that the information or record sought under that subsection cannot be obtained by exercising the power in relation to the regulated person.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsections (1)(d) and (2) is a person whom the inspector has reasonable cause to believe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has information relating to any business record of the regulated person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in possession of any business record of the regulated person.

subsection.content: If a person gives an answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1), (2) or (3), the inspector may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, the answer by a statutory declaration.

If, for the reason that the information concerned is not within the person’s knowledge or possession, a person does not give any answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1), (2) or (3), the inspector may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, that reason and fact by a statutory declaration.
This section is subject to section 34ZZB(1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: BusinessRecord
def.leadIn: business record (業務紀錄), in relation to a regulated person, means any record or document relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the business conducted by the regulated person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any transaction or activity that was undertaken in the course of, or may affect, the business conducted by the regulated person.

section.name: s34ZS
section.heading: Inspection powers exercisable in relation to former regulated person

subsection.content: An industry regulator may exercise the powers under section 34ZR for the purpose of ascertaining whether or not a person who was a regulated person of which the industry regulator was formerly the frontline regulator has complied, or has failed to comply, with the performance requirements at any time during the period the industry regulator was the frontline regulator of the person.

An industry regulator may direct any prescribed person to ascertain, with those powers, whether or not a person who was a regulated person of which the industry regulator was formerly the frontline regulator has complied, or has failed to comply, with the performance requirements at any time during the period the industry regulator was the frontline regulator of the person.
This Part is to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s34ZT
section.heading: Initiating investigation powers for suspected non-compliance

subsection.leadIn: If a frontline regulator of a regulated person has reasonable cause to believe that the regulated person may have failed to comply with a performance requirement, the frontline regulator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may exercise the powers under section 34ZU for the purpose of investigating the failure or the question whether or not there has been such a failure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may in writing direct a prescribed person to investigate, with those powers, the failure or the question whether or not there has been such a failure.

subsection.leadIn: If a frontline regulator directs a person under subsection (1)(b) in relation to an investigation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the frontline regulator must provide the person with a copy of the direction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person must, before imposing a requirement under section 34ZU on another person, produce a copy of the direction to that other person.

subsection.content: Before a frontline regulator, or a person directed by a frontline regulator under subsection (1)(b), imposes a requirement under section 34ZU on another person who is a Type A or Type B regulatee of an industry regulator that is not the frontline regulator, the frontline regulator or the person so directed must consult the industry regulator.

Even though a frontline regulator has directed a person under subsection (1)(b) in relation to an investigation, the frontline regulator may still exercise the powers under section 34ZU for the purpose of the investigation.

section.name: s34ZU
section.heading: Investigation powers

subsection.leadIn: An investigator may, in writing, require a person specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to produce, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, any record or document specified in the requirement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is or may be relevant to any matter under investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that is in the person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to attend before the investigator at the time and place specified in the requirement, and answer any question relating to any matter under investigation that the investigator may raise with the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to respond to any written question relating to any matter under investigation that the investigator may raise with the person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to give the investigator any assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person whom the frontline regulator has reasonable cause to believe may have failed to comply with a performance requirement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person whom the investigator has reasonable cause to believe—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be in possession of any record or document that contains, or that is likely to contain, information relevant to any matter under investigation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to be otherwise in possession of such information.

subsection.content: If a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1)(a), the investigator may require the person to give an explanation or further particulars in respect of the record or document.

If a person gives any answer, response, explanation or particulars in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1) or (3), the investigator may, in writing, require the person to verify within the time specified in the requirement, the answer, response, explanation or particulars by a statutory declaration.

If, for the reason that the information concerned is not within the person’s knowledge or possession, a person does not give any answer, response, explanation or particulars in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (1) or (3), the investigator may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, that reason and fact by a statutory declaration.
This section is subject to section 34ZZB(2).

section.name: s34ZV
section.heading: Investigation powers exercisable in relation to former regulated persons

subsection.leadIn: If an industry regulator has reasonable cause to believe that a person who was a regulated person of which the industry regulator was formerly a frontline regulator may have failed to comply with a performance requirement at any time during the period the industry regulator was the frontline regulator of the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the industry regulator may exercise the powers under section 34ZU for the purpose of investigating the failure or the question whether or not there has been such a failure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the industry regulator may direct a prescribed person to investigate, with those powers, the failure or the question whether or not there has been such a failure.

subsection.content: This Part is to be construed accordingly.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Disciplinary Order for Failure to Comply with Performance Requirements

section.name: s34ZW
section.heading: Authority may make disciplinary order

subsection.content: The Authority may make any disciplinary order under subsection (3), (4), (5) or (6) against a regulated person if the Authority is satisfied that the regulated person has failed to comply with a performance requirement.

The Authority may make any disciplinary order under subsection (3) or (4) against a regulated person if the regulated person is convicted of an offence under this Ordinance or any subsidiary legislation under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If the regulated person is a registered intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may order that the registration of the person as such registered intermediary be revoked; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: may order that the person be disqualified from being registered as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities, or as an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for a principal intermediary to which the person is to be attached, for a period determined by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority may order that the registration of the person as such registered intermediary be suspended for a period determined by the Authority.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3B) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a regulated person is a subsidiary intermediary attached to another person who is a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration of the regulated person as such a subsidiary intermediary is revoked under subsection (3)(a)(i) (subsection (3) revocation). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 31)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: The approval of the attachment of the regulated person to that other person is revoked at the time the subsection (3) revocation takes effect. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: If the regulated person is a responsible officer of a principal intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may order that the approval of the individual as such responsible officer be revoked; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: may order that the person be disqualified from being approved as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to a principal intermediary for a period determined by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority may order that the approval of the individual as such responsible officer be suspended for a period determined by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may order that the regulated person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be publicly reprimanded; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be privately reprimanded.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may order the regulated person to pay a pecuniary penalty not exceeding whichever is the greater amount of the following—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 3 times the amount of the profit gained or loss avoided by the regulated person as a result of the failure.

subsection.leadIn: A power to make a disciplinary order against a regulated person under subsection (1) for a failure to comply with a performance requirement is only exercisable if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the frontline regulator of the regulated person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has exercised the powers under section 34ZU for the purpose of investigating the failure or the question whether or not there has been such a failure; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in considering the matters specified in subsection (8), the Authority has regard to the information—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: obtained by the frontline regulator or such a person from the investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: disclosed to the Authority for the purpose of assisting or enabling the Authority to consider those matters; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority complies with section 34ZZ before making the disciplinary order.

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (7)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the regulated person has failed to comply with the performance requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: what disciplinary order is to be made against the regulated person.

subsection.content: If the Authority exercises a power under subsection (1) or (2) to make a disciplinary order against a regulated person, the Authority may disclose to the public details of the decision, including the reasons for it and any material facts of the case.
The Authority must pay any pecuniary penalty paid to or recovered by it under a disciplinary order into the general revenue.

In this section, a reference to a person being disqualified from registration or approval, or a registration or approval being suspended, for a period determined by the Authority includes the person being so disqualified, or the registration or approval being suspended, until the occurrence of an event determined by the Authority.

section.name: s34ZX
section.heading: When disciplinary order takes effect

subsection.content: This section applies if the Authority makes a disciplinary order against a regulated person.

If, before the expiry of the period prescribed by the regulations for making an appeal, the regulated person gives the Authority a notice in writing that the person will not appeal against the decision, the disciplinary order takes effect when the notice is given.
If the regulated person does not appeal against the decision within the period prescribed by the regulations for making an appeal, the disciplinary order takes effect when that period expires.

subsection.leadIn: If the regulated person appeals against the decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the appeal is withdrawn, the disciplinary order takes effect at the time of the withdrawal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the decision is upheld on appeal, the disciplinary order takes effect at the time it is upheld; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the decision is varied on appeal, the disciplinary order as varied takes effect at the time of the variation.

subsection.content: Despite subsections (2), (3) and (4), if the Authority considers appropriate, the disciplinary order takes effect at a time determined by the Authority. The Authority must give the regulated person a notice in writing of the time so determined.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether or not a disciplinary order should take effect at a time determined by the Authority, the Authority must have regard—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to the maintenance of public confidence—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the operation of registered schemes; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the operation of the retirement schemes industry in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the public interest.

section.name: s34ZY
section.heading: Further action by Authority

subsection.content: If the Authority is satisfied that a regulated person has failed to comply with a performance requirement and intends to make a disciplinary order against a regulated person under section 34ZW, it may, by agreement with the regulated person, take any further action, whether in place of or in addition to any disciplinary order, in respect of the regulated person that it considers appropriate in the circumstances of the case.

subsection.leadIn: A power to take further action in respect of a regulated person under subsection (1) for a failure to comply with a performance requirement is only exercisable if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the frontline regulator of the regulated person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has exercised the powers under section 34ZU for the purpose of investigating the failure or the question whether or not there has been such a failure; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has directed a person under section 34ZT(1)(b) to investigate, with those powers, the failure or the question whether or not there has been such a failure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in considering the matters specified in subsection (3), the Authority has regard to the information—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: obtained by the frontline regulator or such a person from the investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: disclosed to the Authority for the purpose of assisting or enabling the Authority to consider those matters;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority considers it appropriate to exercise the power, having regard to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the operation of registered schemes; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in the operation of the retirement schemes industry in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the public interest; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), the Authority complies with section 34ZZ before taking the further action.

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the regulated person has failed to comply with the performance requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: what further action is to be taken in respect of the regulated person.

subsection.content: The Authority is not required to comply with section 34ZZ(2)(b) for the purposes of subsection (2)(d) if the regulated person so agrees. In that case, section 34ZZ(3)(c) does not apply.

section.name: s34ZZ
