section.heading: Procedural requirement for Authority before making disciplinary order or taking further action

subsection.content: This section applies if the Authority forms a preliminary view that it should make a disciplinary order against, or take further action under section 34ZY in respect of, the regulated person.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must give the regulated person a notice in writing of the preliminary view and the reasons for it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must give the regulated person an opportunity to make oral or written representations, or both, on the preliminary view and the reasons for it.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2)(a) must also include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of the disciplinary order or further action proposed to be made or taken;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of the time at which the disciplinary order is proposed to take effect in accordance with section 34ZX; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a statement describing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the right of the regulated person to make representations; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: how and when the regulated person may make representations.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a), a notice under subsection (2)(a) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a disciplinary order under section 34ZW(3) or (4), particulars of the duration and terms of the proposed revocation, disqualification or suspension;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a disciplinary order under section 34ZW(5), particulars of the terms of the proposed reprimand; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a disciplinary order under section 34ZW(6), the amount of the proposed pecuniary penalty and the proposed period within which that penalty must be paid.

section.name: s34ZZA
section.heading: Application of disciplinary powers in relation to former regulated person

subsection.content: This section applies to a power that is exercisable by the Authority under section 34ZW or 34ZY in relation to a person who is a regulated person, in connection with the person’s failure to comply with a performance requirement.

The power is also exercisable by the Authority in relation to the person if the person was a regulated person at the time of the failure, regardless of whether the person is a regulated person when the power is being exercised.
This Part is to be construed accordingly.

division.name: D9
division.heading: Miscellaneous

section.name: s34ZZB
section.heading: Inspection and investigation powers in relation to certain entity

subsection.leadIn: An inspector has no power under section 34ZR to require an entity specified in subsection (3) to disclose any information, or to produce any record or document, relating to the affairs of a customer of the entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the inspector is a relevant authority of the entity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the inspector is satisfied that the disclosure or production is necessary for the purpose of ascertaining any matter specified in section 34ZQ(2) and so certifies in writing to the entity.

subsection.leadIn: An investigator has no power under section 34P or 34ZU to require an entity specified in subsection (3) to disclose any information, or to produce any record or document, relating to the affairs of a customer of the entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the investigator is a relevant authority of the entity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: unless—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the customer is a person whom the investigator has reasonable cause to believe may be able to give information relevant to the matter under investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the investigator is satisfied that the disclosure or production is necessary for the purpose of the investigation and so certifies in writing to the entity.

subsection.leadIn: The entity is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized financial institution;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an insurer authorized under the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 125)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance agency as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41); or (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 125)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance broker company as defined by section 2(1) of the Insurance Ordinance (Cap. 41). (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 125)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantAuthority
def.leadIn: relevant authority (有關主管當局)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an entity specified in subsection (3)(a), means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an entity specified in subsection (3)(b), means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person directed by the Securities and Futures Commission under section 34O(2)(b), 34ZQ(1)(b) or 34ZT(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an entity specified in subsection (3)(c), (d) or (e), means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Insurance Authority; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person directed by the Insurance Authority under section 34O(2)(b), 34ZQ(1)(b) or 34ZT(1)(b).

section.name: s34ZZC
section.heading: Offences relating to sections 34P, 34ZR and 34ZU

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the person.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the person, the person produces any record or document, or gives an answer or response, or gives any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material respect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document, or the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars, are false or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the person, the person, with intent to defraud, produces any record or document, or gives an answer or response, or gives any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if, being an officer or employee of a company, the person, with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes or allows the company to fail to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: causes or allows the company, in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the company, to produce any record or document, or give an answer or response, or give any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed under section 34P or 34ZU on the person only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against a person under subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) in respect of a conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings have previously been instituted against the person for the purposes of section 34ZZD(3)(b) in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those proceedings remain pending, or by reason of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person for the purposes of section 34ZZD(3)(b) in respect of the same conduct.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (4) or (5) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified requirement (指明要求) means a requirement imposed under section 34P, 34ZR or 34ZU.

section.name: s34ZZD
section.heading: Court to inquire into failure to comply with inspection or investigation requirement

subsection.content: A person specified in subsection (2) may, by originating summons, apply to the Court for an inquiry into any person’s failure to comply with a requirement imposed under section 34P, 34ZR or 34ZU.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of section 34P or 34ZU, an investigator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of section 34ZR, an inspector.

subsection.leadIn: On such application, the Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the requirement, order the person to comply with the requirement within the period specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person and, if applicable, that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: An originating summons under subsection (1) is to be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no proceedings may be instituted against a person for the purposes of subsection (3)(b) in respect of any conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 34ZZC(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those criminal proceedings remain pending, or by reason of the previous institution of those criminal proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under section 34ZZC(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s34ZZE
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.leadIn: If an investigator requires a person to give an answer or response to any question, or to give an explanation or further particulars, under section 34P or 34ZU, the investigator must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the question and the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an investigator requires a person to give an answer or response to any question, or to give an explanation or further particulars, under section 34P or 34ZU; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars, might tend to incriminate the person, and the person so claims before giving the answer or response or giving the explanation or particulars,

subsection.continued: the requirement, as well as the question and the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those specified in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The criminal proceedings are those in which the person is charged with an offence under section 34ZZC(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars.

section.name: s34ZZF
section.heading: Magistrate’s warrant

subsection.leadIn: If a magistrate is satisfied on information on oath laid by a person specified in subsection (2) that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that there is, or is likely to be, on premises specified in the information any record or document that may be required to be produced under section 34P, 34ZR or 34ZU, the magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing a person set out in the warrant, and such other person as may be necessary to assist in the execution of the warrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter the premises, if necessary by force, at any time within the period of 7 days beginning on the date of the warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to search for, seize and remove any record or document that the person so set out has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under section 34P, 34ZR or 34ZU, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of section 34P or 34ZU, an investigator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of section 34ZR, an inspector.

subsection.leadIn: If a relevant person has reasonable cause to believe that another person on the premises is employed, or engaged to provide a service, in connection with a business that is or has been conducted on the premises, the relevant person may require that other person to produce for examination any record or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is in the possession of that other person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the relevant person has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under section 34P, 34ZR or 34ZU, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: A relevant person may, in relation to any record or document required to be produced under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit any person found on the premises from—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: removing the record or document from the premises;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: erasing anything from, adding anything to or otherwise altering anything in, the record or document; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: otherwise interfering in any manner with, or causing or permitting any other person to interfere with, the record or document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: take any other step that appears to the relevant person to be necessary for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: preserving the record or document; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: preventing interference with the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: Any record or document removed under this section may be retained for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period not exceeding 6 months beginning on the day of its removal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the record or document is or may be required for any criminal proceedings or for any other proceedings under this Part, such longer period as may be necessary for the purpose of those proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: If a relevant person removes any record or document under this section, the relevant person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must as soon as practicable after the removal give a receipt for the record or document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may permit any person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document but for the removal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to inspect it; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to make copies or otherwise record details of it at all reasonable times.

subsection.content: Section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies to any property that has by virtue of this section come into the possession of an investigator or inspector, as it applies to property that has come into the possession of the police.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement or prohibition under subsection (3) or (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obstructs a relevant person in the exercise of any power conferred by subsection (3) or (4).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (8) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant person (有關人士) means a person authorized by a warrant issued under subsection (1) to carry out the acts mentioned in paragraphs (a) and (b) of that subsection.

section.name: s34ZZG
section.heading: Registration or approval revocable on request
section.content: The Authority may revoke the registration of a person as a principal intermediary or subsidiary intermediary, or the approval of the attachment of a person to a principal intermediary, or the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary, at the request of the person or individual.

section.name: s34ZZH
section.heading: Notice of revocation, suspension, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: suspends or revokes the registration of a person as a registered intermediary under Division 5 or 6;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revokes the approval of a person as a responsible officer of a principal intermediary under section 34ZK; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: makes a disciplinary order against a person under section 34ZW.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must give the person a notice in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the suspension or revocation, or the disciplinary order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement of reasons for the suspension or revocation, or for the disciplinary order.

section.name: s34ZZI
section.heading: Effect of revocation and suspension

subsection.content: A revocation or suspension under this Part of the registration of a person as a registered intermediary does not affect any agreement, transaction or arrangement entered into by the person as such registered intermediary.

A revocation or suspension under this Part of the approval of the attachment of a person to a principal intermediary does not affect any agreement, transaction or arrangement entered into by the person as a subsidiary intermediary attached to the principal intermediary.

section.name: s34ZZJ
section.heading: Payment by Authority to industry regulator in relation to expenditure or cost for services

subsection.content: The Authority may pay to an industry regulator an amount that in the Authority’s opinion represents the expenditure or cost incurred, or likely to be incurred, by the industry regulator in providing the services or performing the functions under this Part.
A payment under subsection (1) is to be paid from the MPFA Administration Account.

section.name: s34ZZK
section.heading: Transitional and saving provisions
section.content: Schedule 5B has effect.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Appeal Board

subsection.content: Any person aggrieved by any decision specified in Schedule 6 may appeal to an Appeal Board called in English the “Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Appeal Board” and in Chinese “強制性公積金計劃上訴委員會”. An appeal must be made within the period prescribed by the regulations. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

The Chief Executive shall appoint a person to be the Chairman of the Appeal Board and such other person or such number of other persons as he thinks fit to be the Deputy Chairman or Deputy Chairmen of the Appeal Board. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)
Subject to subsection (7), the Chairman or any Deputy Chairman shall be appointed for a term of not more than 2 years but may be reappointed.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: A person appointed under subsection (2) to be the Chairman of the Appeal Board must be—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a former judge or a former deputy judge of the Court of First Instance. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: A person appointed under subsection (2) to be the Deputy Chairman, or one of the Deputy Chairmen, of the Appeal Board must be a solicitor or barrister admitted under the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159). (Amended 16 of 2012 s. 14)
The Chief Executive shall appoint a panel of persons whom he considers suitable for appointment under section 36 as members of the Appeal Board. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2; 16 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: The panel of persons appointed under subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not include any public officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must include—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at least 1 but not more than 2 persons who, in the Chief Executive’s opinion, represent the interests of both Type A regulatees and Type B regulatees within the meaning of Part 4A; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at least 1 but not more than 2 persons who, in the Chief Executive’s opinion, represent the interests of relevant employees. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 14)

subsection.content: An appointment under subsection (2) or (5) shall be notified in the Gazette.
The Chairman and any Deputy Chairman or person appointed under subsection (5) may at any time resign by notice in writing to the Chief Executive. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

The Chairman and any Deputy Chairman or person appointed under subsection (5) shall be remunerated out of money provided by the Legislative Council for that purpose at a rate that the Financial Secretary may determine.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Constitution and powers of Appeal Board

subsection.content: The Appeal Board shall consist of the Chairman or any Deputy Chairman who shall preside at the hearing and such number of persons, not being fewer than 2, from the panel referred to in section 35(5) as the Chairman may appoint to be members of the Appeal Board to hear any appeal.

In relation to the hearing of appeals every question before the Appeal Board shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of the members hearing the appeal except a question of law which shall be determined by the Chairman or (where appropriate) the Deputy Chairman and in the case of an equality of votes the Chairman or Deputy Chairman shall have a casting vote.

subsection.leadIn: In hearing an appeal the Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive and consider any material, whether by way of oral evidence, written statements, documents or otherwise, and whether or not it would be admissible in a court of law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing signed by the Chairman, summon any person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to produce to it any document that is relevant to the appeal and is in his custody or under his control; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to appear before it and to give evidence relevant to the appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: administer oaths and affirmations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require evidence to be given on oath or affirmation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: make an award of such sum, if any, in respect of the costs involved in the appeal as is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case.

subsection.content: After hearing an appeal made in respect of any decision specified in Schedule 6 the Appeal Board may uphold, vary or quash that decision and make such consequential orders as may be necessary.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Appeal Board’s decision is final
section.content: Subject to section 39, the determination of an appeal by the Appeal Board or any order as to costs made by the Appeal Board shall be final.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Supplementary provisions relating to appeals

subsection.content: The procedure and practice of the Appeal Board shall, subject to this Ordinance, be determined by the Chairman.

If the Chairman is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from exercising his functions, the Chief Executive may appoint any Deputy Chairman to act as Chairman and as such to exercise all the functions of the Chairman during the period of his appointment. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

If a person appointed by the Chairman under section 36(1) to hear an appeal is precluded by illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other cause from exercising his functions, the Chairman may appoint any other person from the panel referred to in section 35(5) to act in his place.

subsection.leadIn: At the hearing of an appeal, the appellant is entitled to appear in person or to be represented by any of the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a legal practitioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the appellant is a company, any of its officers or employees;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the appellant is a partnership, any of its partners or employees;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: with the leave of the Appeal Board, any other person. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: At the hearing of an appeal, the Authority is entitled to be represented by any of the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Managing Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the Authority’s employees;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a legal practitioner;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: with the leave of the Appeal Board, any other person. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: In relation to any appeal to the Appeal Board, the members of the Appeal Board, the appellant, and any witness, representative or other person appearing before the Appeal Board shall have the same privileges and immunities as they would have if the proceedings were civil proceedings before a court.
A sum awarded to the Authority under section 36(3) as costs is recoverable by the Authority in a court of competent jurisdiction as a debt due to the Authority. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)
A sum awarded against the Authority under section 36(3) as costs is recoverable from the Authority in a court of competent jurisdiction as a debt. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s39
section.heading: Case may be stated for Court of Appeal

subsection.content: The Appeal Board may refer any question of law arising in an appeal to the Court of Appeal for determination by way of case stated.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of the case, the Court of Appeal may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the question stated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remit the case to the Appeal Board, in whole or in part, for reconsideration in the light of the Court’s determination. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: Where a case is stated under subsection (1), the Appeal Board shall not determine the relevant appeal before the Court of Appeal determines the relevant point of law.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Offences relating to appeal
section.leadIn: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to attend and give evidence when required to do so by the Appeal Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to answer truthfully, and completely questions put to him by the Appeal Board; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to produce any document which he is required by the Appeal Board to produce,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Persons not to disclose certain information

subsection.leadIn: A person who obtains information in the performance of functions conferred or imposed by or under this Ordinance— (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 33)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not disclose the information to any other person, unless the disclosure is necessary in order to perform those functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not enable another person to have access to the information, except in so far as that access is necessary to allow that other person to perform functions under or for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 33)

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not prevent the disclosure of, or the provision of access to, information (not being information contained in a report referred to in section 7C(4)) in accordance with an order of a court or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prevent the disclosure of, or the provision of access to, the information by a relevant person (Party A) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure or the provision is made to another relevant person (Party B); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information is, in the opinion of Party A, necessary for Party B’s performance of functions under or for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 33)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prevent the disclosure of, or the provision of access to, the information by a prescribed person (Party C) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure or the provision is made to another prescribed person (Party D); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the disclosure or the provision is, in the opinion of Party C, necessary—

subparagraph.content: to assist Party C’s performance of functions under or for the purposes of this Ordinance; or
to facilitate Party D’s performance of functions under or for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 33)

subsection.content: A person who, without lawful authority, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant person (相關人士) means—(a)the system operator of an electronic MPF system; or(b)the approved trustee of a registered scheme. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 33)

section.name: s41A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to section 41—disclosure by system operator to approved trustees

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), section 41(1) does not prevent the system operator of an electronic MPF system from—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: otherwise disclosing the information to the approved trustee.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information is to be disclosed by the approved trustee to a person located in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person performs in that place functions that correspond to those of the Commissioner of Inland Revenue; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure by the trustee of the information to the person is for the purpose of complying with the trustee’s reporting obligation under the taxation law of that place.

section.name: s41B
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to section 41—disclosure by persons other than Authority

subsection.leadIn: Section 41(1) does not prevent a person (other than the Authority) who obtains information as described in that section from—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: disclosing the information for the purposes of sections 50B and 50C of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: disclosing the information for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Section 41(1) does not prevent the system operator of an electronic MPF system from disclosing any information obtained by the system operator as described in that section as a summary compiled from information provided by persons in accordance with this Ordinance.
However, subsection (2) applies only if the summary is compiled so as to prevent the identities and businesses of those persons from being ascertained from the summary.

subsection.leadIn: Section 41(1) does not prevent a wholly owned subsidiary from disclosing any information obtained by the subsidiary as described in that section if the disclosure is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of, or otherwise in connection with, an audit conducted, by the auditor of the subsidiary, for the subsidiary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of enabling the Director of Audit to perform, in relation to the Authority or the subsidiary, a function under section 6PA.

subsection.content: Any information disclosed under subsection (1)(c) may be used or disclosed only for the purposes mentioned in that subsection.
A person who uses or discloses any information in contravention of subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Authority may disclose certain information despite section 41

subsection.leadIn: Section 41 does not prevent the Authority from doing any of the following with respect to information obtained by it under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disclose the information as a summary compiled from information provided by persons in accordance with this Ordinance but only if the summary is compiled so as to prevent the identities and businesses of those persons from being ascertained from the summary;

paragraph.name: b
c
caa
paragraph.content: disclose the information for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance; (Added 1 of 2015 s. 9)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: disclose the information in such form as the Authority considers appropriate but only if the information has been made available to members of the public by virtue of being disclosed in any circumstances in which, or for any purpose for which, disclosure is not precluded by section 41; (Added 1 of 2008 s. 37)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (1A) and (2), disclose the information to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chief Executive;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of Occupational Retirement Schemes;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Insurance Authority;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of Inland Revenue;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data;

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: the Ombudsman;

subparagraph.name: xi
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of Companies;

subparagraph.name: xii
subparagraph.content: the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588);(Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: xiii
subparagraph.content: the Official Receiver appointed under the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);

subparagraph.name: xiv
xv
subparagraph.content: a person authorized by a person or body specified in subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), (v), (vi) or (vii); (Replaced 1 of 2015 s. 9. Amended E.R. 4 of 2019)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: disclose the information to a body specified in accordance with subsection (4), but only if the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
ii

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: disclose the information with the consent of the person from whom the information was obtained or received and, if the information relates to a different person, with the consent also of the person to whom the information relates; (Added 1 of 2008 s. 37)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: disclose the information relating to provident fund schemes or constituent funds or approved pooled investment funds, but only if the Authority considers that it could—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: promote understanding by the public of the retirement scheme industry in Hong Kong and of the benefits, risks and liabilities associated with investing in provident fund schemes or occupational retirement schemes;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: promote understanding by the public of the importance of making informed decisions relating to provident fund schemes or occupational retirement schemes, including, in particular, the importance of making informed decisions when choosing registered schemes or investing contributions or accrued benefits; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: secure an appropriate degree of protection for the public by ensuring that they have sufficient information to help them make informed decisions relating to provident fund schemes or occupational retirement schemes, including, in particular, sufficient information to help them make informed decisions when choosing registered schemes or investing contributions or accrued benefits; (Added 1 of 2008 s. 37. Amended 40 of 2021 s. 35)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: disclose the information for the purpose of, or otherwise in connection with, an audit as required by section 6P; (Added 40 of 2021 s. 35)

disclose the information for the purpose of enabling the Director of Audit to perform, in relation to the Authority or a wholly owned subsidiary, a function under section 6PA. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 35)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Authority may only disclose information under subsection (1)(d) if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in the interests of the scheme members concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure enables the exercise or performance of a function imposed or conferred by law. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 9)

subsection.content: The Authority may disclose information under subsection (1) to the Commissioner of Inland Revenue only if it is satisfied that the information is required in order to assist the Commissioner in determining a matter that the Commissioner is required or empowered to determine under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).
Subsection (1) does not authorize the disclosure of information contained in a report referred to in section 7C(4) to a person or body specified in subsection (1)(d) or (e).
The Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify a body for the purposes of subsection (1)(e).

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: The information that may be disclosed under subsection (1)(g) includes (but is not limited to) information relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the investment portfolios and investment policies of provident fund schemes, constituent funds or approved pooled investment funds;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the investment performances of provident fund schemes, constituent funds or approved pooled investment funds;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the risks associated with investing in provident fund schemes, constituent funds or approved pooled investment funds;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fees and charges payable under provident fund schemes, constituent funds or approved pooled investment funds; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the types of services available to members of provident fund schemes. (Added 1 of 2008 s. 37)

subsection.leadIn: Section 41 does not prevent the Authority from disclosing to a person located in a place outside Hong Kong information obtained by it under this Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person exercises or performs in that place functions that correspond to those of the Authority or a person or body specified in subsection (1)(d); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person is subject to adequate secrecy provisions imposed by the law of that place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the disclosure will enable or assist the person to exercise or perform the person’s official functions,

paragraph.continued: and that it is not contrary to the interests of any scheme members or the public interest that the information should be disclosed to the person.

subsection.leadIn: The information that may be disclosed under subsection (6) includes (but is not limited to) information on matters relating to the affairs of an approved trustee or a service provider—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is incorporated, or that has its principal place of business, in a place outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is incorporated in or outside Hong Kong and that is an associate of an approved trustee that is incorporated, or has its principal place of business, in that place; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that is incorporated in Hong Kong and that has, or is proposing to establish, in that place an associate that is or would be subject to supervision by that person.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (9), if information is disclosed by the operation of subsection (1) (other than paragraph (a), (ca) or (f) of that subsection), any of the following persons must not disclose the information (or any part of it) to any other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the information is so disclosed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another person obtaining or receiving the information, whether directly or indirectly, from that person. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (8) does not prevent a person from disclosing information to any other person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the disclosure—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is made by a person or body specified in subsection (1)(d)(v), (vi) or (vii), or a person authorized by any of them; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the opinion of the person or body, enables or assists the person or body to perform their functions under Part 4A;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the information (or the part of it) has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person or that other person referred to in subsection (8)(a) or (b) is a party; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with a court order, a law or a requirement made under a law. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Section 41 does not prevent the Authority from giving consent under subsection (9)(a) if it is satisfied that the disclosure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the interests of the scheme members concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enables the exercise or performance of a function imposed or conferred by law. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 9)

subsection.content: The Authority may, in disclosing information under this section or in giving consent under subsection (9)(a), impose conditions that it considers appropriate. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 9)
A person who contravenes subsection (8) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 9)

section.name: s42AA
section.heading: Insurance Authority, Monetary Authority and Securities and Futures Commission may disclose information obtained under Part 4A despite section 41

subsection.leadIn: Section 41 does not prevent an entity specified in subsection (5) from disclosing the information to another entity so specified if, in the opinion of the entity disclosing the information— (Amended 1 of 2015 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure will enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform the recipient’s functions under Part 4A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure will enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform the recipient’s functions (other than those under Part 4A) and it is not contrary to the interest of the investing public or to the public interest that the information should be so disclosed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the information should be disclosed in the interest of the investing public or in the public interest.

subsection.content: Section 41 does not prevent an entity specified in subsection (5) from disclosing the information to the Authority if, in the opinion of the entity, the disclosure will enable or assist the Authority to perform its functions.

subsection.leadIn: Section 41 does not prevent an entity specified in subsection (5) from doing any of the following with respect to information obtained by it under Part 4A—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disclose the information as a summary compiled from information provided by persons in accordance with Part 4A but only if the summary is compiled so as to prevent the identities and businesses of those persons from being ascertained from the summary;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: disclose the information in connection with any civil proceedings to which the entity is a party or with a view to bringing any such proceedings;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: disclose the information for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance; (Added 1 of 2015 s. 10)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: disclose the information in such form as the entity considers appropriate but only if the information has been made available to members of the public by virtue of being disclosed in any circumstances in which, or for any purpose for which, disclosure is not precluded by section 41;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (3A) and (4), disclose the information to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chief Executive;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Financial Secretary;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of Occupational Retirement Schemes;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the Commissioner of Inland Revenue;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: the Ombudsman;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of Companies;

subparagraph.name: ix
subparagraph.content: the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588);(Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subparagraph.name: x
subparagraph.content: the Official Receiver appointed under the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);

subparagraph.name: xi
xii
subparagraph.content: a person authorized by a person or body specified in subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii) or (iv); (Replaced 1 of 2015 s. 10. Amended E.R. 4 of 2019)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: disclose the information with the consent of the person from whom the information was obtained or received and, if the information relates to a different person, with the consent also of the person to whom the information relates.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: An entity specified in subsection (5) may only disclose information under subsection (3)(e) if, in its opinion, the disclosure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the interests of the scheme members concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enables the exercise or performance of a function imposed or conferred by law. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.content: An entity specified in subsection (5) may disclose information under subsection (3) to the Commissioner of Inland Revenue only if the entity is satisfied that the information is required in order to assist the Commissioner in determining a matter that the Commissioner is required or empowered to determine under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112). (Amended 1 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The entity specified for the purposes of this section is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (7), if information is disclosed by the operation of subsection (3) (other than paragraph (a), (d) or (f) of that subsection), any of the following persons (not being the Authority or an entity specified in subsection (5)) must not disclose the information (or any part of it) to any other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the information is so disclosed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: another person obtaining or receiving the information, whether directly or indirectly, from that person. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (6) does not prevent a person from disclosing information to any other person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the entity disclosing the information consents to the disclosure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the information (or the part of it) has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, counsel or a solicitor or other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person or that other person referred to in subsection (6)(a) or (b) is a party; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with a court order, a law or a requirement made under a law. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: Section 41 does not prevent the entity disclosing the information from giving consent under subsection (7)(a) if, in its opinion, the disclosure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the interests of the scheme members concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in the public interest; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: enables the exercise or performance of a function imposed or conferred by law. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 10)

subsection.content: The entity disclosing the information may, in disclosing information under this section or in giving consent under subsection (7)(a), impose conditions that it considers appropriate. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 10)
A person who contravenes subsection (6) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4. (Added 1 of 2015 s. 10)

section.name: s42AAB
section.heading: Specified persons may disclose certain information despite section 41

subsection.leadIn: Section 41 does not prevent a specified person from disclosing information if— (Amended 40 of 2021 s. 37)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has given written consent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following applies—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person to whom the information relates has given written consent;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the information is disclosed in a manner that prevents particulars relating to the identity of the person to whom the information relates from being ascertained from the information.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may give consent only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information is to be disclosed to a person located in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person exercises or performs in that place functions that correspond to those of the Commissioner of Inland Revenue; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the disclosure will enable or assist the person to exercise or perform the person’s official functions.

subsection.content: The Authority may, in giving consent, impose conditions that it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an administrator as defined by section 2(1) of the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426);(b)an approved trustee of a registered scheme; or(c)a relevant employer of an occupational retirement scheme. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 37)

section.name: s42AB
section.heading: Person not to disclose information obtained in the course of inspection, investigation or disciplinary action

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person on whom a requirement under section 34P, 34ZR or 34ZU has been imposed by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Authority or a person directed by the Authority under section 34O(1)(a)(ii); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an industry regulator or a person directed by an industry regulator under section 34O(2)(b), 34ZQ(1)(b) or 34ZT(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who has been given a notice under section 34ZZ(2)(a) or 34ZZH(2).

subsection.leadIn: The person specified in subsection (1)(a) must not disclose any information obtained in the course of the requirement being imposed, or in the course of a compliance or purported compliance with the requirement, to any other person unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following consents to the disclosure—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a)(i), the Authority;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(a)(ii), the industry regulator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the conditions specified in subsection (4) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified in subsection (1)(b) must not disclose any information obtained from the notice, or from any communication with the Authority in relation to the subject matter of the notice, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority consents to the disclosure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the conditions specified in subsection (4) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for the purposes of subsections (2)(b) and (3)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information has already been made available to the public by virtue of being disclosed in any circumstances in which, or for any purpose for which, disclosure is not precluded by section 41;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for the purpose of seeking advice from, or giving advice by counsel, a solicitor, or any other professional advisor, acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under a provision of Part 4A;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person is a party; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in accordance with an order of a court, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.content: The Authority or industry regulator may impose any conditions that it considers appropriate on a consent given by it for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) or (3)(a).
A person who contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s42A
section.heading: Protection for auditors and service providers

subsection.leadIn: An auditor or a service provider appointed or engaged by an approved trustee under this Ordinance does not contravene a duty owed by the auditor or service provider in law only because the auditor or service provider has given to the Authority in good faith information, an opinion or a document concerning a matter if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the auditor or service provider became aware of the matter in the auditor’s or service provider’s capacity as such; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the matter is relevant to a function of the Authority under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) has effect with respect to information, an opinion or a document given to the Authority whether or not it is given in response to a request of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a person whose appointment or engagement as an auditor or service provider has ceased; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to an auditor or service provider who was appointed by a trustee whose approval has been revoked.

section.name: s42B
section.heading: Immunity

subsection.content: No civil liability shall be incurred by the Authority, a director of the Authority or an employee of the Authority in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by the Authority, director or employee (as the case requires) in good faith in the performance or purported performance of any function under this Ordinance or any other enactment. (Amended 16 of 2012 s. 16)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: No civil liability is incurred by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a wholly owned subsidiary (other than a specified entity); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director or employee of the subsidiary,

subsection.continued: in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by the subsidiary, director or employee (as the case requires) in good faith in the performance or purported performance of any function delegated to the subsidiary under section 6F. (Added 16 of 2020 s. 10)

subsection.content: No civil liability is incurred by an entity specified in subsection (3), or a director or employee of such an entity, or a person directed by such an entity under section 34O(2)(b), 34ZQ(1)(b) or 34ZT(1)(b), in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by the entity, director, employee or person (as the case requires) in good faith in the performance or purported performance of any function under Part 4A. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: The entity is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Insurance Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: No civil liability is incurred by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified entity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director or employee of the specified entity,

subsection.continued: in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, by the entity, director or employee (as the case requires) in good faith in the performance or purported performance of the functions mentioned in subsection (5). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 38)

subsection.leadIn: The functions are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to perform a function delegated under section 6F(2) by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to comply with a direction or instruction given by the Authority to the specified entity (as the system operator of an electronic MPF system). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 38)

subsection.content: In subsection (5)(c), a reference to a direction or instruction includes a direction or instruction under section 6E(1)(ec)(ii). (Added 40 of 2021 s. 38)

section.sourceNote: (Added 2 of 2002 s. 15. Amended E.R. 1 of 2013; 40 of 2021 s. 38)

section.name: s43
section.heading: Offence for unapproved person to carry on business as approved trustee, etc.

subsection.content: A person must not act as, or purport to carry on business as, an approved trustee unless the person is approved as a trustee under section 20.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not administer, or purport to administer, a provident fund scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is an approved trustee or has been appointed under section 33A(3) as administrator of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scheme is registered under section 21 or 21A.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: However, subsection (2) does not apply to the system operator of an electronic MPF system or a person engaged by the system operator for providing scheme administration services to approved trustees. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 39)

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $100,000 for each day on which the offence is continued; or (Replaced 1 of 2015 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for each day on which the offence is continued. (Replaced 1 of 2015 s. 12)

section.name: s43A
section.heading: Offences by approved trustees

subsection.leadIn: An approved trustee of a registered scheme commits an offence if the trustee, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pays the accrued benefits of a scheme member otherwise than in the circumstances permitted by or under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to pay accrued benefits of a scheme member in accordance with an entitlement conferred by or under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: An approved trustee of a registered scheme who invests the accrued benefits of scheme members in restricted investments in contravention of section 29 commits an offence.
An approved trustee who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement of section 14(3) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: An approved trustee who is convicted of an offence against this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence.

section.name: s43B
section.heading: Offences by employers

subsection.content: An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on employers by section 7 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years and, in the case of an offence consisting of a failure by the employer to comply with the requirement imposed by section 7(1A), to a daily penalty of $500 for each day on which the offence is continued. (Replaced 18 of 2008 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), an employer does not have a reasonable excuse for failing to comply with a requirement imposed by section 7 by reason only that the relevant employee’s not becoming or continuing to be a member of a registered scheme was wholly or partly due to the fault of the employee. (Added 18 of 2008 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 7A(1), (2) or (7) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence. (Added 18 of 2008 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 7A(8) commits an offence and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where he has deducted any amount from the employee’s relevant income for the contribution period concerned as the employee’s contribution and the total amount of contribution paid in respect of the employee to the approved trustee for that contribution period is less than the amount so deducted, liable on conviction to a fine of $450,000 and to imprisonment for 4 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $700 for each day on which the offence is continued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $500 for each day on which the offence is continued. (Added 18 of 2008 s. 3. Amended 16 of 2012 s. 17)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 7AA(2), (3) or (6) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence. (Added 18 of 2008 s. 11)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.leadIn: An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with section 7AA(7) commits an offence and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where he has deducted any amount from the employee’s relevant income for the contribution period concerned as the employee’s contribution and the total amount of contribution paid in respect of the employee to the Authority for that contribution period is less than the amount so deducted, liable on conviction to a fine of $450,000 and to imprisonment for 4 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $700 for each day on which the offence is continued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $500 for each day on which the offence is continued. (Added 18 of 2008 s. 11. Amended 16 of 2012 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement of section 14(4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction— (Amended 18 of 2008 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence. (Amended 18 of 2008 s. 3)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, the employer fails to pay to the Authority any sum payable under the order at the end of 14 days after the date by which the sum must be paid to the Authority under the order,

subsection.continued: the employer commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $500 for each day on which the offence is continued. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 17)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3A), a reference to a sum payable under an order includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any part of a sum payable under the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a sum payable by instalments, any instalment or any part of an instalment. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 17)

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings may be instituted for an offence against this section within 6 months after the offence is discovered by, or comes to the notice of, the Authority. (Added 29 of 2002 s. 11. Amended 1 of 2008 s. 42)

section.name: s43BA
section.heading: Court may make certain orders in proceedings for offences under section 43B

subsection.content: Where an employer is convicted by a court of an offence against section 43B(1), the court may, in addition to any penalty imposed under that section, make an order requiring the employer to procure for the employee concerned membership in a registered scheme within the time specified in the order.

Where an employer is acquitted by a court of an offence against section 43B(1) on the ground that there was a reasonable excuse for the default, the court may make an order requiring the employer to procure for the employee concerned membership in a registered scheme within the time specified in the order.

Where an employer is convicted by a court of an offence against section 43B(1C) or (1E), the court may, in addition to any penalty imposed under that section, make an order requiring the employer to pay any mandatory contribution or contribution surcharge that is outstanding at the time of the conviction and in respect of which the offence was committed.

Where an employer is acquitted by a court of an offence against section 43B(1C) or (1E) on the ground that there was a reasonable excuse for the default, the court may make an order requiring the employer to pay any mandatory contribution or contribution surcharge that is outstanding at the time of the acquittal and in respect of which the charge was brought.

An employer who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with an order made under this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a daily penalty of $500 for each day on which the offence is continued.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must pay any contribution or surcharge that is paid to it in respect of a relevant employee pursuant to an order made under subsection (3) or (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the employee is still employed by the employer concerned at the time the Authority makes payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employer for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the employer has not nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employee for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if neither the employer nor the employee has nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of a registered scheme that the Authority considers appropriate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the employee has ceased to be employed by the employer concerned at the time the Authority makes payment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to the approved trustee of the registered scheme nominated by the employee for this purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the employee has not nominated a registered scheme, to the approved trustee of a registered scheme that the Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.content: On receiving the contribution or surcharge paid to the approved trustee under subsection (6), the approved trustee must take actions reasonably required by the Authority with regard to the contribution or surcharge. (Replaced 40 of 2021 s. 40)

Nothing in subsection (3) or (4) affects the rights conferred on the Authority or any other person by this Ordinance or any other law to bring proceedings to recover from the employer any outstanding mandatory contribution or contribution surcharge.

section.name: s43C
section.heading: Offences by self-employed persons

subsection.leadIn: A self-employed person who is 18 years of age or over and below retirement age commits an offence if, without reasonable excuse, the person— (Amended 2 of 2002 s. 16)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to become a member of a registered scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to continue to be a member of a registered scheme; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: being a member of a registered scheme—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails to pay a mandatory contribution on time; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: pays as a mandatory contribution an amount that is less than the required amount.

subsection.leadIn: A self-employed person who is convicted of an offence against this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence.

section.name: s43D
section.heading: Offence to obstruct Authority etc. in the exercise or performance of functions

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without lawful authority, obstructs or hinders, or interferes with, a person to whom this section applies in the exercise or performance of a function conferred or imposed on that person by or under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a lawful requirement made by such a person in the course of exercising or performing such a function,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an auditor who is appointed by an approved trustee for the purposes of section 30;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an inspector appointed for the purposes of section 32.

section.name: s43E
section.heading: Offence to make false or misleading statement

subsection.leadIn: A person who, in any document given to a prescribed person in connection with this Ordinance, makes a statement that the person knows to be false or misleading in a material respect, or recklessly makes a statement which is false or misleading in a material respect, commits an offence and is liable on conviction— (Amended 1 of 2008 s. 44; 9 of 2016 s. 9; 40 of 2021 s. 41)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed person (訂明人士) means—(a)the Authority;(b)a system operator of an electronic MPF system;(c)an approved trustee;(d)a trustee of a relevant scheme; or(e)an auditor of an approved trustee or of a registered scheme; (Added 40 of 2021 s. 41)
relevant scheme (有關計劃) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of Schedule 2 to the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Exemption) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. B). (Added 9 of 2016 s. 9)

section.name: s43F
section.heading: Offence relating to pay-record

subsection.leadIn: A participating employer who, in a pay-record given to an employee, provides any information that the employer knows to be false or misleading in a material respect, or recklessly provides any information that is false or misleading in a material respect, commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence.

subsection.def: In this section, pay-record (供款紀錄) means a pay-record prepared under section 139 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s44
section.heading: Liability of officers, managers and partners

subsection.content: Where an offence under this Ordinance is committed by a company and is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, any officer, or other person concerned in the management of the company, or any person who was purporting to act in that capacity, the officer or person as well as the company commits the offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

Where an offence under this Ordinance committed by a partner is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, any other partner of the partnership, that other partner also commits the offence and is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)
