subsection.leadIn: Where an offence under section 43B(3A) is committed by a company, the offence is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to the neglect on the part of, an officer or any person who was purporting to act in that capacity if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the officer or person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was concerned in the management of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knew or ought to have known that the order in respect of which the offence was committed had been made against the company. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 18)

subsection.content: Where an offence under section 43B(3A) is committed by a company, the offence is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to the neglect on the part of, a person (other than an officer) concerned in the management of the company or any person who was purporting to act in that capacity if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the person knew or ought to have known that the order in respect of which the offence was committed had been made against the company. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: Where an offence under section 43B(3A) is committed by a partner, the offence is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to the neglect on the part of, another partner of the partnership if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the other partner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was concerned in the management of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knew or ought to have known that the order in respect of which the offence was committed had been made against the partner. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: The presumption under subsection (3), (4) or (5) is rebutted by a person charged with an offence under section 43B(3A) by virtue of that subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue that the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance and was not attributable to the person’s neglect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt. (Added 16 of 2012 s. 18)

section.name: s44A
section.heading: Proof of certain matters in proceedings for offence under section 43B(3A)

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings for an offence under section 43B(3A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of a document specified in subsection (6), and purporting to be certified by or on behalf of the registrar of a court as a true copy of the specified document, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be so certified;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be a true copy of the specified document; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the specified document is prepared by an officer of a court, is proof of its contents.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings for an offence under section 43B(3A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of any document relevant to any of the facts specified in subsections (7) and (8), and purporting to be certified by or on behalf of the registrar of a court as a true copy of the document so relevant, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be so certified;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be a true copy of the document so relevant; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the document so relevant is prepared by an officer of a court, is proof of the facts to which the document is relevant.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings for an offence under section 43B(3A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate purporting to be issued by or on behalf of the registrar of a court, and stating any of the facts specified in subsection (7), is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the certificate, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be so issued; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is proof of the facts so stated.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings for an offence under section 43B(3A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate purporting to be issued by or on behalf of the Registrar of the High Court or of the Court of Final Appeal, and stating any of the facts specified in subsection (8), is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the certificate, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be so issued; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is proof of the facts so stated.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings for an offence under section 43B(3A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate purporting to be issued by the Authority, and stating either or both of the facts specified in subsection (9), is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the certificate, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is presumed to be issued by the Authority; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is proof of the facts so stated.

subsection.leadIn: The document specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a claim filed with a court of competent jurisdiction in proceedings brought under section 18(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an order made by a court of competent jurisdiction in those proceedings; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other document relating to proceedings brought under section 18(3).

subsection.leadIn: The facts specified for the purposes of subsections (2)(a) and (3)(a) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether any payment has been made to the court in full or partial discharge of an order of the court and if so, the particulars of the payment (including the amount and date of the payment);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether a decision has been made in any proceedings to set aside or review an order of the court and, if so, the particulars of the decision;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether any proceedings are pending to set aside or review an order of the court and, if so, the particulars of the pending proceedings;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: whether any person was present—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at the hearing of the court at which an order of the court was made; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at any hearing of the claim to which the order relates; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether any document relating to the proceedings before the court has been served on any person and, if so, the particulars of service (including the mode, time and address of the service).

subsection.leadIn: The facts specified for the purposes of subsections (2)(a) and (4)(a) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a decision has been made in an appeal (if any) against an order of a court and, if so, the particulars of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether an appeal is pending against an order of a court and, if so, the particulars of the pending appeal.

subsection.leadIn: The facts specified for the purposes of subsection (5)(a) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount and date of any payment received in satisfaction of an order of a court made in proceedings brought under section 18(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the outstanding amount under such an order.

section.name: s44B
section.heading: Defence for offence under section 43A(1) or (3)

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 43A(1)(a) to establish that the payment was made only because of the failure of the system operator of the electronic MPF system to discharge the system operator’s duties.

It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 43A(1)(b) to establish that the default was only because of the failure of the system operator of the electronic MPF system to discharge the system operator’s duties.

It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 43A(3) to establish that the non-compliance was only because of the failure of the system operator of the electronic MPF system to discharge the system operator’s duties.

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence under section 43A(1)(a) or (b) or (3) is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the purpose of the relevant defence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: default (欠付權益), in relation to a person charged with an offence under section 43A(1)(b), means a failure of the person to pay accrued benefits of a scheme member in accordance with an entitlement conferred by or under this Ordinance;

relevant defence (相關免責辯護)—(a)in relation to an offence under section 43A(1)(a), means the defence under subsection (1);(b)in relation to an offence under section 43A(1)(b), means the defence under subsection (2); and(c)in relation to an offence under section 43A(3), means the defence under subsection (3).

section.name: s45
section.heading: Application and interpretation of sections 45B and 45C

subsection.leadIn: Sections 45B and 45C apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approved trustees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: participating employers; (Amended 30 of 2008 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: self-employed persons who are 18 years of age or over and below retirement age; and (Replaced 2 of 2002 s. 17. Amended 30 of 2008 s. 6)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: persons required to give information or documents under section 19C. (Added 30 of 2008 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: In sections 45B and 45C—
subsection.def: prescribed financial penalty (訂明罰款) means the amount of financial penalty prescribed by the regulations in relation to a provision referred to in section 45A(1)(a);
prescribed provision (訂明條文) means a provision of this Ordinance or of the regulations prescribed by the regulations for the purposes of those sections.

section.name: s45A
section.heading: Power to make regulations for purposes of sections 45B and 45C

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 45B and 45C, the regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prescribe a provision of this Ordinance or of the regulations that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: specifies a duty that is required to be performed, or a requirement or standard that is required to be complied with; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: requires a fee, contribution or other amount of money to be paid; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe the amount of financial penalty payable for a failure to perform the duty, or to comply with the requirement or standard, or to pay the amount of money on time; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), prescribe different amounts of financial penalties in respect of different provisions of this Ordinance and of the regulations and prescribe different amounts of financial penalties according to whether it is the first or second or a subsequent occasion on which the person concerned has failed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to perform a duty, or comply with a requirement or standard, specified in a prescribed provision; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to pay on time a fee, contribution or other amount under such a provision; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), prescribe a daily penalty for each day on which a failure to perform a duty, or to comply with a requirement or standard, specified in a prescribed provision continues. (Added 18 of 2008 s. 30)

subsection.leadIn: The maximum amount that the regulations may prescribe as a financial penalty—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for failing to perform a duty, or to comply with a requirement or standard, specified in a prescribed provision, is— (Amended 18 of 2008 s. 30)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a daily penalty, $1,000 per day; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, $50,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for failing to pay on time a fee, contribution or other amount of money payable under a prescribed provision, is $5,000 or 10 per cent of the amount, whichever is the greater.

section.name: s45B
section.heading: Authority may serve notice requiring payment of financial penalty in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may serve on a person to whom this section applies a notice in the required form if it reasonably believes that the person has failed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to perform a duty or to comply with a requirement or standard specified in a prescribed provision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to pay on time a fee, contribution or other amount of money payable under such a provision.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: However, subsection (1) does not apply if the failure occurs only because the system operator of an electronic MPF system fails to discharge the system operator’s duties under this Ordinance. (Added 40 of 2021 s. 43)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a notice is in the required form if it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alleges that the person concerned has failed to perform a duty or to comply with a requirement or standard, or to pay on time a fee, contribution or other amount of money, referred to in that subsection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specifies the prescribed financial penalty that is applicable to the alleged failure; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: states that, if within the period specified in the notice (being a period of not less than 14 days), the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pays to the Authority the prescribed financial penalty specified in the notice; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: performs the duty, or complies with the requirement or standard, or pays the fee, contribution or other amount of money,

paragraph.continued: no further action will be taken against the person in relation to the matter; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: further states that, if at the end of that period, the person has not paid the prescribed financial penalty to the Authority or has not performed the duty, or complied with the requirement or standard, or paid that fee, contribution or amount of money, civil proceedings may be brought against the person to recover the amount of the penalty.

subsection.leadIn: If a person on whom a notice is served under this section, within the specified period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pays the prescribed financial penalty to the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: performs the duty or complies with the requirement or standard, or pays the fee, contribution or amount of money, specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: no proceedings are to be brought against the person for the recovery of that penalty.

subsection.content: The fact that a person pays a financial penalty to the Authority does not absolve the person from having to perform the duty or to comply with the relevant requirement or standard specified in, or to pay the fee, contribution or amount of money payable under, the relevant prescribed provision.

section.name: s45C
section.heading: Proceedings for recovery of financial penalty

subsection.leadIn: If a person on whom a notice is served under section 45B does not, within the period specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay the prescribed financial penalty to the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: perform the duty or comply with the relevant requirement or standard specified, or pay the fee, contribution or amount of money payable under, the relevant prescribed provision,

subsection.continued: the Authority may bring proceedings in a court of competent jurisdiction for the recovery of that penalty.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of proceedings brought under this section, the court may, if satisfied that the defendant has failed to perform the duty or to comply with the requirement or standard, or to pay the fee, contribution or other amount of money, that gave rise to the proceedings, order the defendant to pay—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the prescribed financial penalty; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such smaller amount as it considers appropriate, having regard to the nature and extent of the failure.

subsection.content: It is a defence to proceedings brought under this section (other than proceedings relating to the payment of an amount of money) that it was not reasonably practicable to perform the duty, or to comply with the requirement or standard, to which the proceedings relate.

subsection.leadIn: Proceedings under this section may be brought at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 6 years after the date on which it is alleged that the relevant duty was not performed, the relevant requirement or standard was not complied with or the relevant fee, contribution or amount of money was not paid; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the failure to perform that duty, or to comply with that requirement or standard, or to pay that fee, contribution or amount has continued, within 6 years after the date on which the failure ceased.

subsection.content: The procedure and rules of evidence, and the burden of proof, applicable to civil proceedings apply to proceedings brought under this section.

In proceedings brought under this section, the court may make an order awarding costs to either party and assess the amount of those costs. An award of costs can be made against the Authority only in the circumstances in which an award of costs could be made against a prosecutor in criminal proceedings.
Failure to comply with an order made under this section is a contempt of the court.

section.name: s45D
section.heading: How financial penalty is to be dealt with when paid or recovered
section.content: A financial penalty paid under section 45B or recovered under section 45C is to be paid into the MPFA Administration Account maintained under section 6M.

section.name: s45E
section.heading: Person not liable to be proceeded against for offence and financial penalty relating to same matter

subsection.content: A person may not be charged with an offence arising out of a contravention of a provision of this Ordinance if proceedings for the recovery of a financial penalty have been brought for the same contravention.

Proceedings for the recovery of a financial penalty may not be brought against a person for a contravention of this Ordinance if the person has been charged with an offence arising out of the same contravention.

section.name: s45F
section.heading: Power of Court to make certain orders

subsection.leadIn: Whenever a person has done, is doing or is proposing to do any act or thing that constituted, constitutes or would constitute a contravention of this Ordinance, the Court may, on the application of the Authority or of any person whose interests have been, are being or would be affected by the doing of the act or thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make an order restraining the person from again doing, continuing to do or doing that act or thing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if in the opinion of the Court it is desirable to do so, make a further order requiring the person to do any act or thing.

subsection.content: Whenever a person has refused or failed, is refusing or failing, or is proposing to refuse or fail, to do any act or thing that the person is required to do by or under this Ordinance, the Court may, on the application of the Authority or of any person whose interests have been, are being or would be affected by the refusal or failure to do the act or thing, make an order requiring the person to do the act or thing.
An order under subsection (1) or (2) may be made on such terms as the Court considers appropriate.
The Court may grant an interim order pending determination of an application referred to in subsection (1) if in its opinion it is desirable to do so.
The Court may from time to time rescind or vary an order made under this section.

subsection.leadIn: The power of the Court to make an order restraining a person from again doing, continuing to do or doing an act or thing may be exercised—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not it appears to the Court that the person intends to do the act or thing again or to continue to do the act or thing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not the person has previously done the act or thing; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether or not there is imminent danger of substantial damage to any other person if the person does the act or thing.

subsection.leadIn: The power of the Court to make an order requiring a person to do an act or thing may be exercised—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not it appears to the Court that the person intends to refuse or fail again, or to continue to refuse or fail, to do the act or thing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not the person has previously refused or failed to do the act or thing; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether or not there is an imminent danger of substantial damage to any other person if the person refuses or fails to do the act or thing.

subsection.content: If an application for an order under this section is made by the Authority, the Court may not require the Authority or any other person, as a condition of making an interim order, to give any undertaking as to damages.
The Court may, in addition to or instead of making an order under this section in respect of a person, order the person to pay damages to another person.

section.name: s45G
section.heading: Right to bring civil proceedings to recover financial loss

subsection.leadIn: A person who has sustained financial loss that is attributable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a contravention of the governing rules of a registered scheme by another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the failure of another person to perform a duty, or to comply with a requirement or standard, imposed on that other person by or under this Ordinance (except Part 4A), (Amended 16 of 2012 s. 20)

subsection.continued: is entitled, by proceedings brought in a court of competent jurisdiction, to recover from that other person the amount of that loss as damages.

subsection.content: The right conferred by this section is in addition to any other right conferred by law to recover the loss or damages in respect of the loss.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations, not inconsistent with this Ordinance, for or with respect to any matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that by this Ordinance is required or permitted to be prescribed by regulations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is necessary or convenient to be prescribed for achieving the objects of this Ordinance. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Regulations may also be made under subsection (1) for all or any of the following purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for the giving of undertakings to the Authority by approved trustees and applicants for approval as trustees;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring approved trustees and persons applying for approval as such to enter into arrangements for the provision of adequate insurance against the risk of losses that are attributable to misfeasance or other illegal conduct by them or by others with respect to registered schemes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing the retirement age for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: requiring approved trustees of registered schemes to provide information to scheme members and prescribing the kind of information that is to be provided to them;

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: providing for the keeping of records (including the establishment and maintenance of registers), and the provision of information in those records; (Added 11 of 2009 s. 10)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: providing for the payment of accrued benefits to or in respect of scheme members and providing for the transfer of accrued benefits from one registered scheme to another or from one account in a registered scheme to another;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: providing for the preservation of the accrued benefits of scheme members until the occurrence of a specified event (including, but not limited to, the retirement, death, total incapacity, terminal illness or permanent departure from Hong Kong of scheme members); (Amended 1 of 2015 s. 16)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: providing for the disposal of unclaimed accrued benefits;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: providing for the operation of the compensation fund referred to in section 17;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: providing for the formulation of proper accounting systems (including the keeping of proper accounting records) with respect to registered schemes;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: prescribing requirements with which approved trustees must comply with with respect to keeping scheme member’s accounts;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: permitting approved trustees, despite section 12, to deduct from scheme members’ accounts fees for administrative expenses;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: providing for the auditing of the accounting records and financial statements of approved trustees and of registered schemes;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: prescribing the duties of auditors so appointed (including the duty of an auditor to report specified matters to the Authority in specified circumstances);

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: providing for the engagement or appointment by the approved trustee of a registered scheme of service providers to provide services for the purposes of the scheme and for the delegation of the trustee’s functions in relation to the scheme to such a service provider;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: prescribing the duties of service providers and other persons engaged or appointed by the approved trustee of a registered scheme to provide services for the purposes of the scheme (including the duty of such a service provider or other person to report specified matters to the Authority in specified circumstances);

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.leadIn: prescribing requirements that are to be complied with with respect to the funds of registered schemes, including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: requirements relating to the separation of the funds and other assets of a registered scheme from other funds and assets that are beneficially owned by employers who are participating in the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: requirements that the funds and other assets of a registered scheme are to be applied only for the purposes of the scheme; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: requirements that the funds and other assets of a registered scheme are not to be subject to any charge, pledge, lien, mortgage or other encumbrance, except in circumstances specified in the rules or by the Authority;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: requiring approved trustees of registered schemes to enter into arrangements for the scheme assets to be held by custodians and prescribing requirements to be complied with with respect to those arrangements and the qualifications of custodians;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: requiring the approved trustees of registered schemes to maintain adequate reserves so as to provide investment guarantees;

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: requiring approved trustees of registered schemes to maintain specified internal control procedures with respect to those schemes;

paragraph.name: sa
paragraph.leadIn: providing for, in relation to approved trustees that are companies—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the composition of the board of directors of those trustees and the composition of committees of those boards;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any change or proposed change of controllers of those trustees; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the objection by the Authority to the existing controllers of those trustees continuing to be such controllers; (Added 18 of 2008 s. 31)

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: requiring persons to lodge with the Authority returns containing specified kinds of information, or to provide the Authority with specified kinds of information, relevant to the exercise of the Authority’s functions;

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: providing for the service or notification of documents for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: providing for the voluntary winding up of employer sponsored schemes;

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: providing for the merger of existing registered schemes and for the division of an existing registered scheme into one or more other schemes;

paragraph.name: wa
paragraph.content: requiring the guarantor of an approved pooled investment fund, within the meaning of section 2 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A), to maintain adequate reserves so as to provide investment guarantees; (Added 2 of 2002 s. 18)

paragraph.name: x
paragraph.content: prohibiting funds of a registered scheme from being invested in pooled investment funds except as permitted by the regulations or as approved by the Authority. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: A regulation under this section may do all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: apply generally or be limited in its application by reference to specified exceptions or factors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: apply differently according to different factors of a specified kind;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorize any matter or thing to be determined, applied or regulated by any specified person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe fees for the purposes of those regulations, including fees for the granting of approvals for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: authorize the Authority to charge (on a cost recovery basis) for any service provided by the Authority. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: A regulation under this section may apply, adopt or incorporate by reference, with or without modifications, any publication (including an Ordinance or subsidiary legislation), either in force at the time of publication or as in force from time to time. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

Any regulations made under this section may prescribe offences in respect of contraventions of the regulations, and may provide for the imposition of a fine not exceeding level 6 and of imprisonment for a period not exceeding 1 year.
Regulations made under this section shall be subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Rules

subsection.content: The Authority may make rules, not inconsistent with this Ordinance or the regulations, for or with respect to any matter that by this Ordinance is required or permitted to be prescribed by the rules. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Rules may also be made under subsection (1) for all or any of the following purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for matters relating to the administration of registered schemes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing methods by which mandatory contributions must or may be paid to approved trustees of registered schemes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribing the measures to be taken by participating employers, relevant employees and self-employed persons in order to ensure that sections 7, 7A and 7C are complied with. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Rules under this section may do all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: apply generally or be limited in their application by reference to specified exceptions or factors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: apply differently according to different factors of a specified kind;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: authorize any matter or thing to be determined, applied or regulated by any specified person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe fees for the purposes of those rules. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: Any rules made under this section may prescribe offences in respect of contraventions of the rules, and may provide for the imposition of a fine not exceeding level 4 and of imprisonment for a period not exceeding 6 months.
Rules made under this section shall be subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s47A
section.heading: Authority may specify or approve forms

subsection.content: The Authority may specify or approve the form and contents of documents required for the purposes of this Ordinance.
If the Authority has specified or approved a form for the purposes of this Ordinance, strict compliance with the form is not necessary and substantial compliance is sufficient.

If a form specified or approved by the Authority for the purposes of this Ordinance requires the form to be completed in a specified way, or requires specified information to be included in or be attached to, or to accompany, the form, the form is not properly completed unless it is completed in that way, or includes or has attached to it, or is accompanied by, that information.

section.name: s47B
section.heading: Rules against perpetuities not to apply to registered schemes
section.content: The rules of law relating to perpetuities do not apply to the trusts relating to registered schemes or to the approved trustees of those schemes.

section.name: s47C
section.heading: Service of summons
section.content: Notwithstanding section 8 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227) and without limiting the generality of section 803 or 827 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), a summons relating to an offence against this Ordinance that is alleged to have been committed by any employer may be served on the employer by leaving it at, or sending it by post to, any place at which the employer carries on business.

section.name: s47D
section.heading: Time limit for prosecution

subsection.content: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings in respect of an offence (other than an indictable offence) under this Ordinance or any subsidiary legislation under this Ordinance may be brought within 3 years after the commission of the offence unless otherwise specified.

Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to proceedings in respect of an offence that was committed before the commencement date* of section 17 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (1 of 2015).

section.name: s48
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive in Council to amend Schedules

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedules 1, 1B, 2, 3, 5, 5A, 6, 7, 8 and 17 (specified schedules). (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2; 9 of 2016 s. 10)
Amendments made under this section to the specified schedules are subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Transitional provisions for 2021 Amendment Ordinance
section.content: The transitional provisions specified in Schedule 17 have effect.

td.p: Any person who is an officer to which the Pensions Ordinance (Cap. 89) applies.
Any person who is an officer to which the Pension Benefits Ordinance (Cap. 99) applies.
Any person who is an officer to which the Pension Benefits (Judicial Officers) Ordinance (Cap. 401) applies.
Any person who is a teacher to which the Grant Schools Provident Fund Rules (Cap. 279 sub. leg. C) apply.
Any person who is a teacher to which the Subsidized Schools Provident Fund Rules (Cap. 279 sub. leg. D) apply.
Any relevant employee or self-employed person who, at the date of the coming into operation of this Schedule, has attained 64 years of age.

subsection.leadIn: Any relevant employee (other than a casual employee) whose employment ceases before the 60th day after the relevant time except a relevant employee who has been employed— (Amended L.N. 224 of 2000)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for not less than 60 days after the relevant time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under a continuous contract.

subsection.leadIn: In this item—
subsection.def: continuous contract (連續性合約) has the same meaning as in section 3(1) of the Employment Ordinance (Cap. 57);

def.name: RelevantTime
def.leadIn: relevant time (有關時間), in relation to a relevant employee, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the employee is being employed on the commencement* of section 7 of this Ordinance, the time of that commencement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee is employed after that commencement, the beginning of the date on which the employment begins. (Amended 2 of 2002 s. 19)

td.p: Any employer of a person specified in items 1 to 7 and 9. (Replaced 4 of 1998 s. 2)
Any person employed in the European Union Office of the European Commission in Hong Kong.

section.name: s1
section.content: In respect of items 1 to 5 and 9, the person described in those items is an exempt person only to the extent that the relevant statutory provisions apply to his relevant income derived from employment the subject of those provisions, and not to other income (if any) derived from other sources which may be otherwise subject to the provisions of this Ordinance or to any obligation under this Ordinance in his capacity as an employer, if applicable.

section.name: s2
section.content: In respect of item 7, the relevant employee first-mentioned in that item is an exempt person only to the extent that he is under the employment first-mentioned in that item. (Replaced L.N. 225 of 2000)

section.name: s3
section.content: In respect of item 8, the employer described in that item is an exempt person only to the extent of the relevant income of persons or relevant employees described in items 1 to 7 and 9 and not to other income (if any) derived from other sources which may be otherwise subject to the provisions of this Ordinance. (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)

td.p: Any person who is a domestic employee in respect of a contract of employment as such.
Any self-employed person who is a hawker.
Any employer of a person specified in item 1.
The employer of an employee who is, because of the operation of section 4(3) of this Ordinance, exempt from the operation of this Ordinance. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: In this Part— (Amended 4 of 1998 s. 2)
section.def: hawker (小販) has the same meaning as in the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132).

section.name: s2
section.content: The persons referred to in items 1 and 2 are exempt from the operation of this Ordinance only in so far as their relevant income is derived from employment of the kind referred to in those items. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s3
section.content: An employer referred to in item 3 is exempt from the operation of this Ordinance only in respect of the relevant income of a domestic employee employed by the employer. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s4
section.content: An employer referred to in item 4 is exempt from the operation of this Ordinance only in respect of the relevant income of the exempted employee of the employer. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Definitions
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: chairperson (主席) means the chairperson of the Authority;
deputy chairperson (副主席) means the deputy chairperson of the Authority;
director (董事) means a director of the Authority.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Periods for which directors may be appointed
section.content: Subject to this Schedule, a director holds office for such period (not exceeding 4 years) as is specified in the director’s document of appointment, but is eligible (if otherwise qualified) for re-appointment.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Terms and conditions of office of directors
section.content: A director is entitled to such terms and conditions of office (including remuneration and travelling and subsistence allowances) as the Chief Executive may, from time to time, determine in respect of the director.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Vacancy in office of director

subsection.leadIn: The office of a director becomes vacant if the director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: completes a term of office and is not re-appointed; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: becomes bankrupt, applies to take the benefit of any law for the relief of bankrupt or insolvent debtors, compounds with his or her creditors or makes an assignment of his or her remuneration for their benefit; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is, under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), found by the Court to be of unsound mind and incapable of managing himself or herself and his or her affairs; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is convicted in Hong Kong of an offence which is punishable by imprisonment for 12 months or more or is convicted elsewhere than in Hong Kong of an offence which, if committed in Hong Kong, would be an offence so punishable; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: resigns the office by written notice given to the Chief Executive; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: is removed from office by the Chief Executive under this section.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may remove a director from office at any time.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Filling of vacancy in office of director
section.content: If the office of a director becomes vacant, the Chief Executive must arrange for a suitable person to be appointed to fill the vacancy in accordance with this Ordinance as soon as practicable after the date on which the vacancy occurred.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Acting executive directors etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may, from time to time, appoint a person to act in the office of the Managing Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the illness or absence of the Managing Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during a vacancy in the office of Managing Director,

subsection.continued: and the person, while so acting, has all the functions of, and is taken to be, the Managing Director.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may, at any time, remove from office a person appointed under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may, from time to time, appoint a person to act in the office of an executive director (other than the Managing Director)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the illness or absence of the director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during a vacancy in the office of such a director,

subsection.continued: and the person, while so acting, has all the functions of, and is taken to be, an executive director.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, at any time, remove from office a person appointed under subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The deputy chairperson has the functions of the chairperson under sections 8 and 12 of this Schedule, and is taken to be the chairperson for the purposes of those section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the illness or absence of the chairperson; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during a vacancy in the office of chairperson.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Disclosure of pecuniary interests

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a director has a pecuniary interest in a matter that is considered or is to be considered at a meeting of the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interest appears to raise a conflict with the proper performance of the director’s duties in relation to the consideration of the matter,

subsection.continued: the director must, as soon as practicable after becoming aware of the relevant facts, disclose the nature of the interest at a meeting of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A disclosure by a director at a meeting of the Authority that the director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an officer or member, or is in the employment, of a specified company or other body; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a partner, or is in the employment, of a specified person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has some other specified interest relating to a specified company or other body or to a specified person,

subsection.continued: is a sufficient disclosure of the nature of the interest in any matter relating to that company or other body or to that person which may arise after the date of the disclosure and which is required to be disclosed under subsection (1).

subsection.content: Particulars of any disclosure made under this section must be recorded by the Authority in a book kept for the purpose and that book must be open at all reasonable hours to inspection by any person.

subsection.leadIn: After a director has disclosed the nature of any interest in any matter, the director must not, unless the Authority otherwise determines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during any deliberation of the Authority with respect to the matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in any decision of the Authority with respect to the matter.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the making of a determination by the Authority under subsection (4), a director who has a pecuniary interest in a matter to which the disclosure relates must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during any deliberation of the Authority for the purpose of making the determination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in the making by the Authority of the determination.

subsection.content: A contravention of this section does not invalidate a decision of the Authority.
This section does not apply to or in respect of an interest of a director in a matter or thing which arises merely because the director is a member of a registered scheme.

section.name: s8
section.heading: General procedure for meetings of Authority

subsection.content: Meetings are to be held as often as necessary to enable the Authority to exercise and perform its functions.
A meeting of the Authority may be convened by the chairperson.
The chairperson must convene a meeting of the Authority on being given a notice for that purpose by 2 or more other directors.
The procedure for the convening meetings of the Authority and for the conduct of business at those meetings is, subject to this Schedule, to be as determined by the Authority.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Quorum for meetings of Authority
section.content: The quorum for a meeting of the Authority is a majority of its directors, but at least 3 of the directors present must be non-executive directors.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Presiding director at meetings of Authority

subsection.leadIn: A meeting of the Authority is to be presided over by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of the chairperson, the deputy chairperson; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the absence of the chairperson and deputy chairperson, a director elected by the directors present at the meeting.

subsection.content: The director presiding at a meeting of the Authority has a deliberative vote and also has a casting vote if the numbers of votes for and against a motion are equal. However, that director must consult with the Financial Secretary before exercising a casting vote.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Voting at meetings of Authority
section.content: A decision supported by a majority of the votes cast at a meeting of the Authority at which a quorum is present is the decision of the Authority.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Transaction of business otherwise than at ordinary meetings

subsection.content: The business of the Authority may be transacted by the circulation of papers among all of the then existing directors.
Any of the directors may initiate a motion concerning Authority business by circulating a paper.

A motion under this section is to be approved by a simple majority of the directors unless within 3 working days of the date of the paper the chairperson orders, or any 2 other directors require under section 8(3) of this Schedule, that a meeting of the Authority to be convened to consider the motion.
Papers may be circulated among directors for the purposes of this section by facsimile message or other means of transmitting the information in the papers concerned.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: A delegation under section 6F—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be general or limited; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be in, or be evidenced by, writing signed by the Managing Director or by a person authorized by the Managing Director for that purpose; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may be revoked, wholly or partly, by the delegator.

section.name: s2
section.content: A delegated function may be exercised only in accordance with any conditions to which the delegation is subject.

section.name: s3
section.content: A delegate may, in the exercise of a function delegated under this section, exercise any other function that is incidental to the delegated function.

section.name: s4
section.content: A delegated function that purports to have been exercised by a delegate is, until the contrary is proved, taken to have been duly exercised by the delegate.

section.name: s5
section.content: A delegated function that is duly exercised by a delegate is taken to have been exercised by the delegator.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exercise of a function by a person or body is, by virtue of a document (including an Ordinance), dependent on the opinion, belief or state of mind of the person or body in relation to any matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or body has delegated the function to some other person or body,

section.continued: the function may be exercised by the delegate on the opinion, belief or state of mind of the delegate in relation to any such matter.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: If a function is delegated to a particular officer or the holder of a particular office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the delegation does not cease to have effect merely because the person who was the particular officer or the holder of the particular office when the function was delegated ceases to be that officer or the holder of that office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the function may be exercised (or, in the case of a duty, must be performed) by the person for the time being occupying or acting in the office concerned.

section.name: s8
section.content: A function that has been delegated may, despite the delegation, be exercised by the delegator.

section.name: s9
section.content: Section 6F and this Schedule applies to a sub-delegation of a function in the same way as it applies to a delegation of a function, but only in so far as this Ordinance or the document that authorizes the delegation of the function also authorizes the sub-delegation of the function.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Minimum Level of Relevant Income Per Contribution Period

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The minimum level of relevant income, in the case of a relevant employee (not being a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme), is— (Amended 18 of 2008 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the employee is remunerated on a monthly basis, $7,100 per month;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee is remunerated more frequently than on a monthly basis, $280 per day;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the employee is remunerated less frequently than on a monthly basis, $7,100 per month, that amount as prorated.

section.name: s2
section.content: The minimum level of relevant income is, in the case of a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme, $280 per day.

section.name: s3
section.content: The minimum level of relevant income is, in the case of a self-employed person, $7,100 per month or $85,200 per year.
section.sourceNote: (Schedule 2 replaced 29 of 2002 s. 12. Amended 18 of 2008 s. 13; L.N. 120 of 2011; L.N. 133 of 2013)

tr.td: Section 4 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Amendment of Schedule 2) Notice 2011 (L.N. 120 of 2011) for the application provision relating to the amendments made by section 3 of that Notice.

Section 4 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Amendment of Schedule 2) Notice 2013 (L.N. 133 of 2013) for the application provision relating to the amendments made by section 3 of that Notice.

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Maximum Level of Relevant Income Per Contribution Period

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The maximum level of relevant income, in the case of a relevant employee (not being a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme), is— (Amended 18 of 2008 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the employee is remunerated on a monthly basis, $30,000 per month;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee is remunerated more frequently than on a monthly basis, $1,000 per day;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the employee is remunerated less frequently than on a monthly basis, $30,000 per month, that amount as prorated.

section.name: s2
section.content: The maximum level of relevant income is, in the case of a casual employee who is a member of an industry scheme, $1,000 per day.

section.name: s3
section.content: The maximum level of relevant income is, in the case of a self-employed person, $30,000 per month or $360,000 per year.
section.sourceNote: (Schedule 3 replaced 29 of 2002 s. 12. Amended 18 of 2008 s. 14; L.N. 168 of 2011; L.N. 135 of 2013)

tr.td: Section 4 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Amendment of Schedule 3) Notice 2011 (L.N. 168 of 2011) for the application provision relating to the amendments made by section 3 of that Notice.

Section 4 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Amendment of Schedule 3) Notice 2013 (L.N. 135 of 2013) for the application provision relating to the amendments made by section 3 of that Notice.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Covenants to be Implied in Governing Rules

section.name: s0
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 24 of the Ordinance, the following covenants are implied in the governing rules of a registered scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the approved trustee will comply with those governing rules;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, in administering the scheme, the approved trustee will exercise the care, skill, diligence and prudence to be reasonably expected of a person who is administering a provident fund scheme and is familiar with the operation of provident fund schemes;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the approved trustee will use in the administration of the scheme all knowledge and skill that the trustee has, or ought reasonably to be expected to have, because of the trustee’s profession or business, in so far as that knowledge and skill is relevant to the operation of the scheme;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the approved trustee will act in the interests of scheme members and not in the trustee’s own interests;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that the approved trustee will ensure that the funds of the scheme are invested in different investments so as to minimize the risk of losses of those funds, unless in particular circumstances it is prudent not to do so. (Added 4 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Approved trustee to be given notice of inquiry
section.content: Not later than 7 days before holding an inquiry under section 33, the Authority must give the approved trustee concerned 7 days’ notice of the date on which, and the time and place at which, the inquiry is to begin.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Authority not bound by rules of evidence
section.content: At the inquiry, the Authority must comply with the rules of natural justice, but is not bound by the rules of, or the practice relating to, evidence and may inform itself on any matter as it thinks appropriate.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Representation at inquiry

subsection.leadIn: At the inquiry, the approved trustee concerned is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be represented by a person of the trustee’s choice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to adduce to the Authority evidence (either orally or in writing), and to address the Authority on matters, relevant to the determination of the inquiry.

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee’s representative is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be present, and to advise that trustee, throughout the inquiry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to address the Authority on that trustee’s behalf.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Authority to give decision in writing
section.content: At the conclusion of the inquiry, the Authority must give its decision in writing and must specify in the decision the grounds on which it is based. The Authority must ensure that a copy of the decision is given to the approved trustee concerned.

schedule.name: sch5B
schedule.heading: Transitional and Saving Provisions for Part 4A

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: List of Registered MPF Intermediaries (註冊強積金中介人名單) means the List of Registered MPF Intermediaries that, immediately before 1 November 2012, was kept by the Authority at its head office in Hong Kong;
List of Responsible Officers (負責人員名單) means the List of Responsible Officers that, immediately before 1 November 2012, was kept by the Authority at its head office in Hong Kong;
transitional period (過渡期) means the period of 2 years beginning on 1 November 2012.

subsection.content: An expression used in this Schedule, and defined or otherwise explained in Part 4A, has the same meaning as in that Part.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Type A qualifying capacity

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a person holds a Type A qualifying capacity if the person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: is an authorized long term insurance broker;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is licensed under section 116 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, or both, within the meaning of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a person ceases to hold the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(c) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for any authorized financial institution, the authorization is revoked under section 22 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an authorized financial institution that is registered under section 119 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) for Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity within the meaning of that Ordinance, the registration is revoked under section 196(1)(i)(A) of that Ordinance in relation to that regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for an authorized financial institution that is so registered for such Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the registration is revoked under that section 196(1)(i)(A) in relation to those regulated activities.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not limit the way in which a person ceases to hold any Type A qualifying capacity.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a person has a Type A qualifying capacity suspended if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(b) as an authorized long term insurance broker that is a member of a body of insurance brokers approved by the Insurance Authority under section 70 of the Insurance Companies Ordinance (Cap. 41), the membership is suspended;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(c)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for any authorized financial institution, the authorization is suspended under section 24(1) or 25(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: that is registered under section 119 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) for Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity within the meaning of that Ordinance, the registration is suspended under section 196(1)(i)(B) or 197(1) of that Ordinance, or is deemed to be suspended under section 197(4) of that Ordinance, in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: that is so registered for such Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the registration is suspended under that section 196(1)(i)(B) or 197(1), or is deemed to be suspended under that section 197(4), in relation to those regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the qualification mentioned in subsection (1)(d)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the licence is suspended under section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), or is deemed to be suspended under section 195(4) of that Ordinance, in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the licence is suspended under that section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1), or is deemed to be suspended under that section 195(4), in relation to those regulated activities.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Type B qualifying capacity

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a person holds a Type B qualifying capacity if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an appointed long term insurance agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is registered with the Insurance Agents Registration Board as a responsible officer of an appointed long term insurance agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: is registered with the Insurance Authority, the Insurance Agents Registration Board, or a relevant insurance broker body—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a technical representative of an appointed long term insurance agent; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a technical representative of an authorized long term insurance broker;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: is licensed under section 120 of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, or both, within the meaning of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is an officer or employee of a company authorized under section 8 of the Insurance Companies Ordinance (Cap. 41) to carry on long term business within the meaning of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: is an officer or employee of an authorized financial institution.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person ceases to hold the Type B qualifying capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(f) if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for an officer or employee who is an appointed long term insurance agent, the appointment as an agent is terminated under a code of practice approved by the Insurance Authority under section 67 of the Insurance Companies Ordinance (Cap. 41); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for an officer or employee who is registered with the Insurance Agents Registration Board as a responsible officer or technical representative of an appointed long term insurance agent, the registration is terminated under such a code of practice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person ceases to hold the Type B qualifying capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(g) if—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who is a relevant individual registered under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity within the meaning of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), all or any of the officer’s or employee’s relevant particulars are removed from the register under section 58A(1)(c) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who is a relevant individual so registered as engaged in respect of such Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, all or any of the officer’s or employee’s relevant particulars are removed from the register under that section 58A(1)(c) in relation to those regulated activities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for an officer or employee who, with the consent of the Monetary Authority under section 71C of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an executive officer of a registered institution appointed under section 71D of that Ordinance to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business conducted by the registered institution that constitutes Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity within the meaning of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), the consent is withdrawn under section 71C(4)(c) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: such an executive officer so appointed to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business that constitutes such Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the consent is withdrawn under that section 71C(4)(c) in relation to those regulated activities.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not limit the way in which a person ceases to hold any Type B qualifying capacity.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, a person has a Type B qualifying capacity suspended if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of the capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(a), the appointment as an agent is suspended under a code of practice approved by the Insurance Authority under section 67 of the Insurance Companies Ordinance (Cap. 41);

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(c)(ii) or (d) as a technical representative or chief executive of an authorized long term insurance broker that is a member of a body of insurance brokers approved by the Insurance Authority under section 70 of the Insurance Companies Ordinance (Cap. 41)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person is suspended from acting as such technical representative or chief executive; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(e)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity, the licence is suspended under section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), or is deemed to be suspended under section 195(4) of that Ordinance, in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: as a person licensed to carry on Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the licence is suspended under that section 194(1)(i)(B) or 195(1), or is deemed to be suspended under that section 195(4), in relation to those regulated activities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(f)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for an officer or employee who is an appointed long term insurance agent, the appointment as an agent is suspended under a code of practice approved by the Insurance Authority under section 67 of the Insurance Companies Ordinance (Cap. 41); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for an officer or employee who is registered with the Insurance Agents Registration Board as a responsible officer or technical representative of an appointed long term insurance agent, the registration is suspended under such a code of practice; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of the capacity mentioned in subsection (1)(g)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: who is a relevant individual registered under section 20 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) as engaged in respect of Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity within the meaning of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), all or any of the officer’s or employee’s relevant particulars are suspended from the register under section 58A(1)(d) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: who is a relevant individual so registered as engaged in respect of such Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, all or any of the officer’s or employee’s relevant particulars are suspended from the register under that section 58A(1)(d) in relation to those regulated activities; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for an officer or employee who, with the consent of the Monetary Authority under section 71C of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155), is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an executive officer of a registered institution appointed under section 71D of that Ordinance to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business conducted by the registered institution that constitutes Type 1 or Type 4 regulated activity within the meaning of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571), the consent is suspended under section 71C(4)(d) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) in relation to that regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: such an executive officer so appointed to be responsible for directly supervising the conduct of each business that constitutes such Type 1 and Type 4 regulated activities, the consent is suspended under that section 71C(4)(d) in relation to those regulated activities.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Transitional arrangements for corporate intermediaries with Type A qualifying capacity

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who, immediately before 1 November 2012—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was shown in the List of Registered MPF Intermediaries as a corporate intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was not an appointed long term insurance agent, or was both an appointed long term insurance agent and a holder of a Type A qualifying capacity.

subsection.content: The person is to be regarded as being registered on 1 November 2012 under section 34T(4) as a principal intermediary.
The registration as a principal intermediary by virtue of subsection (2) that subsists immediately before the occurrence of an event specified in subsection (4) ceases to subsist on that occurrence.

subsection.leadIn: The event is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Transitional arrangements for corporate intermediaries without Type A qualifying capacity

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who, immediately before 1 November 2012—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was shown in the List of Registered MPF Intermediaries as a corporate intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was an appointed long term insurance agent, but was not a holder of a Type A qualifying capacity.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the person is to be regarded as being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registered on 1 November 2012 under section 34U(4) as a subsidiary intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approved on 1 November 2012 under section 34V(4) as being attached to another person specified in the notice mentioned in subsection (5).

subsection.content: The registration as a subsidiary intermediary, or the approval of the attachment to that other person, by virtue of subsection (2) that subsists immediately before the occurrence of an event specified in subsection (4) ceases to subsist on that occurrence.

subsection.leadIn: The event is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the expiry of the transitional period.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply unless, before 1 November 2012, the Authority was given a notice in writing that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person mentioned in section 4(1) of this Schedule consented to the person to which this section applies being an intermediary for carrying on regulated activities for the person so mentioned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person so mentioned is specified in the notice.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Transitional arrangements for individual intermediaries

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who, immediately before 1 November 2012, was registered in the List of Registered MPF Intermediaries as an individual intermediary sponsored by another person.

subsection.leadIn: The person is to be regarded as being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registered on 1 November 2012 under section 34U(4) as a subsidiary intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approved on 1 November 2012 under section 34V(4) as being attached to that other person.

subsection.content: The registration as a subsidiary intermediary, or the approval of the attachment to that other person, by virtue of subsection (2) that subsists immediately before the occurrence of an event specified in subsection (4) ceases to subsist on that occurrence.

subsection.leadIn: The event is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Transitional arrangements for responsible officers

subsection.content: This section applies to an individual who, immediately before 1 November 2012, was shown in the List of Responsible Officers as being designated by a person specified in subsection (2) as a responsible officer of the person.

subsection.leadIn: That person is one who, immediately before 1 November 2012—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was shown in the List of Registered MPF Intermediaries as a corporate intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was not an appointed long term insurance agent, or was both an appointed long term insurance agent and a holder of a Type A qualifying capacity.

subsection.content: The individual is to be regarded as being approved on 1 November 2012 under section 34W(4) as being a responsible officer of the person.

The approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the person by virtue of subsection (3) that subsists immediately before the occurrence of an event specified in subsection (5) ceases to subsist on that occurrence.

subsection.leadIn: The event is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, during the transitional period, the person applies under section 34W(1) for approval of the individual as an officer with specified responsibilities in relation to the person, the application being granted or rejected; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Application to persons regarded as principal intermediary

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who, by virtue of section 4(2) of this Schedule, is regarded as being registered as a principal intermediary.
In its application to the person, Part 4A has effect subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5).
Section 34Z(4), (5) and (6) is to be replaced by the following—

subsection.leadIn: The following industry regulator is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.content: if the person holds the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(c) of Schedule 5B, the Monetary Authority; or
if the person holds the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(d) of Schedule 5B, the Securities and Futures Commission.

subsection.leadIn: If the person holds the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(c) of Schedule 5B, and the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(a) or (b) of Schedule 5B—

paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the Monetary Authority is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part; or

where the Authority is satisfied that the person carries on the majority of its business activities as the holder of the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(a) or (b) of Schedule 5B, the Insurance Authority is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: If the person holds the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(a) or (b) of Schedule 5B, and the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(d) of Schedule 5B—

paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the Insurance Authority is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part; or

where the Authority is satisfied that the person carries on the majority of its business activities as the holder of the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(d) of Schedule 5B, the Securities and Futures Commission is to be assigned as the regulator of the person for the purposes of this Part.”.

subsection.content: Section 34ZC is to be replaced by the following—
