section.heading: Principal intermediary ceasing to hold Type A qualifying capacity etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.content: a person is a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: ceases to hold the relevant Type A qualifying capacity; or
has the relevant Type A qualifying capacity suspended.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of the person as a principal intermediary—

paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b)(i), is revoked at the time the person ceases to hold the Type A qualifying capacity; or
in the case of subsection (1)(b)(ii), is suspended for the period during which that suspension is in force.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantTypeAQualifyingCapacity
def.leadIn: relevant Type A qualifying capacity (有關甲類合資格身分)—

paragraph.content: in relation to a person whose frontline regulator is the Insurance Authority, means the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(a) or (b) of Schedule 5B;
in relation to a person whose frontline regulator is the Monetary Authority, means the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(c) of Schedule 5B; or
in relation to a person whose frontline regulator is the Securities and Futures Commission, means the Type A qualifying capacity mentioned in section 2(1)(d) of Schedule 5B.”.

subsection.content: Section 34ZE(1)(c) is to be replaced by the following—

paragraph.leadIn: a principal intermediary—

subparagraph.content: acquires any qualification as a Type A regulatee;
ceases to hold any Type A qualifying capacity; or
has any Type A qualifying capacity suspended.”.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Application to persons regarded as subsidiary intermediary

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who, by virtue of section 5(2) or 6(2) of this Schedule, is regarded as being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registered as a subsidiary intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approved as being attached to another person who is regarded as being registered as a principal intermediary.

subsection.content: In its application to the person, Part 4A has effect subject to subsections (3) and (4).
Section 34ZF is to be replaced by the following—

section.heading: Subsidiary intermediary ceasing to hold Type B qualifying capacity etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies—

paragraph.content: if a person is a subsidiary intermediary attached to a principal intermediary; and

paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.content: ceases to hold the relevant Type B qualifying capacity; or
ceases to hold a Type B qualifying capacity (other than the relevant Type B qualifying capacity), and on the cessation no longer holds any Type B qualifying capacity; or
has the relevant Type B qualifying capacity suspended; or
has a Type B qualifying capacity (other than the relevant Type B qualifying capacity) suspended, and on the suspension no longer holds any Type B qualifying capacity that is not under suspension.

subsection.leadIn: The approval of the attachment of the person to the principal intermediary—

paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)(b)(i), is revoked at the time the person ceases to hold the relevant Type B qualifying capacity or the Type B qualifying capacity; or
in the case of subsection (1)(b)(ii), is suspended for the period during which that suspension is in force.

subsection.leadIn: Where the person is not approved as being attached to any principal intermediary after a revocation under subsection (2)(a), the registration of the person as a subsidiary intermediary is revoked if—

paragraph.content: no application has been made under section 34V(1) for approval of attachment of the person to a principal intermediary within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (2)(a) takes effect; or
such an application has been made within 90 days after the date on which the revocation under subsection (2)(a) takes effect, and the Authority has rejected the application.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelevantTypeBQualifyingCapacity
def.leadIn: relevant Type B qualifying capacity (有關乙類合資格身分)—

paragraph.content: in relation to a person whose frontline regulator is the Insurance Authority, means the Type B qualifying capacity mentioned in section 3(1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (f) of Schedule 5B;
in relation to a person whose frontline regulator is the Monetary Authority, means the Type B qualifying capacity mentioned in section 3(1)(g) of Schedule 5B; or
in relation to a person whose frontline regulator is the Securities and Futures Commission, means the Type B qualifying capacity mentioned in section 3(1)(e) of Schedule 5B.”.

subsection.content: Section 34ZI(1)(c) is to be replaced by the following—

paragraph.leadIn: a subsidiary intermediary—

subparagraph.content: acquires any qualification as a Type B regulatee;
ceases to hold any Type B qualifying capacity; or
has any Type B qualifying capacity suspended; or”.

schedule.name: sch7
schedule.heading: Age Specified for the Purposes of Section 15(2)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Effect of this Schedule

subsection.content: This Schedule has effect for the purpose of determining whether a person is the associate of another for the purposes of this Ordinance.
A person is an associate of another person for the purposes of this Ordinance only as provided by this Schedule.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Associates of companies
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, an associate of a company includes each of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an officer of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a close relative, partner or employee of an officer of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an associated company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an officer of an associated company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a close relative, partner or employee of an officer of an associated company.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Matters relating to voting shares

subsection.leadIn: If a reference in a provision of this Ordinance to an associate of another person relates to the extent of a power to exercise, or to control the exercise of, the voting power attached to voting shares of a company, the reference includes a person with whom the other person has, or proposes to enter into—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an agreement as a result of which one of those persons has or will have power (even if it is in any way qualified)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to exercise voting power attached to shares in the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to control, directly or indirectly, the exercise of that voting power; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to influence substantially the exercise of that voting power; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an agreement for the purpose of controlling or influencing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the composition of the company’s board; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the conduct of affairs of the company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an agreement under which one of those persons—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: will or may acquire; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: may be required by the other of those persons to acquire,

paragraph.continued: shares in the company in which the other has a relevant interest; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an agreement under which one of those persons may be required to dispose of shares in the company in accordance with the other’s directions,

subsection.continued: whatever other effect the agreement may have.

subsection.content: In relation to a matter concerning shares of a company, a person may be an associate of the company and the company may be an associate of a person.

section.name: s4
section.heading: References to associates

subsection.leadIn: A reference in this Ordinance to an associate of another person includes a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person in partnership with whom the other person carries on a business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to section 5(2) of this Schedule, a person who is a partner of the other person otherwise than by virtue of carrying on a business in partnership with the other person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a trustee of a trust in relation to which the other person benefits, or is capable of benefiting, otherwise than as a result of transactions entered into in the ordinary course of business in connection with the lending of money; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an officer of a company that carries on a business and of which the other person is also an officer; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to section 5(2) of this Schedule, an officer of a company that does not carry on a business and of which the other person is also an officer.

subsection.leadIn: A reference in this Ordinance to an associate of another person also includes a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person in concert with whom the other person is acting, or proposes to act; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person with whom the other person is, or proposes to become, an associate, whether formally or informally, in any other way,

subsection.continued: in respect of the matter to which the reference relates.

subsection.leadIn: If a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has entered, or proposes to enter, into a transaction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has done, or proposes to do, any act,

subsection.continued: in order to become associated with another person as mentioned in an applicable provision of this Schedule, the persons are taken to be associates of each other for the purposes of that provision.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Exclusions

subsection.leadIn: A person is not an associate of another person by virtue of section 3(1) or 4(2) or (3) of this Schedule only because of any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: one of the persons (a client) gives specific instructions to the other, whose ordinary business includes dealing in securities, to acquire shares on the client’s behalf in the ordinary course of that business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one of the persons has appointed the other (otherwise than for valuable consideration given by the other or by an associate of the other) to vote as a proxy or representative at a meeting of members, or of a class of members, of a company.

subsection.content: For the purposes of proceedings under this Ordinance in which it is alleged that a person was an associate of another because of section 4(1)(b) or (e) of this Schedule, the person is taken to have been an associate of the other in relation to a matter by virtue of that paragraph only if it is proved that the person knew, or ought to have known, at that time the material particulars of that matter. (Amended E.R. 4 of 2019)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Associates of composite persons
section.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a reference to an associate includes, in a case where 2 or more persons constitute the approved trustee of a registered scheme, a reference to an associate of any of those persons.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Terminology used in this Part

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, a reference to a power to vote in respect of a share is a reference to a power to exercise, or to control the exercise of, the right to vote attached to the share.
A reference in this Schedule to power to dispose of a share includes a reference to power to exercise control over the disposal of the share.

subsection.leadIn: A reference in this Schedule to power or control includes a reference to power or control that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is direct or indirect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is, or can be, exercised as a result of, by means of, in breach of, or by revocation of, a trust, agreement or practice, whether the trust, agreement or practice is enforceable or not.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a power to vote in respect of a share; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a power to dispose of a share,

subsection.continued: that is exercisable by 2 or more persons jointly is taken to be exercisable by any of those persons.

subsection.content: A reference in this Schedule to a controlling interest includes a reference to an interest that gives control.

section.name: s8
section.heading: When person has relevant interest in a share
section.leadIn: A person has a relevant interest in a share for the purposes of this Schedule if the person has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: power to vote in respect of a voting share in a company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: power to dispose of the share.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Control of company having power in relation to a share
section.leadIn: If a company has, or is by this Part taken to have, power to vote in respect of a share or power to dispose of a share, a person is to be regarded, for the purposes of this Schedule, as having in relation to the share the same power as the company has, or is taken to have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company is, or its directors are, accustomed or under an obligation, whether formal or informal, to act in accordance with the directions, instructions or wishes of the person in relation to the exercise of the power to vote in respect of the share; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person has a controlling interest in the company.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Control of relevant percentage of voting power in company having power in relation to a share
section.leadIn: If a company or an associate of a company has, or is by this Part (other than this section) taken to have, power to vote in respect of a share, or power to dispose of a share, a person is to be regarded, for the purposes of this Schedule, as having in relation to the share the same power as the company or associate has, or is taken to have, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an associate of the person has; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: associates of the person together have; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person and an associate or associates of the person together have,

section.continued: power to vote in respect of no less than 20 per cent of the voting shares in the company.

section.name: s11
section.heading: When person is taken to have relevant interest in shares
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: has a right enforceable against another person in relation to an issued share in which the other person has a relevant interest (whether the right is enforceable presently or in the future and whether or not on the fulfilment of a condition); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has an option granted by another person, or has granted to another person an option, with respect to an issued share in which the other person has a relevant interest; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on performance of the relevant agreement, enforcement of the right, or exercise of the option, the first-mentioned person would have a relevant interest in the share,

section.continued: the first-mentioned person is to be regarded, for the purposes of this Part, as having that relevant interest in the share.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Control of company having a relevant interest by virtue of section 11
section.leadIn: If a company is, because of section 11 of this Schedule, to be regarded as having a relevant interest in a share in another company, a person is taken, for the purposes of this Part, to have a relevant interest in the share if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the first-mentioned company is, or its directors are, accustomed or under an obligation, whether formal or informal, to act in accordance with the directions, instructions or wishes of the person in relation to the exercise of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a power to vote in respect of shares in the other company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a power to dispose of shares in the other company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has a controlling interest in the first-mentioned company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person has power to vote in respect of no less than 20 per cent of the voting shares in the first-mentioned company.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Matters not affecting application of this Part

subsection.leadIn: It is immaterial for the purposes of this Part whether or not power to vote in respect of a share, or power to dispose of a share—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is express or implied or formal or informal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is exercisable by a person alone or jointly with any other person or persons; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: cannot be related to a particular share; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is, or can be made, subject to restraint or restriction.

subsection.content: A relevant interest in a share is not to be disregarded only because of its remoteness or how it arose.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Exclusions: money lenders
section.leadIn: A relevant interest of a person in a share is to be disregarded for the purposes of this Schedule if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s ordinary business includes lending money; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has authority to exercise powers as the holder of the relevant interest only because of a security given for the purposes of a transaction entered into in the ordinary course of business in connection with lending money, other than a transaction entered into with an associate of the person.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Exclusions: certain trustees
section.leadIn: A relevant interest of a person in a share is to be disregarded for the purposes of this Schedule if the share is subject to a trust, the person has the relevant interest as a trustee of the trust and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a beneficiary under the trust is, by virtue of section 11 of this Schedule, regarded as having a relevant interest in the share because the beneficiary has a presently enforceable and unconditional right referred to in paragraph (b) of that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a bare trustee.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Exclusions: instructions to securities dealer to dispose of share
section.content: A relevant interest of a person in a share is to be disregarded for the purposes of this Schedule if the person’s ordinary business includes dealing in securities and the person has authority to exercise powers as the holder of the relevant interest only because of instructions given to the person, by or on behalf of another person, to dispose of the share on the other person’s behalf in the ordinary course of that business.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Exclusions: honorary proxies
section.content: A relevant interest of a person in a share is to be disregarded for the purposes of this Schedule if the person has it only because of having been appointed, otherwise than for valuable consideration given by the person or an associate of the person, to vote as a proxy or representative at a meeting of members, or of a class of members, of a company.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Effect of this Part
section.content: A person has a relevant interest in a share for the purposes of this Schedule only as provided by this Part.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Associated companies
section.leadIn: Companies are related to each other (and thus associates of each other) for the purposes of this Ordinance if one of the companies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has power to vote in respect of no less than 20 per cent of the voting shares of the other company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds no less than 20 per cent of the issued share capital of the other company; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a subsidiary of the other company; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is a subsidiary of a company that is an associate of the other company.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: higher risk assets (較高風險資產) means any assets identified as such in the guidelines for the purposes of this Schedule.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Constituent funds
section.leadIn: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must make available in the scheme the following constituent funds for investments under the default investment strategy of the scheme—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a constituent fund investing in a globally diversified manner that targets to invest 20% of the net asset value of the fund in higher risk assets, but the investment in those assets may vary from 15% to 25% of the net asset value of the fund at any point in time (Age 65 Plus Fund);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a constituent fund investing in a globally diversified manner that targets to invest 60% of the net asset value of the fund in higher risk assets, but the investment in those assets may vary from 55% to 65% of the net asset value of the fund at any point in time (Core Accumulation Fund).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Investment strategy for scheme members who are below 50 years of age
section.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must invest the accrued benefits of a scheme member who is below 50 years of age solely in the Core Accumulation Fund.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Investment strategy for scheme members who are 50 years of age or above but below 65 years of age

subsection.content: Subject to section 34DB(3), this section applies to a scheme member of a registered scheme who is 50 years of age or above, but below 65 years of age.

subsection.leadIn: The approved trustee of the scheme must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: invest the accrued benefits of the member in the Core Accumulation Fund and the Age 65 Plus Fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the member’s accrued benefits have been invested under section 3 of this Schedule but not yet invested under this section—

subparagraph.content: invest, within 60 days beginning on the member’s 50th birthday, a portion of the member’s investments in the Core Accumulation Fund in the Age 65 Plus Fund; and

ensure that immediately after the investment is made, the investments in the respective funds, each relative to the member’s total investments in both funds, are of the percentages set out in columns 2 and 3, opposite to the age of 50 in column 1, of the table in subsection (3) (Table);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the member’s accrued benefits have been invested under this section—

subparagraph.content: allocate, once in each year within 60 days beginning on the birthday of the member in that year, the member’s investments in the Core Accumulation Fund and the Age 65 Plus Fund respectively; and

ensure that immediately after the allocation, the investments in the respective funds, each relative to the member’s total investments in both funds, are of the percentages set out in columns 2 and 3, opposite to the member’s age in column 1, of the Table; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for accrued benefits in the member’s account in a particular year that have not been invested under this section, invest those benefits in the Core Accumulation Fund and the Age 65 Plus Fund according to the proportion expressed in the percentages set out in columns 2 and 3, opposite to the member’s age in column 1, of the Table.

subsection.leadIn: The table of percentages for the purposes of subsection (2) is as follows—

section.name: s5
section.heading: Investment strategy for scheme members who are 65 years of age or above
section.content: Subject to section 34DB(3), the approved trustee of a registered scheme must invest the accrued benefits of a scheme member who is 65 years of age or above solely in the Age 65 Plus Fund.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Investment strategy for scheme members whose age is uncertain
section.content: The approved trustee of a registered scheme must invest the accrued benefits of a scheme member solely in the Age 65 Plus Fund if the trustee is not aware of the age of the member.

schedule.name: sch11
schedule.heading: Percentage Specified for Purposes of Section 34DD(4)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The percentage for the purposes of section 34DD(4)(a) is a daily rate calculated by the following formula—

continued.content: Ais the number of days in the year.

section.name: s2
section.content: Subject to section 3, the percentage for the purposes of section 34DD(4)(b) is 0.2%.

section.name: s3
section.content: For a year that begins on or after the material day, the percentage for the purposes of section 34DD(4)(b) is 0.1%.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: DIS constituent fund (預設投資策略成分基金) has the meaning given by section 34DA;
inception date (成立日) has the meaning given by section 19T(1);
new constituent fund (新成分基金) has the meaning given by section 19T(1).

schedule.name: sch12
schedule.heading: Supplementary Functions of Electronic MPF System

schedule.name: sch13
schedule.heading: Fund Expense Ratio (FER) for Relevant Corresponding Period of Constituent Fund

section.name: s1
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Schedule applies to a constituent fund of a registered scheme and a prescribed period (as defined by section 19Y(3)) relating to the constituent fund.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: CIS means a specified CIS (as defined by section 34DD(5)) that is not an APIF;
relevant corresponding period (相關相應期間) has the meaning given by section 19Y(3).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Determination of FER for relevant corresponding period

subsection.leadIn: The FER for the relevant corresponding period of the constituent fund is to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determined by applying the formula specified in subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expressed as a percentage rounded off to 5 decimal places.

subsection.leadIn: The formula is—

td.p: the direct expense ratio of the constituent fund (expressed as a percentage);
the underlying fund cost ratio of the constituent fund (expressed as a percentage);
the reimbursement ratio of the constituent fund (expressed as a percentage);
the total number of days in the relevant corresponding period.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: reimbursement ratio (補還比率) means the ratio arrived at by dividing the aggregate of the reimbursement of the fees and expenses to the constituent fund by the average NAV (as defined by section 4(2) of this Schedule).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meaning of direct expense ratio in section 3(2) of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 3(2) of this Schedule—
subsection.def: direct expense ratio (直接開支比率) means the ratio arrived at by dividing the specified expenses by the average NAV.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of direct expense ratio in subsection (1)—
subsection.def: specified expenses (指明開支) means the amount arrived at by—(a)deducting the amount of the excluded expenses that is attributable to the constituent fund for the relevant corresponding period from the amount of the expenses set out in the relevant financial statements of the registered scheme that is attributable to the constituent fund for that period; and(b)adding the amount of the adjusted unit expenses (if any) that is attributable to the constituent fund for the relevant corresponding period.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of specified expenses in subsection (2)—
subsection.def: adjusted unit expenses (經調整單位開支) means an amount equal to the aggregate of the total value of the units of the constituent fund that are deducted from the accounts of each scheme member for the corresponding period concerned for payment of—(a)annual fees; or(b)fees or charges that would have been treated as expenses if they were directly deducted from the constituent fund;

excluded expenses (豁除開支) means the sum of any amount that is set out in the relevant financial statements of the registered scheme as an expense for the corresponding period concerned and that relates to—(a)any transaction costs;(b)any foreign exchange losses;(c)any withholding taxes;(d)any adjustments made for different basis when ascertaining the net asset value of the constituent fund; or(e)any distributions made by the constituent fund.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Meaning of underlying fund cost ratio in section 3(2) of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 3(2) of this Schedule—
subsection.def: underlying fund cost ratio (基礎基金成本比率) means the aggregate of the following—(a)the sum of the product of C and E for each APIF in which any assets of the constituent fund are invested during the relevant corresponding period; and(b)the sum of the product of C and E for each CIS in which any assets of the constituent fund are invested during the relevant corresponding period.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of underlying fund cost ratio in subsection (1)—
subsection.def: C—(a)in relation to an APIF, means the average percentage of the constituent fund’s investments in the APIF over the relevant corresponding period; and(b)in relation to a CIS, means the average percentage of the constituent fund’s investments in the CIS over the relevant corresponding period;

E—(a)in relation to an APIF, means the FER for the most recent financial period of the APIF that ends not later than the last day of the relevant corresponding period; and(b)in relation to a CIS, means—(i)the expense ratio of the CIS that is most recently available; or(ii)if subparagraph (i) is not applicable—a reasonable estimate of the expense ratio of the CIS.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the average percentage of a constituent fund’s investment in an APIF is the percentage obtained by dividing the sum of each specified percentage by the total number of the applicable pricing points; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the average percentage of a constituent fund’s investment in a CIS is the percentage obtained by dividing the sum of each specified percentage by the total number of the applicable pricing points.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: specified percentage (指明百分比)—(a)in relation to an APIF, means the percentage obtained by dividing the value of the investments of the constituent fund in the APIF as at an applicable pricing point by the net asset value of the constituent fund as at that pricing point; and(b)in relation to a CIS, means the percentage obtained by dividing the value of the investments of the constituent fund in the CIS as at an applicable pricing point by the net asset value of the constituent fund as at that pricing point.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Meaning of applicable pricing point in sections 4(2) and 5(3) and (4) of this Schedule
section.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 4(2) and 5(3) and (4) of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a pricing point is a point in time at which the net asset value of the constituent fund is determined; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: applicable pricing points are pricing points—

subparagraph.content: that are adopted by the approved trustees for the purpose of determining the FER for the relevant corresponding period; and
that are evenly distributed throughout the period at intervals of not more than one month.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Determination of FER for financial period of APIF

subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of E in section 5(2) of this Schedule, the FER for the most recent financial period of an APIF that ends not later than the last day of the relevant corresponding period is to be determined in accordance with sections 3, 4, 5 and 6 of this Schedule (relevant provisions).

subsection.leadIn: In applying the relevant provisions for the purposes mentioned in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (c)(i) and (h), a reference in a relevant provision to the corresponding period concerned, the relevant corresponding period, or the relevant corresponding period of the constituent fund, is a reference to the most recent financial period of Fund A that ends not later than the last day of the relevant corresponding period;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the expression conversion factor in section 3 of this Schedule—

subparagraph.content: if the most recent financial period of Fund A that ends not later than the last day of the relevant corresponding period covers 29 February, means 366; and
in any other case, means 365;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a reference in the definition of specified expenses in section 4(2) of this Schedule to the relevant financial statements of the registered scheme is a reference to the relevant financial statements;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a reference in the definition of adjusted unit expenses in section 4(3) of this Schedule to each scheme member is a reference to the constituent fund the assets of which are invested in Fund A;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a reference in the definition of excluded expenses in section 4(3) of this Schedule to the relevant financial statements of the registered scheme is a reference to the relevant financial statements;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: a reference in section 5(2) of this Schedule to the most recent financial period of the APIF that ends not later than the last day of the relevant corresponding period is a reference to the most recent financial period of the invested APIF that ends not later than the last day of the most recent financial period of Fund A; and

paragraph.leadIn: a reference in section 6(b) of this Schedule to the approved trustee is to be construed as—

subparagraph.content: if Fund A is an insurance policy—the insurer of the insurance policy;
if Fund A is a mutual fund—the management company of the mutual fund; and
if Fund A is a unit trust—the trustee of the unit trust.

subsection.content: Subsections (4) and (5) apply to an APIF (Fund B) in which any assets of another APIF (investing APIF) are invested.

For the purpose of determining the FER for the most recent financial period of Fund B that ends not later than the last day of the most recent financial period of the investing APIF, subsection (2)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h) and (i) (modification provisions) and the relevant provisions apply as if Fund B were Fund A.

subsection.leadIn: In applying the modification provisions for the purpose mentioned in subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference in subsection (2)(b) to the most recent financial period of Fund A that ends not later than the last day of the relevant corresponding period is a reference to the most recent financial period of Fund B that ends not later than the last day of the most recent financial period of the investing APIF;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference in subsection (2)(c)(i) to the most recent financial period of Fund A that ends not later than the last day of the relevant corresponding period is a reference to the most recent financial period of Fund B that ends not later than the last day of the most recent financial period of the investing APIF; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference in subsection (2)(e) to the constituent fund the assets of which are invested in Fund A is a reference to the investing APIF the assets of which are invested in Fund B.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Constituent Fund to which Section 19W(2) Applies

section.name: s1
section.heading: Application of Part 1 of this Schedule
section.content: This Part applies for the purposes of section 19X(2).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Relevant rate of administration fee

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the relevant rate of administration fee for a constituent fund of a registered scheme to which section 19W(2) applies is the annual rate of the administration fee (or equivalent) of the constituent fund (annual rate)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is stated, and expressed as a percentage of the net asset value of the constituent fund, in the offering document of the registered scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is applicable to the fund as at 31 December 2020.

subsection.content: If, in relation to a constituent fund of a registered scheme, the annual rate is expressed in the form of a range of percentage of the net asset value of the constituent fund, the relevant rate of administration fee for the constituent fund is to be the highest rate in the range.
The relevant rate of administration fee for a constituent fund of a registered scheme is to be rounded off to 5 decimal places.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Constituent Fund to which Section 19W(3) Applies

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of Part 2 of this Schedule
section.content: This Part applies for the purposes of section 19X(3).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Relevant rate of administration fee

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the relevant rate of administration fee for a constituent fund of a registered scheme to which section 19W(3) applies is the rate calculated in accordance with the following formula—

td.p: the total number of days in the relevant period.

subsection.content: If, in relation to a constituent fund of a registered scheme, the prevailing rate of administration fee is expressed in the form of a range of percentage of the net asset value of the constituent fund, the relevant rate of administration fee for the constituent fund is to be the highest rate in the range.
The relevant rate of administration fee for a constituent fund of a registered scheme is to be rounded off to 5 decimal places.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prevailing rate of administration fee (現時行政費率), in relation to a constituent fund of a registered scheme, means the annual rate of the administration fee (or equivalent) of the constituent fund—(a)that is stated, and expressed as a percentage of the net asset value of the constituent fund, in the offering document of the registered scheme; and(b)that is applicable to the fund on a particular day;
relevant period (相關期間), in relation to a constituent fund of a registered scheme to which section 19W(3) applies, means the corresponding period of the constituent fund mentioned in that section.

section.name: s1
section.content: This Schedule applies for the purposes of section 19Z.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 3 and 4 of this Schedule, the percentage permitted for the relevant corresponding period is the ratio calculated in accordance with Formula 1—
A – (B – C)

td.p: the reference ratio for the constituent fund;
the reference rate for the constituent fund;

the average level of the fee payable by the approved trustee of the registered scheme to the system operator of the electronic MPF system for the relevant corresponding period, which is calculated in accordance with Formula 2 and expressed as a percentage rounded off to 5 decimal places—

the annual rate of the fee (expressed as a percentage of the net asset value of the constituent fund) charged by the system operator of the electronic MPF system, in relation to the use of the electronic MPF system and provision of scheme administration services, that is applicable to the constituent fund on a particular day in the relevant corresponding period of the fund;
the total number of days in the relevant corresponding period of the constituent fund.

section.name: s3
section.content: The ratio calculated under section 2 of this Schedule is to be expressed as a percentage rounded off to 5 decimal places.

section.name: s4
section.content: If, in relation to a constituent fund of a registered scheme, B is less than or equal to C, the percentage permitted for the relevant corresponding period is A.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: relevant corresponding period (相關相應期間) has the meaning given by section 19Z(4).

schedule.name: sch16
schedule.heading: Calculation of Amount for Purposes of Section 19ZA(2)

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 19ZA(2), the amount is to be calculated in accordance with the following formula—

td.p: the FER for the relevant corresponding period;
the total number of days in the relevant corresponding period;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the financial period of the registered scheme relating to the relevant corresponding period covers 29 February—366; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—365.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: relevant corresponding period (相關相應期間) has the meaning given by section 19Z(4).

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: effective day (規定生效日), in relation to a pre-existing scheme, means the day specified under section 19N(1) for the scheme;
General Regulation (《一般規例》) means the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes (General) Regulation (Cap. 485 sub. leg. A);
relevant requirement (相關規定) has the meaning given by section 19O(2).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to approved trustee’s duties with regard to contributions received from Authority—section 7AD

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 14 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 7AD as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 7AD) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a contribution paid under section 7AC to the trustee if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the contribution was paid before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(2) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, items 1C and 1D of Schedule 4 to the General Regulation as in force immediately before the commencement date apply to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 7AD applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to recovery of arrears and contribution surcharges—section 18

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 15(2) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 18(6) as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a payment made under section 18(5) to the trustee if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the payment was made before the effective day.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to Authority’s power to pay special contributions into accounts of scheme members—section 19B

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 16 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 19B as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 19B) applies to the payment of a special contribution by the Authority to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the payment was made by the Authority before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(4) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 2C of Schedule 4 to the General Regulation as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 19B applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to Authority’s power to require information or documents necessary for paying special contributions—section 19C

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 17 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 19C as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 19C) applies to a pre-existing scheme in relation to the payment of a contribution (referred to as a special contribution in Part 3A) by the Authority if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme and—

subparagraph.content: the relevant requirement has not taken effect; or
the requirement under subsection (1)(a) of the pre-amended section 19C was made, in relation to the scheme, before the effective day.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to Authority’s power to recover special contributions that should not have been paid—section 19E

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 18 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 19E as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 19E) applies to a pre-existing scheme in relation to a contribution (referred to as a special contribution in Part 3A) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the special contribution has been paid into the account of a member of the scheme before the effective day.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(4) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 2G of Schedule 4 to the General Regulation as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 19E applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Transitional arrangements relating to transfer of accrued benefits to account within same registered scheme—section 34DC

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 25 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 34DC as in force immediately before the commencement date (pre-amended section 34DC) applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant requirement has taken effect.

subsection.content: Despite the commencement of section 102(6) of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance, item 4G of Schedule 4 to the General Regulation as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of the pre-existing scheme, to the extent that the pre-amended section 34DC applies to the approved trustee because of subsection (1).
Because of subsection (1), sections 20B, 30 and 33 as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the pre-existing scheme, in so far as they relate to the pre-amended section 34DC.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Transitional arrangement relating to payment from Authority under section 43BA(6)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the commencement of section 40 of the 2021 Amendment Ordinance (amendment provision), section 43BA(7) and (8) as in force immediately before the commencement date applies to the approved trustee of a pre-existing scheme in relation to a contribution or surcharge paid under section 43BA(6) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is no section 19N notice in respect of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a section 19N notice in respect of the scheme, and the contribution or surcharge was paid before the effective day.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the amendment provision comes into operation.
